column12: Astronaut in-cabin operation and display control system for space double-arm on-orbit operation
column13: The invention relates to an astronaut in-cabin operation and display control system for space double-arm on-orbit operation, and belongs to the technical field of space double-arm on-orbit operation. Comprising a multi-mode operation control module, a dynamic information management module and a real-time simulation and display module, the mode operation control module comprises a working mode selection module, a ground operation management module, an autonomous task management module and a man-machine interaction operation module; the dynamic information management module comprises a mechanical arm dynamic bus information management module and a mechanical arm information processing module; the real-time simulation and display module comprises a mechanical arm simulation training module and a mechanical arm motion parameter and image display module; the man-machine interaction operation module comprises a panel operation module, a rotating handle operation module and a translation handle operation module; through dynamic information flow management, autonomous task management and multi-data-source fusion man-machine interaction design, multi-point access management of the space double mechanical arms is achieved, and multi-mode operation of the space mechanical arms is completed in a cabin for astronauts.
column15: HU YUXI;;WU ZHIHONG;;NIU JIAXIANG;;ZHANG SIBO;;YU SHENG;;LI DELUN;;ZHOU YONGHUI;;XU ZHE;;ZHU CHAO;;LI WANLING;;ZHOU YIDING;;GAO SHENG;;TANG ZIXIN

column12: System and method for flexible reuse of web page based on low-code development platform
column13: The invention discloses a system and method for flexible reuse of a web page based on a low-code development platform, and belongs to the technical field of program development, the method comprises the following steps: S1, establishing the web page through a visual design end, and storing page metadata of the web page to a server; s2, acquiring page metadata of the server side through the deployment side to obtain a page view; s3, triggering a component binding event according to page view multiplexing required by a user to obtain an event script instance; and S4, performing data interaction between page views according to event script instance calling. According to the method, original static metadata has the characteristic of dynamic use, basic support is provided for multiplexing rendering and event isolation operation of all components in the page in combination with the generated page metadata instance and an API calling method, and flexible multiplexing interaction of the web page can be achieved in a low-code development platform.

column12: Clothing sharp collar separate design original data tailoring method
column13: The invention discloses a clothing sharp collar separate design original data tailoring method, which is characterized by determining related clothing specification original data such as collar length, collar middle width and the like according to clothing styles, and obtaining the ease amount of a sharp collar through a new technology of separately designing collars and controlling collar key elements according to the length of a collar piece. The problems that in the prior art, a longer time is consumed, the collar length cannot be calculated, the requirements of the garment market for the precision and speed of garment style change cannot be met, and garment comfort is poor are solved, and the original data design tailoring method which is precise, simple, fast and good in garment comfort is achieved.

column12: IMES aided design platform of airborne product matching test equipment
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of computer aided design, and relates to an iMES aided design platform of airborne product matching test equipment, which is used for intelligent design, manufacturing and delivery aided design execution of the airborne product matching test equipment iMES, and comprises three first-level modules of a homepage, a data management module and a personal center, and a plurality of second-level modules, according to the invention, the project management process is more standardized; all major dangerous operations in the project process have operation log records; a scheme designer can carry out visual design on a project structure; operation can be carried out in the same table in the wiring table design process, and important information concerned by designers is always locked in a visible range; document management is more standardized; after the design is completed, a BOM list can be formed; a test report formed after processing is generated; the project period is visualized; and the working efficiency is improved.
column14: AVIC STAR XIAN INTELLIGENT SYSTEM CO LTD
column15: SUN RUI;;ZHAO KAIRUI;;WANG JIAHUAN;;ZHANG YUDI;;WANG ZHAOKE

column12: Multi-PCE path calculation interaction method and system
column13: The invention discloses a multi-PCE path calculation interaction method and system, and the method comprises the steps: configuring a PCC to establish an independent connection channel with at least one sub-PCE, and enabling the PCC to complete the session establishment with each child PCE; configuring each child PCE to establish an independent connection channel with a parent PCE, and enabling each child PCE to complete session establishment with the parent PCE; enabling each child PCE to announce the operation state, and to announce the operation state again when the state changes; when a PCC generates a path calculation request, selecting an appropriate connection channel according to a preset PCE election strategy in the PCC; or, when the PCE generates a path establishment request, selecting an appropriate connection channel according to a request distribution strategy preset in the parent PCE. According to the invention, an interaction process between one PCC and a plurality of PCEs is provided, consistency of LSP-DB data synchronization between the PCEs is maintained in real time, networking deployment and interaction design of SDN intelligent calculation paths are enriched and perfected, concurrent calculation paths and construction paths are provided, load capacity of the PCEs is balanced, and consistency and timeliness of LSP-DB data synchronization between the PCEs are ensured.

column12: Gearbox load determination method for reliability analysis
column13: The invention discloses a gearbox load determination method for reliability analysis, and relates to the technical field of gearboxes, the method comprises the following steps: designing a driving working condition and a gear shifting rule, inputting the driving working condition, the gear shifting rule and vehicle data into a visual simulation tool for simulation calculation, screening the data of the simulation calculation to combine a target gear, and determining the reliability of the gearbox. And finally, simulation is conducted again through the visual simulation tool to obtain the gearbox load distribution of the target gear. The method comprises the steps of S1 simulation data design, S2 simulation data calculation and screening and S3 gearbox load simulation calculation. According to the method, a dynamical model is established, simulation motion is carried out through a Simulink simulation tool, target gears are screened out in combination with engine parameters, the target gears are combined at the same time, simulation is carried out through the Simulink simulation tool again, and the gearbox load distribution result of the target gears is obtained; by means of the method, transmission load distribution of different target gear combinations under the multi-working-condition operation condition can be analyzed.
column14: XUZHOU XCMG DRIVETRAIN CO LTD;;UNIV CHONGQING
column15: HU JIANJUN;;LIU RENPING;;XUE SHOUZHI;;LYU CHANG;;SUN DANDAN;;QIN DATONG

column12: DATA PROCESSING SYSTEMS
column13: In a data processing system, when displaying frames to a user on a display, the location of the user's gaze on the display is determined, and the amount of light to be output for different regions of the display when displaying the frame on the display is selected and set based on the determined location of the user's gaze on the display.

column12: Officially authorized virtual identification cards
column13: A system that allows users to display valid identification via a mobile device. Authentic and valid IDs and secure folders are verified by a certificate authority. Statistical techniques are applied to automatically determine the consistency and reliability of user data. Context is automatically determined to display data according to the context.

column12: Test case generation method and device, electronic equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention discloses a test case generation method and device, electronic equipment and a storage medium. The method comprises the steps of obtaining production operation and maintenance data corresponding to a to-be-tested application, and determining at least one to-be-used test case corresponding to the to-be-tested application; determining a to-be-used test equivalence class set corresponding to the current test input item based on the to-be-processed test equivalence class set of the current test input item and the used equivalence class set of the target configuration input item matched with the current test input item; based on the to-be-used test equivalence class set and the to-be-processed test equivalence class set corresponding to the corresponding test input item, obtaining a target test equivalence class set corresponding to the test input item; and obtaining a target test case based on the target test equivalent class set of each test input item corresponding to the to-be-used test case. The problems of incomplete test and poor test effect caused by determining the test item based on the risk in the prior art are solved, the comprehensiveness of the test is improved, and the effect of improving the test effect is achieved.

column12: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR DETERMINING OPTIMAL OPERATION PATH, AND STORAGE MEDIUM
column13: The present invention provides a method and device for determining an optimal operation path, and a storage medium. The method includes: determining (S11) a model operation topology graph including a plurality of operation nodes according to a neural network model; selecting (S12) a plurality of operators with a same operation type as the operation node for each operation node in the model operation topology graph, and creating a corresponding operator node for each operator; according to a connection relationship between the operation nodes in the model operation topology graph, constructing (S13) an operator topology graph based on the created operator nodes; determining (S14) an operation index of each of the operator nodes, and weighting the operator topology graph based on the operation index of each operator node to obtain a weighted operator topology graph; and selecting (S15) an optimal operation path in the weighted operator topology graph.
column14: BEIJING XIAOMI PINECONE ELECTRONICS CO LTD

column12: Simulation data generation method and device, computer equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention relates to an analog data generation method and device, computer equipment and a storage medium. The method comprises the following steps: receiving user input through a user interface, wherein the user input comprises a data type parameter, a numerical parameter, an occurrence time parameter and a target interface parameter of to-be-generated data; searching a pre-stored data template file corresponding to the data type parameter; generating a data packet queue based on the numerical parameters by using the data template file; and sending each data packet in the data packet queue to a target interface corresponding to the target interface parameter according to a sending moment specified by the occurrence time parameter. By adopting the method, the cost of a test system can be reduced, and the flexibility of usable test data is improved.
column14: BLACK SESAME INTELLIGENT TECH SHANGHAI CO LTD

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR PROACTIVELY AND REMOTELY DIAGNOSING AN HVAC SYSTEM
column13: Systems and methods are disclosed for providing remote and proactive diagnostics of HVAC equipment or an HVAC system. Accordingly, the disclosed embodiments provide the ability to remotely measure e.g., electrical health, run state, superheat, subcooling and/or other conditions of an HVAC unit for the purposes of assessing the health and efficiency of an HVAC system. The disclosed embodiments will collect critical system data using a series of unit connected sensors and use test/evaluation calculations based on the input sensor information for making evaluations of system performance. Wireless technology (e.g., cellular communications, WLAN, Wi-Fi, etc.) is used to transmit pertinent information to a data collection server for deeper analysis, monitoring, alerting and tracking.
column15: RUPP STEVEN;;NAHMAD AARON J;;CRUZ MARIO A

column12: METHOD FOR RATING A SOFTWARE COMPONENT OF AN SIL ENVIRONMENT
column13: A method for rating a software component of a software-in-the-loop (SiL) environment, a target hardware including at least one target hardware component being simulated by an SiL environment including at least one corresponding software component, both the target hardware and the SiL environment being subjected to a test situation, while the target hardware and the SiL environment are being subjected to the test situation, output data being generated in each case by both the target hardware and the SiL environment and the output data of the target hardware being compared to the outputs of the SiL environment, the software component being rated on the basis of the comparison.

column12: AIS-based LNG ship transport capacity tracking method and system
column13: The invention provides an AIS-based LNG ship transport capacity tracking method and system, and the method comprises the steps: firstly collecting ship AIS data, LNG port data and LNG berth data, calculating voyage number dynamic data according to the AIS data, judging whether the voyage number is a wrong voyage number, and judging an LNG port, extracting a plurality of low-speed stable voyage segments by a self-adaptive constant fitting algorithm, calculating the missing port and missing berths and according to the calculated missing ports and missing berths, complementing missing voyage numbers to finally form complemented voyage numbers. The invention calculates and obtains ship voyage dynamic data based on the AIS data design algorithm, and is combined with business logic, complements and corrects the missing voyage numbers of LNG ships. Complete LNG voyage number information is obtained, and the loading and unloading actions of the voyage numbers and the loading and unloading properties of a port are corrected.

column12: BIOMARKERS FOR SEVERE PULMONARY CONDITION
column13: The present disclosure is related to biomarkers for predicting severe pulmonary conditions. In particular, it provides a novel in vitro method for assessing the severity of a pulmonary condition of a subject using lipid biomarkers. In addition, the present biomarkers can be used in methods for predicting the progress of a pulmonary condition, selecting an appropriate treatment and preventing the occurrence of serious complications of a pulmonary condition.
column32: RAVIPATI SRINIVASARAO ET AL: "Plasma lipid biomarker signatures in squamous carcinoma and adenocarcinoma lung cancer patients", METABOLOMICS, SPRINGER US, NEW YORK, vol. 11, no. 6, 26 May 2015 (2015-05-26), pages 1600 - 1611, XP036276542, ISSN: 1573-3882, [retrieved on 20150526], DOI: 10.1007/S11306-015-0811-X;;EKROOS KIM ET AL: "Plasma lipid biomarker signatures in squamous carcinoma and adenocarcinoma lung cancer patients", PROGRESS IN LIPID RESEARCH., vol. 78, 1 April 2020 (2020-04-01), FR, pages 101030, XP055836932, ISSN: 0163-7827, DOI: 10.1016/j.plipres.2020.101030;;LAVRYNENKO OKSANA ET AL: "Ceramide ratios are affected by cigarette smoke but not heat-not-burn or e-vapor aerosols across four independent mouse studies", LIFE SCIENCE, PERGAMON PRESS, OXFORD, GB, vol. 263, 12 November 2020 (2020-11-12), XP086389316, ISSN: 0024-3205, [retrieved on 20201112], DOI: 10.1016/J.LFS.2020.118753;;CATERINO MARIANNA ET AL: "Dysregulation of lipid metabolism and pathological inflammation in patients with COVID-19", SCIENTIFIC REPORTS, vol. 11, no. 1, 3 February 2021 (2021-02-03), XP055887862, Retrieved from the Internet <URL:http://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-021-82426-7> DOI: 10.1038/s41598-021-82426-7;;KHODADOUST MEHRAN M.: "Inferring a causal relationship between ceramide levels and COVID-19 respiratory distress", SCIENTIFIC REPORTS, vol. 11, no. 1, 21 October 2021 (2021-10-21), XP055887739, Retrieved from the Internet <URL:https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-021-00286-7> DOI: 10.1038/s41598-021-00286-7

column12: High-reliability telemetering link ignition control method for space-time interaction of multiple aircrafts
column13: A high-reliability telemetering link ignition control method for space-time interaction of multiple aircrafts comprises the following steps that 1, the remaining flight time of a test aircraft is calculated in real time, an ignition control instruction is generated, and the ignition control instruction is placed in a telemetering frame, transmitting to an S-band telemetering detection station arranged at a ground target aircraft through a telemetering link of the test aircraft; 2, the S-band telemetering detection station analyzes telemetering data in real time and transmits analyzed telemetering frames to telemetering ignition control software periodically through a network interface; 3, starting internal timing by telemetering ignition control software; and 4, performing ignition control by telemetering ignition control software. The method can be applied to the condition of information collaborative matching among multiple aircrafts, and an implementation way is provided for more complex ignition time sequence control; and meanwhile, a multi-stage criterion collaborative interaction design is adopted, so that the reliability of ignition control under complex space-time matching is improved.
column14: BEIJING LINJIN SPACE AIRCRAFT SYSTEM ENG INST
column15: PAN YU;;XU GANGFENG;;WANG KANG;;WANG JIANHONG;;LI SHAOGUANG;;ZHANG XUE;;WANG LIN;;ZHANG JINGYING;;PENG XIAO;;TANG MAO;;LIU JIANYAN;;LI HAO;;LI JINLEI;;WU CHUNFEI;;FAN QILIN;;LI HONGYANG;;GU TIANQI;;WANG LI;;LI MENGMENG;;PAN MINGJIAN

column12: DNN CONTRACTION DEVICE AND ONBOARD COMPUTATION DEVICE
column13: A DNN contraction device (100) outputs a reduced DNN to a DNN computation unit (300) that performs a DNN computation using an internal memory. The DNN contraction device (100) includes an output data size measurement unit (110) and a data contraction unit (120). The output data size measurement unit (110) measures the output data size in the DNN layer from the DNN network information. The data contraction unit (120) sets a contraction number of the DNN layer based on the output data size and the memory size of the internal memory.

column12: Risk-based software validation and change control
column13: Embodiments are directed to performing risk-based software validation and to applying change control when upgrading a software application. In one scenario, a computer system calculates a risk score for features in a software application. This risk score indicates a relative level of risk for installing and using the software application. The computer system performs internal usage testing to determine how the software application is recommended for use, and conducts use tests to determine how a specified client uses the features of the software application as compared to the determined recommended use. Then, based on the calculated risk and the determined use of the features, the computer system provides a recommendation for the specified client indicating which portions of the software application are to undergo client-specific validation. In another scenario, a computer system applies change control when upgrading a software application from a first version to a second version.
column15: WRIGHT ERIN MARIE;;CRAMER DEREK EDWARD;;THOMAS ROBERT EDWARD;;MILITO CHAD;;HOLBROOK TERRANCE;;BUTLER ALEXANDER JAMES

column12: HYBRID PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT USABILITY TESTS
column13: The present invention relates to an improved method and system for performing a plurality of usability tests for software development life cycle (SDLC) in various stages of completion. The method preferably comprises the steps of establishing one or more test attributes implying resources consumed by the plurality of usability tests (101); developing a mathematical function based on the one or more test attributes (102); defining performance metrics indicative of status of the product development (103); assigning a metric point and an integer weight to each of the performance metrics (104); computing a score mark for each of the performance metrics by multiplying the metric point by a ratio of the integer weight to a total integer weight (105); and evaluating the mathematical function by inputting a total score mark thereto (106) to generate a usability test result (107). The system comprises a function derivation module (200), a data performance module (201), a computation module (202) and a monitoring module with display (203).
column15: CHUA NGIP KHEAN;;ASHOK SIVAJI;;MOHAMED REDZUAN ABDULLAH;;SOO SHI TZUAAN;;ZULKIFLE MOHD NOR

column12: Vibration sounder with size and shape of diaphragm plate adjustable
column13: The invention discloses a structural composition, a working principle and a using method of a vibrating sounder with a diaphragm plate adjustable in size and shape. The vibration sounder designed and manufactured by the scheme can respectively control the inner and outer ring diaphragm plates to work according to the needs of sound field simulation, thereby achieving the purpose of changing the size and shape of the vibration diaphragm plate, expanding the frequency coverage range of the sound field of the sound source, enriching the sound field characteristics of the sound source, and improving the sound field simulation capability of the sound field to different objects.
column15: YU JING;;LI ZHIYUAN;;ZHANG WEI;;WANG SIWEI;;WU MENG;;ZHAO ZHIPING

column12: Fan blade detection device
column13: According to the fan blade detection device, through information interaction design of the industrial personal computer and the infrared imaging processing system, controllability of the experimentalprocess is high, the infrared thermal imager and the light source are matched through combined action of the infrared imaging system, the signal generator and the amplifying device, real-time data ofthe fan blade can be obtained, and real-time performance of the fan blade is improved. And display is performed on the industrial personal computer, so that the detection precision and efficiency areimproved. The fan blade detection device is provided with the detection module, the collection unit has a sleep mode and a detection mode, and when the detection module detects that fan blades are placed on the fan blade detection device, the collection unit in the fan blade detection device is triggered, so that the collection unit is awakened for collection only when needed, and the collection efficiency is improved. And when not needed, the fan blade detection device is in a low-power sleep mode, so that the power consumption of the whole fan blade detection device is reduced, the electricenergy is saved, and the service life is prolonged.

column12: Infrared imaging false alarm source classification method based on physical model constraint
column13: The invention belongs to the field of infrared image processing and machine vision application, and provides an infrared imaging false alarm source classification method based on physical model constraint, which realizes collaborative modeling and characterization of a false alarm source by physical characteristics and image characteristics, and meets the requirements of suppression of the false alarm source and intelligent target recognition in ground detection. According to the main scheme, the method comprises the steps of analyzing infrared false alarm source characteristic and constructing a false alarm source data sample set; processing forward modeling simulation data, and extracting physical characteristic parameter characterization characteristics; extracting geometric features of a false alarm source from an infrared image acquired by a sensor by adopting a multidirectional rotation structure operator, and extracting texture features of the false alarm source by adopting a local texture spectrum feature descriptor (LTMV, local texture spatial feature matrix); carrying out feature fusion on geometric features, texture features and physical features obtained by extracting features of the training set data to obtain a comprehensive feature vector and using the comprehensive feature vector for classifier training; and finally, realizing false alarm source classification by using test set data.
column15: SUN XIAOLI;;PENG ZHENMING;;DENG JIAKUN;;WU FENGYI;;ZHANG XIAN;;XIAO SHENGYUAN;;ZHENG HUAJING

column12: Systems and methods for testing a software application
column13: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed for testing a software application. An exemplary method includes storing a control file identifying a test case for testing a software application. A first expected result may be extracted from a device storing expected results of the software application, the first expected result being identified by the control file. A first actual result may be extracted from a device storing actual results output by the software application, the first actual result being identified by the control file. The first expected result may be compared with the first actual result to determine whether the first actual result matches the first expected result. A result file indicating whether the test case passed or failed is generated, and the test case has passed when the first actual result matches the first expected result. The result file may be stored in a storage device.

column12: Anomaly detection and model training method, computer equipment and storage medium
column13: The embodiment of the invention discloses an anomaly detection method, an anomaly detection model training method, computer equipment and a storage medium. The anomaly detection method comprises the following steps: determining first index data belonging to a preset system index in a first period; determining second index data belonging to the system index in a second period, wherein the second period is before the first period; comparing the first index data with the second index data to generate index features; and classifying the system indexes according to the index characteristics so as to carry out anomaly detection. By comparing the data design index characteristics of the system indexes in different periods, the condition of the system indexes can be reflected, and the performanceof the anomaly detection model trained by the method is ensured, so that the accuracy of anomaly detection is ensured, the anomaly detection model regards anomaly detection as a classification problem, the operation is simple and convenient, and the reliability is improved.

column12: ERROR AVOIDANCE FOR PARTIALLY PROGRAMMED BLOCKS OF A MEMORY DEVICE
column13: A read command is received by a processing device coupled to a memory device. The read command specified a logical address. The processing device translates the logical address into a physical address of a physical block of the memory device, wherein the physical address specifies a wordline and a memory device die. Responsive to determining that the physical block is partially programmed, the processing device identifies a threshold voltage offset associated with the wordline. The processing device computes a modified threshold voltage by applying the threshold voltage offset to a read level associated with the memory device die. The processing device reads the data from the physical block using the modified threshold voltage.

column12: User guiding method for Chinese natural language query method
column13: The invention discloses a user guiding method for a Chinese natural language query method. The user guiding method comprises the following steps: S1, starting a search box on a user operation interface; s2, cold start (before text content is input) of a search box is used as a watershed, and a word and sentence separation mode is adopted for guiding; s3, complementing the recommended words and phrases through a content recommendation algorithm in the text content input process of the user; and S4, guiding the user to ask questions according to the correct sentence pattern, and obtaining a data analysis result conforming to expectation. According to the user guiding method for the Chinese natural language query question method, example sentences are recommended through the pull-down menu of the search box, completion recommendation is carried out, it is ensured that a user can propose a question with a correct sentence pattern according to guiding, a data analysis result meeting expectation is obtained, meanwhile, question method type information supported by a product is revealed in the pull-down menu, and the user can conveniently and rapidly guide the question method. And the user can perceive the replaceable elements through visual design, so that the purpose of mastering and skillfully applying question methods and sentence patterns by the user is finally achieved.

column12: Robot automatic spraying production line operating system
column13: The utility model discloses a robot automatic spraying production line operating system which comprises a movable operating table, a conveying system, a robot system, a spraying system, a control system and a visual system. The conveying system, the robot system, the spraying system, the control system and the visual system are all arranged on the movable operation table, the robot system and thespraying system are arranged on one side of the conveying system, the visual system is arranged at one end of the conveying system, and the visual system is arranged at the other end of the conveyingsystem. The control system is connected with the conveying system, the robot system, the spraying system and the visual system. All the systems are coordinated and matched, and automatic workpiece conveying, workpiece position calibration, automatic workpiece spraying and real-time monitoring of the working state of the system can be achieved; in addition, the system is convenient to move, small in occupied area and convenient to repair and maintain due to the double-layer accessibility design.

column13: To provide a concrete form determination support system notifying information showing that an engineer at a site can determine whether specifications and arrangement intervals of form members to be applied to forms satisfy predetermined quality.SOLUTION: A concrete form determination support system is provided which notifies a user of support data for determining quality of a form to be used for concrete installation in a conversation style, the system comprises: an assistant unit which converts conversation data into text by voice recognition, the conversation data being input by voice and showing design data on a form to be used for concrete installation; a chat unit extracting, from query text data, design data including form members for forming the form and arrangement intervals; and a form quality determination unit comparing a finished shape of a form created using the design data with a predetermined quality determination rule, performing quality determination, and outputting the quality determination as confirmation support data. The chat unit creates answer text data as that of a natural language from the confirmation support data and provides the answer text data for the user as support data.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: Methods and systems for validating an autonomous system that includes a dynamic-code module and a static-code module
column13: Disclosed herein are methods and systems for validating an autonomous system that comprises a static-code module and a dynamic-code module, the method including the steps of performing a code-integrity-validation process on the static-code module and performing a behavior-integrity-validation process on the dynamic-code module. In some embodiments, performing the code-integrity-validation process on the static-code module includes performing a signature-verification process on the static-code module. In some embodiments, performing the behavior-integrity-validation process on the dynamic-code module includes using an encrypted-and-signed test vector. In some embodiments, performing the behavior-integrity-validation process on the dynamic-code module includes selecting a test vector from among a plurality of test vectors, generating a modified test vector at least in part by modifying the selected test vector, and performing the behavior-integrity-validation process on the dynamic-code module using the modified test vector.

column12: Flexible employment platform-based compliance detection system
column13: The invention discloses a compliance detection system based on a flexible employment platform, and the system comprises an ArcGISEnsine, an object relation mapping model, Devexpress, an NET frame, a geographic space database engine, and an ArcSDE space database engine. The ArcGISEnsine comprises a basic service module used for assisting component calling, a data access module connected to the basic service module and used for data access, and a map expression module connected to the data access module and used for map annotation rendering. The development component is connected to the map expression module and used for carrying out data visualization; and the expansion option is connected to the development component and used for carrying out advanced function support. According to the compliance detection system based on the flexible employment platform, on the aspects of business logic design, function implementation and performance optimization, codes of a data access layer are effectively standardized according to a data design protocol, the writing amount of repeated codes is reduced, and various requirements of the system can be better met.

column12: Mechanical pump small sample fault diagnosis method based on WGAN-GP-C and metric learning
column13: The invention discloses a mechanical pump small sample fault diagnosis method based on WGAN-GP-C and metric learning, which is based on one-dimensional convolution and time series data design and comprises four parts of data preprocessing, data enhancement, metric learning and model optimization. The data preprocessing realizes data self-adaptive denoising and standardization; in the data enhancement part, network and structure modification is carried out based on WGAN-GP to obtain WGAN-GP-C, so that data expansion according to categories is realized, and edge boundary information of the data is enhanced; a metric network combines a residual idea and a spatial adaptive structure to realize feature mapping, and then a KNN algorithm is utilized to realize state classification; in the model optimization part, the network is optimized by using a weight quantization idea, the KNN is realized by using a Ball-tree, and training data are deleted according to important factors, so that the algorithm performance is improved on the whole. The method has good performance under the condition of rare data, is high in practical value, and can provide thoughts for related workers maintaining mechanical pumps.

column12: Outdoor emergency guidance time prediction method
column13: The invention discloses an outdoor emergency guide time prediction method, which comprises the following steps of S10, the factors having great influence on group evacuation time comprising personnelcharacteristics and path characteristics, randomly valuing each characteristic factor in a reasonable range, and simulating by using an outdoor group evacuation behavior model to obtain evacuation time; S20, grouping the obtained data, and for each group of data, dividing each group of data into training data (75%) and test data (25%) through a spilt function of a sklearn library; S30, preliminaryjudgment is carried out according to the relationship between the data features and the prediction result; selecting a linear regression prediction method to establish a prediction model; constructing a loss function by adopting a least square method; constructing a model by using python/scikit-learning, constructing an evaluation function by using a minimum gradient method and relative errors inan optimization process, calculating by using test data to obtain a conclusion, obtaining respective adaptive relative error measurement values, obtaining a prediction time parameter matrix, and establishing a time prediction model.

column12: Intelligent robot low-code development system based on IROS
column13: The invention particularly relates to an intelligent robot low-code development system based on IROS. According to the intelligent robot low-code development system based on the IROS, a robot visual design component, a low-code generation component, a visual editing component and a visual testing component are added in the IROS, and the components cooperatively generate intelligent robot application codes. According to the intelligent robot low-code development system based on the IROS, on the basis of the communication function of the IROS and the robot development assembly, the application codes of the intelligent robot can be generated in a visual and low-code mode, the application development workload of the intelligent robot is greatly reduced, and the development efficiency and the development quality of the intelligent robot are improved.

column12: Chemical process monitoring method based on gradient descent feature learning mechanism
column13: The invention discloses a chemical process monitoring method based on a gradient descent feature learning mechanism, and aims to cope with outlier sampling data and achieve the purpose of data feature learning from the angle of reconstruction error minimization, thereby completing the operation state monitoring of the chemical process on the basis. According to the method, feature learning is directly carried out on a training data set possibly containing outlier sampling data and fault working condition sampling data, and sampling data under a normal working condition is not required, which is the biggest advantage of the method compared with a traditional chemical process monitoring method; the method depends on a robust standardization process of chemical process sampling data designed by the method and a robust feature learning mechanism with a minimum reconstruction error. In addition, when the gradient descent learning mechanism is implemented, the median of the gradient is innovatively used for updating the coefficient matrix, and the robustness is high when feature learning is implemented. From the two points, the method provided by the invention is a more practical chemical process monitoring method.

column12: Automatic digital data feedback and utilization in aircraft part lifecycle
column13: An aircraft lifecycle in which digital data for an aircraft part is automatically collected, retained, and utilized to individualize aircraft inspection and maintenance is described. Several types of data, including non-destructive evaluation and measurement data and structural health monitoring data, are used in a feedback loop having various phases which may automatically receive data in digital format from other phases. In this manner the part being designed, fabricated, tested, and maintained for the aircraft is optimized and processes involved in the lifecycle of the part is made more efficient.

column12: INSPECTING DEVICE, INSPECTING METHOD AND PROGRAM
column13: To provide an inspecting device that can easily and surely compare a dimension on a design drawing with an actual measured value.SOLUTION: An inspecting device according to an aspect of the present invention is an inspecting device for inspecting a dimension of a measured object, and includes: design information obtaining means for capturing a contour line of the measured object, a designed dimension value, and a design drawing including a dimension line which associates the contour line with the designed dimension value, and a dimension auxiliary line; contour image obtaining means for capturing a contour image of the measured object corresponding to the design drawing; superimposing means for superimposing design drawing data obtained by the design information obtaining means and contour data on the measured object obtained by the contour image obtaining means with each other; actual measured data extracting means for extracting actual measured data on the measured object from the contour data; dimension line data extracting means for extracting, using the contour data superimposed by the superimposing means, the dimension line and the dimension auxiliary line from the design drawing data; design data extracting means; comparing means; and evaluating means.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: COMMODITY PROCUREMENT SYSTEM
column13: To provide a system that is resistant to a significant change of a social structure and still can make use of the change.SOLUTION: In a commodity procurement system, a design station, a component procurement station, and a substation are electrically connected to one another directly, indirectly, or wirelessly. The design station electrically designs a specific commodity according to a program memory prepared in advance on the basis of an input commodity specification, the component procurement station automatically procures necessary components on the basis of data designed by the design station, and the substation stores components. The necessary components are moved to an assembly station from the component procurement station, to which the necessary components are procured according to the data, and component assembly is executed according to the data.SELECTED DRAWING: None

column12: Coding compression method for school uniform design data
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of data processing, in particular to a school uniform design data coding compression method which comprises the following steps: acquiring data characters related to school uniform design, and performing word segmentation processing on the data characters to obtain a first coding dictionary, determining a repeatability parameter of each segmented word in the first coding dictionary and a similarity score between the corresponding segmented word and the context-associated segmented word, determining a clustering membership parameter, performing clustering processing on the segmented words based on the clustering membership parameter to obtain a plurality of regional clusters, obtaining a second coding dictionary according to the plurality of regional clusters, and performing clustering processing on the segmented words according to the second coding dictionary. And finally, coding the data characters based on the second coding dictionary so as to realize compression management of the data characters related to school uniform design. Therefore, the problems of large data processing amount and high character processing difficulty caused by different character formats of related data designed by the school uniform are avoided, the size of a coding dictionary is reduced, and the data coding compression efficiency is improved.

column13: Aspects and implementations of the present disclosure address shortcomings of existing technology by enabling autonomous vehicle simulations based on retro-reflection optical data. The subject matter of this specification can be implemented in, among other things, a method that involves initiating a simulation of an environment of an autonomous driving vehicle, the simulation including a plurality of simulated objects, each having an identification of a material type of the respective object. The method can further involve accessing simulated reflection data based on the plurality of simulated objects and retro-reflectivity data for the material types of the simulated objects, and determining, using an autonomous vehicle control system for the autonomous vehicle, a driving path relative to the simulated objects, the driving path based on the simulated reflection data.

column12: Servo system for dexterous hand and fault detection and control protection method thereof
column13: The invention relates to a servo system for a dexterous hand and a fault detection and control protection method thereof. column12: Software usability comprehensive test method
column13: The invention discloses a software usability comprehensive test method, which comprises the steps of obtaining test indexes of software usability, and classifying the test indexes according to different levels to obtain a test index system; establishing an analytic hierarchy process model, and calculating the weight value of each test index in the test index system through an analytic hierarchy process algorithm to obtain the weight value corresponding to each test index; taking the weight value corresponding to each test index as a parameter, establishing a usability test model based on a neural network algorithm, taking the parameter as an initial weight value, and setting an initial threshold value; inputting a test sample into the usability test model, optimizing the usability test model through an optimization algorithm, and adjusting the initial weight value and the initial threshold value to obtain a usability test optimization model; and inputting target software into the usability test optimization model for simulation operation, and outputting and obtaining a usability test result of the target software.

column12: Micro sensor fault detection and separation method based on statistical magnitude Mahalanobis distance
column13: The invention discloses a micro sensor fault detection and separation method based on statistical magnitude Mahalanobis distance, and belongs to the field of industrial process monitoring and fault diagnosis, and the method comprises the steps: collecting normal sensor measurement as a training data set; giving a window width, and sequentially calculating the sample statistics of the measurement variables in each window to obtain a data matrix formed by the statistics; calculating a mean value and a covariance of the data matrix, and giving a control limit of the Mahalanobis distance; acquiring real-time sensor measurement as test data; calculating statistics by using test data in a window, calculating a Mahalanobis distance by using the mean value and the covariance, and comparing the Mahalanobis distance with a control limit to judge whether a fault exists or not; and if there is a fault, solving the statistical magnitude reconstruction contribution of each sensor by using fault reconstruction, and setting the sensor with the maximum contribution value as a fault sensor to complete fault separation. Compared with the prior art, a process mathematical model is not needed, and detection and separation of faults of various types of micro sensors can be achieved.

column12: Client information management method and system based on memory network
column13: The invention provides a client information management method and system based on a memory network, and relates to the technical field of information management. Newly added client information is called to be input into an information processing model, an information processing result is obtained and stored in a management storage module in a distributed mode, a retrieval target is obtained, and key retrieval features are determined; and the input management storage module executes multi-layer retrieval, analysis and judgment, obtains a retrieval result, realizes storage updating and retrieval calling management of customer information, and solves the problems that in the prior art, due to the fact that information is complex and certain subjective thinking intervention exists, various operations are limited, and the operation efficiency is high. The technical problem that flexible, efficient and high-precision management of customer information cannot be achieved in the prior art is solved, category affiliation and information architecture system extraction are carried out on information, storage is carried out at an adaptive position so as to guarantee orderliness of data and information integrity, layer-by-layer retrieval analysis is carried out according to retrieval requirements, retrieval efficiency is improved, accuracy is guaranteed, and user experience is improved. Therefore, flexible, targeted and effective management of customer information is realized.

column12: Power supply test system
column13: The utility model provides a power supply test system, comprising: a main circuit board on which an acquisition circuit, an A/D conversion circuit and a communication module are arranged, the acquisition circuit being used for acquiring current and voltage data output by a power supply adapter and identifying the maximum power output electric signal of the power supply adapter; the A/D conversion circuit is connected with the acquisition circuit and is used for converting current and voltage data and outputting a digital signal, and the communication module is connected with the A/D conversion circuit and is used for automatically adjusting a test load according to the identified power of the power supply; and the server communicates with the communication module, receives the data of the current and the voltage, and processes the data to obtain a test result. The power adapter testing device can accurately detect various adapters of different models, determine voltage and current data of the adapters, facilitate management and effectively block bad products, can identify and test adaptive signals of the power adapter and a computer, completely simulates a notebook use testing environment, and can save a large amount of labor and time cost.

column12: INFORMATION PROCESSING DEVICE, INFORMATION PROCESSING METHOD, AND INFORMATION PROCESSING SYSTEM
column13: An information processing device includes a memory and a processor configured to obtain first point group information that represents three-dimensional positional information, by using image data captured by a first camera; output second point group information obtained by reducing noise of the first point group information, by using one or more filters; and set filter coefficients of the one or more filters, by using (i) a filter coefficient estimation model trained in advance by using (a) test data for learning that includes image data captured by a second camera and (b) training data based on third point group information that represents three-dimensional positional information obtained by a position sensor, and (ii) observation data that includes the image data captured by the first camera.

column12: DYNAMIC MULTI-OBJECTIVE PARTICLE SWARM OPTIMIZATION-BASED OPTIMAL CONTROL METHOD FOR WASTEWATER TREATMENT PROCESS
column13: A dynamic multi-objective particle swarm optimization based optimal control method is provided to realize the control of dissolved oxygen (SO) and the nitrate nitrogen (SNO) in wastewater treatment process. In this method, dynamic multi-objective particle swarm optimization was used to optimize the operation objectives of WWTP, and the optimal solutions of SO and SNO can be calculated. Then PID controller was introduced to trace the dynamic optimal solutions of SO and SNO. The results demonstrated that the proposed optimal control strategy can address the dynamic optimal control problem, and guarantee the efficient and stable operation. In addition, this proposed optimal control method in this present invention can guarantee the effluent qualities and reduce the energy consumption.

column12: Method for recording operation audit data
column13: The invention discloses a method for recording operation audit data, which is a method for uniformly recording various configuration operations in a system, storing operation records in a database, and finally sending the operation records in a group in a nailing reminding manner to additionally inform other related personnel. The method is realized through an audit interceptor + configuration mode. The method is realized through an audit interceptor and configuration; the audit interceptor intercepts the operations of adding, deleting, modifying and querying the configuration by the business personnel, records various audit data such as related parameters, URL (Uniform Resource Locator) addresses, IP (Internet Protocol) addresses, operator names and operation time during the operation, and records the audit data in a database for later query; according to the method for recording the operation audit data designed by the invention, business personnel can timely perceive who operates the configuration item by recording the operation audit data; and if the business problem is found to be caused by configuration errors of the configuration items, the responsibility of a specific related person in charge can be explored.

column12: METHODS AND TECHNIQUES FOR DEEP LEARNING AT SCALE OVER VERY LARGE DISTRIBUTED DATASETS
column13: An apparatus, method and computer program product for neural network training over very large distributed datasets, wherein a relational database management system (RDBMS) is executed in a computer system comprised of a plurality of compute units, and the RDBMS manages a relational database comprised of one or more tables storing data. One or more local neural network models are trained in the compute units using the data stored locally on the compute units. At least one global neural network model is generated in the compute units by aggregating the local neural network models after the local neural network models are trained.
column15: CABRERA AREVALO WELLINGTON MARCOS;;KUMAR ANANDH RAVI;;AL-KATEB MOHAMMED;;NAIR SANJAY;;SANDHA SANDEEP SINGH

column12: Product data management method compatible with ship design and construction
column13: The invention discloses a product data management method compatible with ship design and construction, and the method comprises the following steps: constructing a product structure tree according to a block-region-system-subsystem, and achieving the unified organization of system design and construction data; coding each hierarchical node of the product structure tree to obtain a node code, and realizing identification of various design data design and construction information; and filtering, merging and sorting are carried out based on the node codes and the node attributes, and structure tree construction and display of any product are realized. The method has the beneficial effects that overall design and final assembly construction are carried out based on the same product structure tree, the conversion work of data from a design view angle to a construction view angle is effectively reduced, a product data coding rule covering design and construction information is formulated, rapid tracing of system and regional information to which the data belong in the development process is realized, and the development efficiency is improved. A data view conversion method based on coding and node attributes is constructed, and the requirements of different departments for data display according to self-defined rules are met.
column14: THE 719TH RES INSTITUTE OF CHINA SHIPBUILDING INDUSTRY CORPORATION
column15: LI FEI;;ZHANG WENJIN;;LI YUAN;;SUN YUHANG;;ZHANG RUI

column12: INCLUSIVE PERSONAL WAYFINDING ASSISTIVE METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR ELECTRONIC DEVICES FOR ALL, IN PARTICULAR FOR VISUALLY IMPAIRED, DYSLECTICS, THE COLOR BLIND, ELDERLY AND CHILDREN.
column13: The present invention is an inclusive personal wayfinding assistive methodology and system (The System) for electronic devices such as handheld or in-vehicle devices (The Device). The System is inclusively designed making independent wayfinding more intuitive and hereby accessible to a larger audience in general and in particular to visually impaired persons, dyslectics, color blind, elderly and children (The User). The concept transforms all current navigation guidance complexity into an intuitive, personal user experience that steps away from commonly used complex user interfaces that utilize a traditional digital map on top of which arrows and routes are displayed to in indicate the user's position, direction and route information in combination with navigation voice instructions to guide the user such as described in these following examples US2013325322A1l and US2019212151A1 2. The disclosed is different to these traditional digital map and arrow interfaces by using well distinguishable, high contrast circular visual objects instead of maps and arrows and the likes to make the interface accessible to a much larger audience. Moreover, the disclosed uses a unique combination of multi-sensory interfaces; visual, haptic, voice and sound in a game like dynamic interface to guide The User. The System offers flexible wayfinding assistance allowing The User to deviate from the selected route to avoid obstacles. The flexible wayfinding assistance wilt in this case 20 recognize the deviation and alter its navigation guidance automatically without the need for route-recalculations.

column12: DEVICES AND METHODS FOR TRAINING SAMPLE CONTAINER IDENTIFICATION NETWORKS IN DIAGNOSTIC LABORATORY SYSTEMS
column13: A method of training a sample container identification network of a diagnostic laboratory system includes obtaining a plurality of data subsets, wherein each data subset is smaller than a full training data set used to train the sample container identification network and includes a plurality of images of one or more sample containers. The sample container identification network is trained on each of the plurality of data subsets to generate a plurality of trained sample container identification networks. Each of the trained sample container identification networks are testing using testing data that includes test images of sample containers, wherein the testing includes identifying the sample containers in the test images. A core data set is selected from one of the plurality of data subsets based on the testing, the core data set for use in training a deployed sample container identification network. Other methods and systems are disclosed.
column15: BEKTAOUI WALID;;CHANG YAO-JEN;;POLLACK BENJAMIN S;;SINGH VIVEK;;KAPOOR ANKUR

column12: Software integration interaction design method
column13: The invention belongs to the field of guidance computers, and relates to a software integration interaction design method. The sub-software module is regarded as a weapon subsystem; input and output interface variables between the main scheduling software and the sub-software modules are defined in a classified mode according to task requirements, the input and output interface variables are set as global variables in main scheduling software engineering, and data updating and information interaction are completed through periodic read-write operation of the main scheduling software and the sub-software modules on the interface variables. All the sub-software modules are packaged and then added into a main scheduling software project in the form of static link library files, and a target file is formed after centralized debugging and compiling and written into a guidance computer. According to the method, the sub-software modules with respective core technologies are independently packaged into the static link library, and are compiled into the total target file through the main scheduling software, so that the self-owned technology of each sub-software module is protected, the functions of the sub-module software are fully applied, and the cooperative development of the software is facilitated.

column12: METHOD FOR MECHANICALLY TESTING A SINGLE PIECE STRUCTURE USING TEST PIECES CREATED BY MEANS OF 3D PRINTING
Clinical monitoring report generation method based on Form self-configuration
column13: The invention discloses a clinical supervision report generation method based on Form self-configuration. The method comprises the following steps: defining a supervision type under each clinical institution center; a clinical monitoring report template name is determined under the monitoring type; module types and contents need to be self-defined in the template, and the module types comprise single input item information, table data and a check list; after template definition is completed and CRA personnel complete center monitoring, adding a mechanism center monitoring report, selecting a defined template file, and supplementing content in each module according to a defined template block in combination with a mechanism center monitoring condition; meanwhile, an Issues list of the current inspection problem is input; and after solving all Issues, submitting PM auditing, and finally printing a visit inspection report, and archiving by a research center. According to the method, report templates are subdivided by configuration personnel according to service types, and meanwhile, the system provides complete report template configuration change recording, data analysis, Issues statistics and other functions, and a visit report monitoring and tracing system is established; therefore, the effects of high configuration speed, WYSIWYG visual design, low error rate, easiness in maintenance, complete control types, simplicity in operation and the like are achieved.

column12: Mutation testing of database functions
column13: Methods and apparatuses are described for mutation testing of database functions. A computing device identifies database functions for testing from at least one database. The computing device generates, for each identified database function, mutated database functions by automatically applying mutations to the identified database function that change aspects of the identified database function. The computing device deploys the mutated database functions to the at least one database. The computing device determines line coverage attributes associated with each mutated database function. The computing device selects tests for execution against each mutated database function based upon the line coverage attributes associated with each mutated database function. The computing device executes the selected tests against each mutated database function using test automation applications to determine an outcome associated with each test. The computing device generates an output file comprising the outcome associated with each test executed against the mutated database functions.
column32: Sarkar, Tanmoy, “Testing database applications using coverage analysis and mutation analysis,” (2013), Graduate Theses and Dissertations, 13308, available at https://lib.dr.iastate.edu/etd/13308, 97 pages.

column12: Method for protecting user data of a storage device, and electronic computing system
column13: The invention relates to a method for protecting user data of a read/write storage device of an electronic computing system in a motor vehicle. Using test data relating to the run time of the electronic computing system, at least one protection region for protecting a storage region of the read/write storage device is established or removed or is specified in such a manner that the extent and/or position of the protection region with respect to a total storage region comprised by the read/write storage device is changed. The invention further relates to a corresponding electronic computing system.
column32: International Search Report and Written Opinion dated Jan. 4, 2016 of corresponding PCT application PCT/EP2015/069662.

column12: Business test method and device, electronic equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention discloses a service testing method and device, electronic equipment and a storage medium, which are applied to the field of service testing in the financial field and solve the problems of low efficiency and low accuracy of service testing caused by the fact that used testing data does not have comprehensiveness, pertinence and effectiveness when a system performs service testing at present. The method comprises the following steps: acquiring original data corresponding to a target test case in a tested system; performing data processing on the original data corresponding to the target test case, and respectively executing the target test case in the tested system of the current version and the tested system of the baseline version by using the original data after data processing to respectively obtain test result data and target result data; and comparing the test result data with the target result data, and determining a test result of the target test case in the tested system of the current version according to a comparison result.
column15: ZHAO LIN;;JIANG JILIN;;CAI MINGZHE;;LIU QIUYAN;;GAO BO

column12: Stacked three-dimensional code generation method, system and device and storage medium
column13: The invention relates to a method for generating a stacked three-dimensional code, which comprises the following steps of: determining a generation pattern of the stacked three-dimensional code, the generation pattern being a preset distribution pattern of a two-dimensional code and a dot matrix code in a display area; obtaining code area display size data designed on the printing carrier; according to the code area display size data and the determined generation style, size data and generation areas of a two-dimensional code and a dot matrix code are calculated respectively; obtaining the raw code data of the two-dimensional code and the raw code data of the dot matrix code; generating a two-dimensional code of a corresponding size according to the raw code data and the size data of the two-dimensional code, and generating a dot matrix code of a corresponding size according to the raw code data and the size data of the dot matrix code; according to the generation areas of the two-dimensional codes and the dot matrix codes, the generated two-dimensional codes and the dot matrix codes are filled into the corresponding generation areas and fused, and after fusion is completed, a stacked three-dimensional code graph is output.
column14: VR CODE XIAMEN NETWORK TECH CO LTD

column12: Systems and methods for testing an embedded controller
column13: Systems and methods described herein provide for testing and debugging different subsystems of an embedded controller using a testing architecture. The testing architecture can simulate messaging interfaces between internal subsystems of the embedded controller and external subsystems the controllers interacts with to integrate various types of software. A method includes generating test support models for one or more subsystems and establishing a communications network between the test support models and a control module of the embedded controller. A clock signal is generated to initiate processing within the testing architecture between the control module and the test support models. An event model is executed at the test support models using the clock signal and data is generated at one or more of the test support models responsive to the event model. The data can correspond to operational parameters of a respective system the embedded controller.

column12: Molecular simulation-based SBS modified asphalt aging performance evaluation method
column13: The invention discloses a molecular simulation-based SBS (styrene butadiene styrene) modified asphalt aging performance evaluation method, which comprises the following steps: determining SBS molecules and asphalt molecular structures before and after aging, and determining the content change of four components (aromatic component, saturated component, colloid and asphaltene) of asphalt before and after aging. The method comprises the following steps: establishing an SBS modified asphalt molecular model, verifying the rationality of the model by using test data (density, glass transition temperature, solubility parameter, cohesive energy density and viscosity), evaluating SBS modified asphalt performance change molecular dynamics (viscosity and tensile shear behavior) before and after aging, and verifying the SBS modified asphalt performance change molecular dynamics by using the test data.
column15: ZHANG WEIGUANG;;WU MENG;;XU GUANGJI;;YAO YUSHI;;MA TAO;;ZHAO YONGLI;;YANG QILIN;;YANG-SHEN LINGRUI;;XU ZECHUAN

column12: Accident fault determination for autonomous vehicles
column13: Methods and systems for determining fault for an accident involving a vehicle having one or more autonomous and/or semi-autonomous operation features are provided. According to certain aspects, performance data indicative of the performance of the features may be used to determine fault for a vehicle accident, such as a collision, by allocating fault for the accident between a vehicle operator, the autonomous operation features, or a third party. The allocation of fault may be used to determine an adjustment to an insurance policy and/or adjust coverage levels for an insurance policy. The allocation of fault may further be used to adjust risk levels or profiles associated with the autonomous or semi-autonomous operation features, which may be applied to other vehicles having the same or similar features.

column12: Application health monitoring based on historical application health data and application logs
column13: Techniques for monitoring health of an application based on historical application health data and application logs are disclosed. In one embodiment, the historical application health data and the historical application logs associated with a period may be obtained. The application may include multiple services running therein. Priority of services may be determined based on the historical application health data associated with a portion of the period. Priority of exceptions associated with each of the services may be determined based on the historical application health data and the historical application logs associated with the portion of the period. Further, an application regression model may be trained by correlating the priority of the services, the associated priority of the exceptions, and the corresponding historical application health data. The health of the application may be monitored by analyzing real-time application logs using tested application regression model.
column15: SAHOO SIDHARTHA;;CHAUDHARY VIPUL;;HEGDE SANDEEP L;;VEERAKUMAR VIMAL DAS KAMMATH;;SRIDHARAN ARUNVIJAI

column12: Officially authorized virtual identification cards
column13: A system that allows users to display valid identification via a mobile device. Authentic and valid IDs and secure folders are verified by a certificate authority. Statistical techniques are applied to automatically determine the consistency and reliability of user data. Context is automatically determined to display data according to the context.

column12: Model Training Method and Apparatus, Storage Medium, and Device
column13: An index table may be dynamically adjusted based on the gradient information in a training process, and further, the corresponding second training data subset may be read based on the index table in the next round. The training data is evaluated in each round, and a training data set in the training process is dynamically adjusted.
column14: HUAWEI CLOUD COMPUTING TECH CO LTD

column12: Methods and systems for identifying an internal flaw in a part produced using additive manufacturing
column13: An example method for identifying an internal flaw in a part produced using additive manufacturing includes calculating a proof load of a part, in which the proof load is a load that when applied to the part will cause the part to fail based on presence of an internal flaw in the part, determining whether the part can withstand the proof load based on a geometry of the part and static strength data, and based on a determination that the part can withstand the proof load, applying the proof load to the part during a compliance test of the part. The proof load causes the part to fracture, when applied to the part, based on presence of the internal flaw in the part that is of a threshold size at which the internal flaw would cause cracking and potential part failure when the part is placed under the operational load.

column12: Situation scene simulation system architecture system construction method
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of aviation simulation, and particularly relates to a situation scene simulation system architecture system construction method, which comprises the following steps that: a time management module generates a step length propulsion command through a system timer; the communication management module pushes the step length propelling command to the operation management module; the operation management module informs the plug-in management module to carry out model calculation after receiving the step length boosting notice; the plug-in management module calls and resolves the model; the plug-in management module notifies a plug-in control thread to perform judgment after the calculation action of the step is completed; after judging that all plug-in threads are executed, the plug-in control thread sends a notice that the current step of calculation of the model is completed; updating a frame internal state machine; the battlefield situation scene data designed for the tested radar can be managed, the consistency of test scenes in the processes of fault reproduction, defect positioning, regression test verification and the like is guaranteed, and the battlefield situation scene data can serve as a data source of a radar confrontation scene test reuse resource library.
column14: LEIHUA ELECTRONIC TECH RESEARCH INSTITUTE AVIATION INDUSTRY CORPORATION OF CHINA

column12: Rail vehicle electrical process design and processing method
column13: The invention relates to a rail vehicle electrical process design and processing method, and the method comprises the following steps: S1, based on an unstructured electrical drawing, establishing anelectrical process design model as a base source data model through informatization and digitization means in combination with the characteristics of each construction process, wherein the design andprocessing of the subsequent electrical process are carried out in the base source data model; S2, automatically generating a structured chart or graph of each process by adopting a data common sourcemode according to a process method and a rule distribution model corresponding to each process in the electrical construction process, and guiding the construction operation of each process; S3, recording and managing the whole process of design, maintenance and construction. According to the method, common-source data design and processing of process charts of all procedures are automatically achieved based on the electrical process structured database, it is guaranteed that process design data sources of all the procedures are unified and synchronously changed, the electrical process changeprocessing difficulty is lowered, and the electrical process design efficiency and the product quality are improved.
column15: BING CHENYANG;;KANG JINLONG;;YANG GUOHUI;;ZHANG SHANXIA;;CHANG JIE;;GE YANXIA;;ZHANG HOUBAO

column12: Demand engineering data management method and device based on Jazz platform
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of system engineering design, and particularly relates to a demand engineering data management method and device based on a Jazz platform. The method comprises the following steps: S1, acquiring demand data designed or maintained by a demand developer in a DOORS system, and sending the demand data to a Rhasody software design end; step S2, a plurality of system models are constructed by a model developer through Rhapsody software; s3, accessing the system models of the Rhapsody software through the EWM client so as to perform configuration management on each system model; and step S4, constructing a model manager RMM through the control capability provided by the Jazz platform for the underlying data access authority, and obtaining each system model and the corresponding model developer based on the model manager RMM for personnel management of the model developer. According to the method, role management of project members is carried out through the model manager RMM of the Jazz platform, and more flexible and fine-grained authority control can be realized.
column14: SHENYANG AIRCRAFT DESIGN INST AVIATION INDUSTRY CORPORATION OF CHINA

column12: Modular design, prefabrication and construction method of emergency shelter hospital infrastructure
column13: The invention relates to a modular design, prefabrication and construction method of an emergency shelter hospital infrastructure. Comprising an air-conditioning heating and ventilation system, a water supply and drainage system, a medical oxygen system, a power distribution system and an intelligent information system, modularized modeling and unique tagging are carried out on cabin basic function units of the emergency mobile hospital and standard basic components in a matched guarantee system through a BIM digital and visual design technology, a unit module library is formed, during project implementation, modules are called and assembled according to project design requirements, and a unit module library is formed. After project model building is completed and collision check and optimization design are carried out on each professional pipeline, each professional construction drawing with positioning base points and module codes is generated, and meanwhile, BIM module information data is transmitted to a PDM product manufacturing database of a manufacturer through a BIM and PDM information interface to carry out basic unit module prefabrication production; therefore, the purposes of rapid design, standardized manufacturing and efficient deployment of the emergency mobile shelter hospital are achieved.
column14: YUNNAN BUILDING INDUSTRIALIZATION RES AND DEVELOPMENT CENTER CO LTD

column12: Communications in a medical device system with link quality assessment
column13: Methods and devices for testing and configuring implantable medical device systems. A first medical device and a second medical device communicate with one another using test signals configured to provide data related to the quality of the communication signal to facilitate optimization of the communication approach. Some methods may be performed during surgery to implant one of the medical devices to ensure adequate communication availability.
