column12: Method for constructing virtual cognitive system of aero-engine core engine
column13: The invention relates to a method for constructing a virtual cognitive system of an aero-engine core engine. The method comprises the following steps: establishing a fine Nurbs industrial model of each part of the aero-engine core engine; performing curved surface segmentation and lightweight processing to obtain an FBX-format small plane body model; through a PBR process design, baking a PBR material map of the FBX-format small plane body model; manufacturing a PBR material ball under the HDRP rendering pipeline; the method comprises the following steps: constructing an FBX-format facet body model with a PBR material ball, loading the model into Unity, selecting an HDRP rendering pipeline, configuring an illumination system, a post-processing system and a camera system, and constructing an aero-engine core machine cognitive virtual scene; carrying out man-machine interaction function design and data-driven working parameter visual design; releasing an exe executable program to obtain a virtual cognitive system of the aero-engine core engine; according to the invention, learners can know the structure and working principle of the parts of the core engine of the engine.

column12: License plate recognition method and system in natural scene
column13: The invention discloses a license plate recognition method in a natural scene. The method comprises the following steps: constructing a license plate recognition model and training the license plate recognition model by using training set data, wherein the training set data comprises a plurality of license plate pictures; testing and evaluating the trained license plate recognition model by using test set data, wherein the test set data comprises a plurality of license plate pictures, the license plate recognition model which passes the test and evaluation is used for license plate recognition, picture information can be extracted by adopting a lightweight feature extraction network mobilenet-v2, and edge equipment can be served more conveniently.
column14: CHENGDU HENGCHUANG XINXING TECH CO LTD
column32: 肖慧辉等: "基于 Transformer 的证件图像无检测文字识别";;XIAOFEN JIA等: "Multi-Attention Ghost Residual Fusion Network for Image Classification";;VISHAL JAIN等: "Deep Automatic Licence Plate Recognition system"

column12: Virtual synchronous classroom teaching system in 5G network environment and working method thereof
column13: The invention belongs to the field of teaching application of information technology, provides a virtual synchronous classroom teaching system in a 5G network environment and a working method thereof, and creates a virtual and situational synchronous classroom teaching system in the 5G network environment. According to the method, aiming at virtual teaching requirements of middle and primary schools, an element library and a component library are designed and constructed, virtual teaching suites with different granularities are generated based on assembly rules, a virtual classroom visual design tool is developed, and a script description language is applied to realize virtual classroom sharing and interoperation based on a scene tree; a C/S architecture is adopted to build a virtual synchronous classroom teaching system, and teaching activities of a virtual classroom are synchronized based on a consistency sorting strategy of timestamps; many-to-many, one-to-many and one-to-one teaching is carried out by adopting direct connection and broadcast mechanisms, teaching contents and teaching process data are displayed on an electronic screen at the front end of a virtual classroom, and interaction operation results are synchronously updated in cloud-end and end-end modes by using a cloud increment technology.
column32: A. A. SIMISCUKA, T. M. MARKANDE AND G. -M. MUNTEAN: "Real-Virtual World Device Synchronization in a Cloud-Enabled Social Virtual Reality IoT Network", 《IEEE ACCESS》;;张琦: "基于Web的VRML虚拟环境教学研究", 《中国优秀硕士学位论文全文数据库 信息科技辑》

column12: PRESCRIPTION ASSISTING METHOD FOR PROVIDING TEST SET BY USING INTERVIEW CONTENT
column13: The present disclosure relates to a prescription assisting method for assisting a doctor in making a prescription for a patient and, specifically, to a method by which a test set to be prescribed for a patient is provided using a transcript of a conversation between a doctor and the patient, particularly in view of the doctor's intention. The present disclosure relates to a method comprising: obtaining medical records by a target doctor to generate learning data sets by using frequently used test item lists and the medical records; generating and training a pattern classification model or base model by using the learning data sets; and generating and providing test sets.

column12: OPTIMIZED DEPLOYMENT OF ANALYTIC MODELS IN AN EDGE TOPOLOGY
column13: Provided are techniques for optimized deployment of analytic models in an edge topology. A description of a multi-tiered edge topology with a plurality of nodes, a multimedia stream analytics composition, and performance objectives are received, where the multimedia stream analytics composition includes tasks that use analytic models. The analytic models are optimized and clustered to form clusters of optimized analytic models. A representative optimized analytic model is selected from each of the clusters. A configuration recommendation is determined that indicates deployment of the tasks and of each selected representative optimized analytic model on the plurality of nodes to meet the performance objectives. One or more workflows are generated from the configuration recommendation and executed on the plurality of nodes to generate output for the multimedia stream analytics composition.
column14: IBM;;IBM UK;;IBM CHINA INVESTMENT CO LTD

column12: GENERATION OF TEST DATA HAVING CONSISTENT INITIAL CONDITIONS FOR STIMULATING A CONTROL UNIT TO BE TESTED
column13: A method for processing raw data recorded from the real world with the aid of a sensor into test data for stimulating a control unit, including: providing recorded raw data from the real world; ascertaining real objects detected by the sensor from the raw data, and generating route data sets, which each describe a scene including images of these real objects at consecutive points in time. providing a library of synthetic objects; assigning synthetic objects to detected images of the real objects, replacing the detected images with synthetic objects; supplementing temporally consecutive route data sets with supplementary data sets before the first route data set; and generating test data by converting the route data sets supplemented by the supplementary data sets into raw data that would have been recorded in the real world by the sensor during the introductory period and the recording period.

column12: Power stability control method based on deep reinforcement learning and graph attention mechanism
column13: The invention discloses a power stability control method based on deep reinforcement learning and a graph attention mechanism, and the method comprises the steps: generating training data through power system simulation software, then training an intelligent agent through the deep reinforcement learning, and enhancing the power grid feature extraction capability through a graph attention mechanism network. And finally realizing stable control on the unstable system. The method mainly comprises the following steps of: designing a generator tripping scheme: designing a set of generator tripping process capable of performing stable control on an unstable system; designing a neural network based on a graph attention mechanism: constructing the neural network of the intelligent agent through a graph attention mechanism network based on the topological structure of the power grid; and deep reinforcement learning content design: designing an action space, a state space, a reward function and the like. According to the method, the graph attention mechanism network and deep reinforcement learning are combined and applied to the stability control of the power system for the first time, the power grid feature extraction capability can be enhanced, and the capability of improving the stability control of an unstable system is achieved.

column12: Teaching data generation method and device, equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention provides a teaching data generation method and device, equipment and a storage medium, and the teaching data generation method comprises the steps: obtaining a unit teaching design requirement inputted by a user, calling a preset field large model, obtaining a teaching intention according to the unit teaching design requirement, retrieving knowledge information related to the teaching intention from a field knowledge base, and generating a teaching data generation result; according to the method, a field large model is called, unit teaching design content is generated according to unit teaching design requirements and knowledge information related to teaching intentions, further, class hour teaching activity content can be generated according to the unit teaching design content, and class hour teaching activity courseware can be generated according to the class hour teaching activity content. According to the teaching data generation method provided by the embodiment of the invention, the teaching data can be intelligently generated, and the generated teaching data can be directly utilized by a user or utilized after modification and can also be used as a reference basis for teaching data design of the user, so that the burden of the user can be greatly reduced.
column15: WANG SHIJIN;;CHEN YUJUE;;ZHAN JINDONG;;WANG YANG;;ZHU XIANG;;LAI XUEWU;;YOSHITOYO

column12: Research and development trial-production management system
column13: The invention discloses a research and development trial-production management system. According to the invention, when the trial-production batch transfer module is used, a trial-production batch transfer list is automatically output, and a spot inspection list is formed for spot inspection and intelligent early warning of problem items during small batch decision making; according to the trial-manufacturing service, project numbers penetrate through the whole trial-manufacturing process through online management, the trial-manufacturing process is online, the trial-manufacturing task progress is fed back in real time, a research and development prototype'medical record library 'is established, a problem closed loop can be controlled, a research and development prototype'archive library' is established, prototype resumes are traceable, and the overall safety of the system is further improved. The data input module quickly imports historical data, design results are convenient to submit, and tool software is deeply integrated; the data management module performs diversified data classification; the data query module performs fuzzy keyword retrieval; and the data output module is used for outputting various data reports and various statistical analyses, so that the overall operation quickness of the system is improved.
column14: HUNAN NIUSHU SHANGZHI INFORMATION TECH CO LTD

column12: Intelligent medicine chest
column13: The invention discloses an intelligent medicine box, and relates to the technical field of intelligent medicine boxes, in particular to an intelligent medicine box which comprises a medicine box body, a front covering panel is connected to the front end of the outer wall of the medicine box body, a middle medicine bin is arranged in the medicine box body, and medicine storage bins are installed on the left side and the right side of the upper portion of the middle medicine bin. A medicine bin support is arranged in the medicine storage bin, a medicine storage box is installed above the medicine bin support, one side of the outer wall of the medicine storage box is connected with an adjusting rack, a gear is installed above the adjusting rack, the input end of the gear is connected with a shaft rod, and a bearing is installed in the middle of the shaft rod; the input end of the shaft rod is connected with a transmission belt wheel, and the input end of the transmission belt wheel is connected with a belt. The intelligent medicine chest is complete in function, small and exquisite in structure, man-machine interaction design, voice broadcast reminding and real-time data recording are achieved, the old are effectively reminded to take medicine, and wide market popularization prospects are achieved.
column15: LUO ZHE;;TANG YAYUAN;;XIA YUPING;;SUN MEIYU;;QIN RUYI;;LI GUONAN;;CHEN TAO;;YUAN JUN

column12: AUGMENTED REALITY DISPLAY FOR SURGICAL PROCEDURES
column13: A device may determine a view of a user of a head mounted display. The device may obtain tracking data relating to a surgical procedure. The device may obtain, from an imaging device, surgical imaging relating to the surgical procedure. The device may orient models of objects based on the tracking data and the view of the user of the head mounted display, wherein the objects includes the imaging device. The device may augment, by providing output to the head mounted display for display, the view of the user with contextual information relating to the objects based on orienting the models based on the tracking data and the view of the user, wherein the contextual information includes the surgical imaging captured by an imaging device.

column12: Hand brake force testing device for motor vehicle detection
column13: The utility model discloses a hand brake force testing device for motor vehicle detection, which comprises a tester, two sides of the top end of the tester are respectively and fixedly provided with a first interface and a second interface, the top end of the first interface is clamped and connected with a data line, and one end of the data line far away from the first interface is fixedly connected with a hand brake force sensor. According to the hand brake force testing device for motor vehicle detection, the hand brake force sensor is utilized by the tester to collect analog signals, the analog signals are subjected to data processing through an AD chip in the processor and are transmitted back to the MCU controller, the MCU controller displays the analog signals on the LCD display screen, and the hand brake force testing device for motor vehicle detection is simple in structure and convenient to use. Test data, peak data and the like can be displayed in real time, and the device is clear, visual, simple and practical. The design of the whole machine accords with ergonomics, the instrument is convenient to operate and control, and the instrument is ideal equipment used for automobile manufacturing, automobile comprehensive performance detection, automobile maintenance and the like.

column12: Automatic test use case generation method, electronic equipment and readable storage medium
column13: An embodiment of the invention discloses an automatic use test case generation method, which comprises the following steps of: monitoring a service interface when the service interface of a target service is truly called to obtain an input parameter and an output parameter of the service interface; recording an execution operation in an execution process of the service interface to obtain operation recorded data; generating a cache file according to the input parameter, the output parameter and the operation recorded data; analyzing the cache file through a preset structured test framework, and determining preparation data corresponding to each step in the structured test framework from the cache file, wherein the structured test framework comprises a plurality of steps; and generating a use case according to the preparation data of each step in the structured test framework.

column12: Attack detection method based on neural network and focus loss
column13: The invention relates to an attack detection method based on a neural network and focus loss. The method comprises the following steps: preprocessing an attack data sample; performing feature extraction on the preprocessed attack data sample by using a buffer area algorithm based on a deep convolutional neural network, and constructing a detection model; performing model training and optimization by using a focus loss function; and testing the trained model by using test data to measure the quality of the classification algorithm. According to the method, the problem that the accuracy rate in the aspect of buffer overflow vulnerability attack detection is not high enough is solved to a certain extent, meanwhile, a focus loss function is provided for the problem that positive and negative sample data are unbalanced, the accuracy rate of attack detection is improved, and the efficiency of attack detection is also improved.

column12: Voltage stabilizer testing method, intelligent terminal and storage medium
column13: The invention relates to a voltage stabilizer test method, an intelligent terminal and a storage medium, and belongs to the technical field of electronic tests.The method comprises the steps that a test type is acquired, and a to-be-tested voltage stabilizer is tested according to the test type; acquiring test data for testing the to-be-tested voltage stabilizer under the test type, and obtaining a test result of the to-be-tested voltage stabilizer according to the test data; and generating a test report according to the test result and outputting the test report. The to-be-tested voltage stabilizer is tested according to different test types to obtain the test data, and the test result is obtained according to the test data, so that in the whole process, workers do not need to use test equipment to test the voltage stabilizer, intervention of the workers is not needed, and manpower is effectively reduced.

column12: Isolated code detection from application code analysis
column13: Disclosed are various embodiments for isolated code detection from application code analysis. Various application components may be identified from a source code file or a bytecode file of a computing application. A graph model representative of the computing application is generated having nodes and bridges that connect some nodes to other nodes. The graph model is generated such that at least one of the nodes is an isolated node having less than a threshold number of bridges connecting to other nodes, which is indicative that a corresponding one of the application components can be implemented as an independently deployable component of the computing application.

column12: Receiving appliance for automated deliveries
column13: A landing pad receives and stores packages delivered from an aerial vehicle and awaiting pickup from an aerial vehicle. The landing pad can be placed outside of a window and can contain a transmitter for sending out an identification signal via radio frequency to aid aerial vehicles in finding the landing pad. The landing pad contains a landing platform with a trapdoor that leads to a storage compartment. The trapdoor can be configured to only open when it receives a signal from an authorized aerial vehicle. The storage compartment can be accessed via a storage compartment door which can contain a locking mechanism. The storage compartment can be climate controlled. The landing pad can also have a transmitter that emits sounds to discourage animals from nesting on or near the landing pad. The landing pad can also include a solar power generator as a source of electrical energy.

column12: Bridge load test evaluation method using tilt angle-displacement joint test
column13: The invention discloses a bridge load test evaluation method using tilt angle-displacement joint test. Analysis and evaluation are performed by using test data, and tilt angle sensors are installed on a main beam to carry out a load test of a bridge structure. Meanwhile, on the basis of comparative study on the sensitivity of displacement sensors and the tilt angle sensors to structural damage and state edge change, a specific method for evaluating the structural state by using main beam deflection curve parameters is provided, and higher recognition accuracy can be obtained under the same condition; the tilt angle sensors should be arranged at the positions of L/4, 3L/4 and the like where the rotation angle of the beam body is maximum; and the displacement sensors are arranged in the spans according to the same principle, so that the tested data are more stable and reliable.
column32: LIXIAO ZHANG等: "Middle displacement monitoring of medium–small span bridges based on laser technology", 《WILEY》;;曹坤阳: "基于灰色神经网络的斜拉桥换索工程索力调整方法研究", 《中国优秀硕士学位论文全文数据库工程科技Ⅱ辑》;;朱世峰: "液—气联动差压连通管式桥梁竖向位移监测方法研究", 《中国博士学位论文全文数据库工程科技Ⅱ辑》;;陈志伟等: "顺坡向单层岩体板裂结构模型粘弹塑性弯曲稳定分析", 《四川大学学报(工程科学版)》

column12: System and Method for Simultaneously Examining, Maintaining and Calibrating Multiple Sensors and Sensor Types
column13: A system and method for simultaneously running a plurality of air quality sensor units using a centralized station and software to test for field performance upon factory return from field installations, automatically identify preventative maintenance requirements, and automatically calibrate the sensor units and generate quality metric reporting. The centralized station and software include a computer, a manifold, tubes, and cables. A test gas is supplied, wherein the manifold distributes the test gas. Once powered and supplied with test gas, the sensor units are tested simultaneously. The computer runs software that compares the test data collected from the sensor units to determine if any of the sensor units fail standards or produce data that deviates from a mean average range. Sensor units that do not require maintenance are calibrated using test gasses to generate calibration coefficients which are stored within the sensors' firmware.

column12: Attention-CNN-LSTM industrial process fault diagnosis method based on improved grey wolf algorithm optimization

column12: Testing Client-Side Rendering Capabilities

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR VALIDATING DOMAIN SPECIFIC MODELS
column13: Model driven engineering (MDE) approaches necessitate verification and validation (V&V) of the models used. Balancing usability of modeling languages with verifiability of the specification presents several challenges. Conventional modeling languages have automated solvers but are hard to interpret and use. Implementations of present disclosure provide systems and methods for validating domain specific models wherein rules and vocabularies in domain specific model are translated to machine interpretable rules (MIR) and machine interpretable vocabularies (MIV) which are processed (via logic programming technique) to generate a logic programming representation (LPR) of the MIR and MIV based on which solution scenarios are generated for validating the domain specific model. Validation of the model involves verifying LPR using a set of ground facts. During validation of solution scenarios of model, system also checks for inconsistences in rules, if any. These rules are corrected and solution scenarios are re-generated to obtain anomaly free solution scenarios.

column12: Evaluation method for accelerated life prediction model of component
column13: **The invention provides a method for evaluating an accelerated life prediction model of a component. The method comprises the following steps: S1, establishing a reliability model R * (t) by using all data; t1, T2, T3,..., TS are set as the acceleration stress of the product; s2, dividing the acceleration stress according to the proportion of (S-1): 1, and dividing the data into training data and test data; s3, establishing a reliability model according to the training data in each combination, deducing a reliability function of stress corresponding to the test data, and recording the reliability function as R (t); reliability modeling is independently carried out by using test data, and an obtained reliability function is defined as a standard reliability function and recorded as R0 (t); and S4, comparing R (t) and R0 (t) of all combinations, and if errors are all within a given threshold range, determining that the model R * (t) is accurate. The invention provides a new thought for the accuracy evaluation problem of the accelerated life prediction model.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR LATENCY CRITICAL QUALITY OF SERVICE USING CONTINUOUS BANDWIDTH CONTROL
column13: A system and method are provided for a bandwidth manager for packetized data designed to arbitrate access between multiple, high bandwidth, ingress channels (sources) to one, lower bandwidth, egress channel (sink). The system calculates which source to grant access to the sink on a word-to-word basis and intentionally corrupts/cuts packets if a source ever loses priority while sending. Each source is associated with a ranking that is recalculated every data word. When a source buffer sends enough words to have its absolute rank value increase above that of another source buffer waiting to send, the system "cuts" the current packet by forcing the sending buffer to stop mid-packet and selects a new, lower ranked, source buffer to send. When there are multiple requesting source buffers with the same rank, the system employs a weighted priority randomized scheduler for buffer selection.

column12: Radar power monitoring method
column13: The invention discloses a radar power monitoring method, which comprises the following steps of: extracting bottom noise signal data from radar echo data, and calculating an intensity mean value E (N)of the bottom noise signal data through mathematical statistics; selecting a detection target, obtaining echo signal data of the detection target from the radar echo data, and calculating an intensity mean value E (S) of the echo signal data through mathematical statistics; calculating the maximum detection distance according to E (N) and E (S); and comparing with the nominal power value of radar, and judging whether the radar power meets the requirement of the nominal value or not. According to the radar power monitoring method provided by the invention, each radar performance index does notneed to be measured by using test equipment, and the maximum detection distance of the radar can be calculated only by using radar echo data, so that the test time and cost can be saved while manpower and material resources are saved.

column12: Method and system to measure gas flow
column13: A system for measuring gas flow generally including a passive acoustic wave generator disposed in a gas flow stream to passively generate an audio signal through vortex shedding, a sound capturing instrument disposed outside the gas stream to produce an electrical signal representative of the acoustic signal, a temperature sensor to obtain temperature measurements indicative of the temperature of the gas flow stream and a control system for determining the gas flow, such as velocity or flow rate, as a function of the acquired acoustic and temperature measurements. The acoustic wave generator includes a corrugated flow channel whose geometric design is so tuned to generate an acoustic emission whose frequency signature varies as a function of the gas flow velocity. The control system may acquires time-domain acoustic data, and process that data to obtain a frequency-domain representation from which gas velocity or gas flow rate can be determined.

column12: NDN-based DNS identifier analysis method and system
column13: The invention discloses an NDN-based DNS identifier analysis method and system, and relates to the technical field of identifier analysis. The invention aims to provide a DNS identifier analysis method and system which can realize a DNS identifier analysis function based on an NDN network, prevent the problem of single-point failure or power abuse of a central node, and ensure the credibility of a user analysis result. The method comprises the steps of identifier name design, identifier data design, identifier server deployment and identifier analysis. A user communicates with a DNS iteration parser through a DNS protocol in an IP network, the iteration parser communicates with an authoritative server through an NDN network, the iteration parser generates a series of NDN Interest packets in order to obtain DNS data entries in the DNS request processing process and sends the NDN Interest packets to the NDN network, the authoritative server provides response to the Interest packets and sends an NDN Data packet containing identification information, and the NDN Data packet is sent to the NDN network. And finally, the NDN network forwards the Data packet to the iteration parser which sends the Interest packet, so that the iteration parser finally obtains the required DNS data entry. According to the invention, problems caused by failure or tampering of the central node can be reduced.

column12: METHOD FOR IDENTIFYING INDIVIDUALS OF OPLEGNATHUS PUNCTATUS BASED ON CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK
column13: A method for identifying an individual of an oplegnathus punctatus based on a convolutional neural network is provided. Target initial positioning involves three continuous convolutional layers and an average pooling layer. A region of feature interest point is obtained, a hyperparameter candidate box is set to obtain a region, thereby obtaining an approximate position of a target object. II_Net backbone convolutional neural network includes six convolutional layers and four pooling layers, which includes a LeakyReLU activation function used as an activation function of the first convolutional layer, convolutional network layers of Alexnet and parameter data, and a maximum pooling layer of an overlapped pooling structure. Fully connected layers use a genetic algorithm to improve data transmission between layers. With the established model, identification of the individual of the oplegnathus punctatus is performed by using test data.

column12: Sentiment analysis as a quality indicator in usability testing

Sentiment information is collected by a wearable device configured to be worn by a test user while a set of operations of a test case are executed, the test case evaluating usability of a product or service. Upon completion of the set of operations, a quality for the evaluation of the usability is determined using the sentiment information collected from the wearable device corresponding to input received from the executed set of operations.

column12: Method for estimating SOC of lithium battery by data-driven algorithm considering internal resistance
column13: The invention discloses a method for estimating the SOC of a lithium battery by a data driving algorithm considering internal resistance. The method comprises the following steps: firstly, carrying out a charge-discharge test on the lithium ion battery by using test equipment, measuring voltage, current, temperature and internal resistance data of the battery in different working states, and preprocessing the obtained data; then, building a bidirectional GRU network, wherein one part of processed data serves as a training set to train the network, and the other part of the processed data serves as a test set to evaluate network performance; and finally, in order to improve the performance of the constructed network, optimizing the bidirectional GRU network by using an NAG algorithm. The input of the constructed bidirectional GRU-NAG network is the voltage, the current, the temperature and the internal resistance of the battery, and the output of the constructed bidirectional GRU-NAG network is the residual electric quantity of the battery, so that the method has the advantages of high estimation speed and simple process, and is a data-driven battery residual electric quantity estimation model.

column12: REMOTE MONITORING AND SUPPORT OF MEDICAL DEVICES
column13: This disclosure is directed to systems and techniques for detecting change in patient health and if a change in patient health is detected, direct a medical device to generate for display output indicating the detection of the change in patient health. An example medical system or technique applies a model to values of configurable settings that are programmed into detection logic of a medical device; based on the application, determine whether modified values of the configurable settings, when implemented by the detection logic, would change a determination, by the medical device, regarding whether sensed physiological activity is indicative of cardiac episode for a patient; and in response to a determination that the modified values would change the determination regarding whether the sensed physiological activity is indicative of the cardiac episode for the patient, generate output data indicative of the modified values for the configurable settings for the medical device.

column12: Electromechanical system mathematical model identification method and system
column13: The invention discloses an electromechanical system mathematical model identification method and system. The method comprises the following steps: acquiring input and output data of an electromechanical system of an identified object; grouping the data into training set data and test set data; using training set data for mathematical model identification, adopting different algorithms to train thetraining set data to obtain a plurality of mathematical models, using test set data for testing and evaluating the mathematical models, and selecting optimal mathematical models under different requirements. The system comprises an embedded terminal and a cloud server host. According to the invention, the hardware function of the identification system is simplified, and the system has configurability through the FPGA module. In addition, a plurality of algorithms are adopted in the cloud server host to identify the mathematical model, and the optimal mathematical model under different requirements is selected through model evaluation for a user to select. According to the invention, the cost of the mathematical model identification system of the astronomical telescope electromechanical system can be greatly saved, the requirement on a user is reduced, and the model identification precision is improved.

column12: APPARATUS AND METHODS FOR ASSAYING A LIQUID SAMPLE
column13: Devices, systems, and kits for assaying a liquid sample include a reader and a test strip. The test strip may comprise a disposable cassette. The system may include a test strip mounting structure configured to receive the cassette in a predetermined orientation. The apparatus includes a processor and memory, together configured to conduct an assay of the liquid sample. The apparatus may include a display configured to generate a pattern encoding data related to a result of the assay.

column12: Earthquake news event-based earthquake data structured automatic method
column13: The invention provides an earthquake news event-based earthquake data structured automatic method, which comprises the following steps of: crawling a large amount of news data from a preset earthquake-related website by using a web crawler; marking trigger words and event elements in the collected news data in a BIO marking mode; randomly dividing the data set into a training data set and a test data set; constructing a seismic event extraction model, wherein the model is realized in a manner of combining a bidirectional long-short-term memory network and a conditional random field; and training a seismic event extraction model by using the labeled training set. In the training process, the model is tested by using test set data, and if the precision requirement is met, the training is completed; and the trained seismic event extraction model is deployed in practical application. Earthquake-related websites are crawled a web crawler, each crawled content is analyzed through an earthquake event model in real time, and if the crawled content conforms to the earthquake event type, earthquake event elements are extracted and stored into a database.

column12: Software application build testing
column13: Various examples are directed to systems and methods for testing software. A testing system may use test case data describing a first test case failed by a first build of the software application, the first build generated by a first commit operation of the plurality of commit operations to execute a fault localization operation, the fault localization operation to identify a first suspect program element of a first build. The testing system may use the first suspect program element and commit data to select a second commit operation from the plurality of commit operations. The testing system may determine an error-inducing commit operation from the plurality of commit operations and executing a corrective action.

column12: Communication system test method and system, equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention discloses a communication system test method and system, equipment and a storage medium, and the method comprises the steps: constructing a test bug information base which stores the test bug information of a plurality of test sites of the communication system; acquiring a to-be-tested place and a to-be-tested version of the communication system; according to the test bug information base, updating the test bug information corresponding to the to-be-tested place to the to-be-used test version; and testing the to-be-tested place based on the updated to-be-used test version. For the same scene or test site, the same or similar bugs often appear, through data statistics intelligent analysis, bug information is synchronously updated to an associated test version before the next test, the problem that the solved problem needs to be analyzed again on site is avoided, in addition, guidance suggestions can be given for the unsolved problem, and the test method of the communication system can be conveniently and accurately optimized.

column12: High-voltage control box test auxiliary system and high-voltage control box test system
column13: The embodiment of the utility model discloses a high-voltage control box test auxiliary system and a high-voltage control box test system. The auxiliary system comprises a master control system, a battery high-voltage simulation system and a battery low-voltage simulation system. The battery high-voltage simulation system comprises a first test data interface and a voltage output interface. The first test data interface is connected with the master control system, and the voltage output interface is connected with a high-voltage interface of the high-voltage control box; the battery low-voltage simulation system comprises a second test data interface and a message output interface; the second test data interface is connected with the master control system, and the message output interface is connected with the low-voltage interface of the high-voltage control box. According to the scheme, under the condition that a battery pack is not used, testing of the high-voltage control box can be completed, the testing cost is saved, and the testing period is shortened; and the battery high-voltage simulation system and the battery low-voltage simulation system can carry out comprehensive function test on the high-voltage control box, so that the application range of the high-voltage control box test auxiliary system is expanded.

column12: Variable-inclination-angle experimental device and method for simulating multi-horizontal-hole grouting of water diversion fault
column13: The invention relates to a variable-inclination-angle experimental device and method for simulating water diversion fault multi-horizontal-hole grouting. The device comprises a grouting simulation platform arranged on a base, and an inclination angle between the grouting simulation platform and the base is adjustable; the grouting simulation platform comprises a steel shell, a fault filling spaceis formed in the steel shell, visual tempered glass is arranged on the front face of the steel shell, a plurality of back face grouting holes are formed in the back face of the steel shell, and a plurality of side face grouting holes are formed in the side wall of the steel shell. According to the invention, simulation of fault grouting effects with different inclination angles can be realized, and slurry diffusion characteristics can be visually displayed through visual design, so that a simulation experiment of horizontal hole grouting reinforcement of typical characteristics of a fault fracture zone is realized.

column12: Multiple XR extended reality application validation process and testing
column13: Techniques are disclosed herein that relate to performing and managing validation tests for XR applications to provide validation for the quality and usability of the applications within XR capable user devices. An example provides a testing system that receives a request to perform validation tests for an XR application executing on an XR capable device, the request including unique testing specifications corresponding to the XR capable device. The testing system may identify testing device capabilities to perform the validation tests and select a testing device of a plurality of testing devices based at least on the testing device capabilities associated with the testing device to execute the validation tests for the XR application according to the testing specifications and report test results from the validation tests to a testing log.

column12: METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR USING SCAN OPERATIONS TO PROTECT SECURE ASSETS
column13: Methods and apparatus are disclosed to protect secure assets using scan operations. One example apparatus includes logic circuitry including a scan chain that includes data storage elements and design logic coupled to the scan chain. The example apparatus also includes data storage to store secure data. The design logic is coupled to the data storage. The example apparatus also includes a security controller to transition the apparatus out of a secure mode of operation. The transition includes the security controller to cause the scan chain to serially shift secure scan data from an input of the scan chain into each data storage element of the data storage elements of the scan chain.

column12: Microseismic data noise suppression method and system, storage medium and seismic information processing equipment
column13: The invention discloses a microseismic data noise suppression method and system, a storage medium and seismic information processing equipment, belongs to a microseismic data processing technology, and aims to solve the problems that all noise cannot be eliminated and effective signals are lost in an existing method. According to the technical key points, a detector is used for collecting microseismic data of a target block; dividing the obtained microseismic data into a training set, a verification set and a test set in proportion, inputting the training set data into the time attention mechanism mutual information generative adversarial network model for learning, and outputting a microseismic noise suppression pre-training model; inputting verification set data into the trained model, and verifying model parameters by using a signal-to-noise ratio to obtain an optimal micro-seismic noise suppression model hyper-parameter combination; testing the optimal hyper-parameter combination by using test set data, and obtaining a final micro-seismic noise suppression model; and inputting the field micro-seismic data into the final micro-seismic noise suppression model to obtain de-noised micro-seismic data, thereby realizing noise suppression of the micro-seismic data.
column15: DONG HONGLI;;SHANG ROU;;WANG CHUANG;;GUAN CHUANG;;SONG JINBO;;SHEN YUXUAN

column12: METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR USING SCAN OPERATIONS TO PROTECT SECURE ASSETS
column13: Methods and apparatus are described to protect secure assets using scan operations. One example apparatus includes logic circuitry including a scan chain (212) that includes data storage elements (232, 234, 236) and design logic (216) coupled to the scan chain. The example apparatus also includes data storage (202) to store secure data. The design logic is coupled to the data storage. The example apparatus also includes a security controller (240) to transition the apparatus out of a secure mode of operation. The transition includes the security controller to cause the scan chain to serially shift secure scan data from an input of the scan chain into each data storage element of the data storage elements of the scan chain.

column12: Processing technology of Skip Via laser drilling
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of circuit board processing, in particular to a Skip Via laser drilling processing technology, which comprises the following steps of: finishing Comfor mask windowing on a laminated substrate; laser reaming data are designed in advance; a laser drilling method is set according to the size of the hole diameter, and a Skip Via hole is obtained; and carrying out copper deposition on the substrate with the Skip Via hole and then entering a subsequent processing flow. According to the processing technology, blind hole Comfor mask windowing is adopted, a copper sheet above a blind hole is etched off firstly, then laser reaming data design is adopted, and the Skip Via hole obtained through methods of small mask, small energy, multiple gun numbers and the like is good in hole pattern and reliable in quality, the problem of adhesive residue at the bottom of the Skip Via hole is solved, and follow-up processing is facilitated.
column14: JIANGXI YANGHAO ELECTRONIC SCIENCE AND TECH LIMITED COMPANY

column12: Intelligent customer service implementation method and device based on knowledge graph
column13: The invention provides an intelligent customer service implementation method and device based on a knowledge graph, relates to the technical field of intelligent customer service, can be used in the financial field, and comprises the following steps: establishing an intelligent customer service model; training and verifying the intelligent customer service model by using the training set data and the verification set data in the data set; testing the intelligent customer service model by using test set data in the data set, and storing the intelligent customer service model according to a test result and a predetermined strategy; and applying the intelligent customer service model to the financial industry intelligent customer service system. According to the application, the intelligent customer service model is constructed based on the knowledge graph, and the intelligent customer service model is trained to reach the standard required by the intelligent customer service, so that the overall accuracy of the answer of the intelligent customer service can be improved, and the satisfaction of the customer after using the intelligent customer service application is improved.

column12: HYDROGEN EMBRITTLEMENT PROGRESS EVALUATION METHOD AND HYDROGEN EMBRITTLEMENT PROGRESS EVALUATION DEVICE
column13: The present invention calculates a cumulative distribution function for break times from multiple items of hydrogen embrittlement break test data measured using test conditions designed for rebar in prestressed concrete, calculates transition probabilities from the cumulative distribution function for the break times by regarding a hydrogen embrittlement break as a stochastic process in which the degradation state successively transitions and reaches a break state, and determines the hydrogen embrittlement progress by integrating the transition probabilities using time.

column12: Test method, device and equipment of data leakage prevention system and storage medium
column13: The invention discloses a test method and device for a data leakage prevention system, equipment and a storage medium. The method comprises the steps that a received test instruction is responded, to-be-used test control parameters in the automatic test system are acquired, and the test control parameters are configured by the system in advance or input by a target object in real time; a plurality of target terminals are controlled to execute batch starting behaviors and terminal behaviors according to the test control parameters, a test environment is obtained, and the target terminals are service objects of the data leakage prevention system; and automatically testing the data leakage prevention system in the test environment to obtain a test result. According to the method and the device, the technical problems of low test efficiency and poor test effect caused by the fact that a traditional open source test framework cannot automatically test the data leakage prevention system under the condition that a plurality of terminal devices run in bursting are solved.

column12: PROTOTYPING VOICE USER INTERFACES FOR LANGUAGES WITH NON-PHONETIC ALPHABETS
column13: Voice command matching during testing of voice-assisted application prototypes for languages with non-phonetic alphabets is described. A visual page of an application prototype is displayed during a testing phase of the application prototype. A speech-to-text service converts a non-phonetic voice command spoken in a language with a non-phonetic alphabet, captured by at least one microphone during the testing phase of the application prototype, into a non-phonetic text string in the non-phonetic alphabet of the voice command. A phonetic language translator translates the non-phonetic text string of the voice command into a phonetic text string in a phonetic alphabet of the voice command. A comparison module compares the phonetic text string of the voice command to phonetic text strings in the phonetic alphabet of stored voice commands associated with the application prototype to identify a matching voice command. column12: Rolling bearing fault diagnosis model establishment method, rolling bearing fault diagnosis method, rolling bearing fault diagnosis device and rolling bearing fault diagnosis equipment
column13: The invention relates to a rolling bearing fault diagnosis model building method, a rolling bearing fault diagnosis method, a rolling bearing fault diagnosis device and rolling bearing fault diagnosis equipment, and belongs to the technical field of bearing fault diagnose.The rolling bearing fault diagnosis model building method comprises the steps that actually-measured sample data of a rolling bearing in various fault states are obtained, the actual measurement sample data comprises training sample data and test sample data; establishing a BP neural network model; optimizing a connection weight and a threshold value of the BP neural network model by adopting a particle swarm optimization algorithm to enable a global error of the BP neural network model to reach preset precision; and inputting the training sample data into the optimized BP neural network model for training, and verifying a training result by using test sample data to obtain a fault diagnosis model of the rolling bearing. The method has the effect of improving the accuracy of the fault diagnosis result of the rolling bearing.

column12: Spacecraft water drop configuration relative motion period calculation method, system and equipment
column13: The invention provides a spacecraft water drop configuration relative motion period calculation method, system and equipment, and relates to the technical field of spacecraft orbital motion design. Setting orbit parameters of the target spacecraft and the tracking spacecraft, and respectively calculating the number of orbits and operating parameters of the target spacecraft and the tracking spacecraft according to the orbit parameters; according to the orbital parameters, the orbital elements and the operation parameters, determining the motion trail direction of the water drop configuration of the tracking spacecraft relative to the target spacecraft; and iteratively solving a true anomaly difference of the tracking spacecraft according to the orbital elements, the orbital parameters and the trajectory data of the motion trajectory direction of the water drop configuration, and calculating a relative motion period of the water drop configuration according to the true anomaly difference. The method is completely based on the spacecraft, is calculated according to the orbital element, does not depend on a specific relative motion equation, directly obtains the relative motion period of the water drop configuration according to the orbital element of the spacecraft, is stable, convenient and accurate in calculation, is clear in physical significance, is convenient to understand, and is suitable for practical engineering application.

column12: INFORMATION PROCESSING DEVICE, INFORMATION PROCESSING METHOD AND INFORMATION PROCESSING PROGRAM

column12: METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR FACILITATING CONFIGURATION, TESTING AND/OR DEPLOYMENT OF A WIRELESS SYSTEM INCLUDING A WIRELESS EXTENDER
column13: Methods and apparatus for facilitating the deployment of a wireless extender in combination with a base station at a customer premises are described. Support is provided for data rate testing in combination with configuring one or more aspects of the system such as wireless extender and/or base station transmission power level. By using testing a system can be deployed where one or more devices may use transmission power levels which are less than the maximum permitted transmission power level while still supporting an expected data rate corresponding to a subscriber service level in a reliable manner. In various embodiments DFS channel black and/or white lists are generated for each link taking into consideration the determined transmit power to be used for a given link.

column12: SUBSTANCE TESTING SYSTEM AND METHOD
Data-driven novel power system distribution network topology online identification method
column13: The invention is suitable for the technical field of electric power, and provides a data-driven novel power system distribution network topology online identification method, which comprises the following steps: acquiring historical operation data of a power distribution network containing high-proportion new energy and a corresponding topological structure, carrying out data preprocessing, and constructing a novel power system distribution network topology operation state database; mapping the actual topological structure of the power distribution network into an undirected graph; constructing a graph convolutional neural network model, and performing distribution network topology offline identification model training by using the training set data; constructing a distribution network topology offline identification model evaluation index system, and evaluating the model identification effect by using test set data; and inputting novel power system power distribution network operation data into the trained identification model to obtain a distribution network topology online identification result. According to the method provided by the invention, intelligent novel power system distribution network topology identification can be realized based on the power distribution network measurement data.

column12: DETERMINING AND SELECTING PREDICTION MODELS OVER MULTIPLE POINTS IN TIME USING TEST DATA
column13: Techniques for model evaluation and selection are provided. A plurality of models trained to generate predictions at each of a plurality of intervals is received, and a plurality of model ensembles, each specifying one or more of the plurality of models for each of the plurality of intervals, is generated. A test data set is received, where the test data set includes values for at least a first interval of the plurality of intervals and does not include values for at least a second interval of the plurality of intervals. A first model ensemble, of the plurality of model ensembles, is selected based on processing the test data set using each of the plurality of model ensembles.

column12: Automatic integration method of COF test data
column13: This method discloses an automatic integration method of COF test data, including: S10: Use test equipment to test wafers on a batch of COF one by one to obtain test document A in csv format; test equipment stores test document A on the Internet In the disk; the network disk stores the test document A and the integrated test image files; S20: Use Python to write a script to obtain the test document A in the network disk, and download the test document A to the destination folder S30: Use the Python language to write a script to read all the materials in the test document A, and store all the materials as a list; output the information in the list to a file in xlsx format, and compare the data Perform classification calculation and integration to form a test image file mapA, and store the test image file mapA in the network disk. The invention can reduce the time for data processing and improve work efficiency.

column12: Rapid detection and evaluation method and system for electric vehicle operation safety rack
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of electric vehicle operation safety detection, in particular to an electric vehicle operation safety rack rapid detection and evaluation method and system, and the method comprises the following steps: S1, carrying out the rapid detection test of a test vehicle on a test rack in a default braking energy recovery mode; s2, collecting rapid detection test data, and processing and analyzing the data; s3, extracting characteristic parameters of each motion segment by using a principal component analysis algorithm; s4, establishing an operation safety detection model, and performing result analysis on the model by using test data; s5, verifying the actual vehicle, and proposing a detection qualified threshold range; the driving-braking safety performance of the electric automobile can be rapidly detected in real time, existing hidden dangers can be found in time, and accidents are reduced.

column12: Method and device for realizing digital function model machine based on multi-field unified modeling language
column13: The invention relates to an implementation method and device of a digital function model machine based on a multi-field unified modeling language, and belongs to the technical field of aerospace. The method comprises the following steps: establishing an industrial mechanism model based on a multi-field unified modeling language, and fusing each mechanism model to obtain a digital function prototype simulation model; and performing a virtual test on failure countermeasures which cannot be verified in an actual test environment by using the digital function prototype simulation model, and correcting the digital function prototype simulation model by using test data. According to the invention, the cost investment can be reduced, the research and development efficiency is improved, and the system test coverage and the system troubleshooting efficiency are improved.

column12: Federal learning system and method based on block chain, electronic equipment and medium
column13: The invention provides a federal learning system and method based on a block chain, electronic equipment and a medium. The federated learning system comprises a plurality of nodes, and each node comprises a public chain layer and a private chain layer; the public chain layer comprises a training task chain and a standard model chain, the training task chain is used for storing training task data, and the standard model chain is used for storing standard model data; the nodes are used for acquiring training task data from the training task chain, acquiring a to-be-trained model of a training task from the training task chain or the standard model chain, training the to-be-trained model based on private data in the private chain layer to obtain a training model, and verifying the training model by using test data to obtain the accuracy of the training model; and determining standard model data from the training model according to the accuracy, and publishing the standard model data to a standard model chain. According to the invention, based on the test data of the block chain and the training task, the model is iterated through decentration and verifiable model accuracy, so that a noise model is prevented from being introduced into federated learning.
column14: SHANGHAI UNITED IMAGING HEALTHCARE CO LTD

column12: INTEGRATED TEST PLATFORM SYSTEM FOR PROVIDING MARKETABILITY USABILITY AND TECHNICALITY TESTS ABOUT BUSINESS MODEL AND THE OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: An integrated test platform system for providing tests of marketability, usability and technicality for a business model, and an operation method thereof are provided. The integrated test platform server included in the system comprises: at least one processor; and a memory that stores instructions instructing the at least one processor to perform at least one operation. The at least one operation comprises the following steps of: authenticating a tester in conjunction with a tester terminal, and storing the authenticated tester in a tester DB in advance; performing a marketability test for a plurality of minimally viable products (MVP) corresponding to a business model in conjunction with an external SNS platform server; selecting at least one of the plurality of minimum viable products based on the marketability test; selecting a plurality of testers corresponding to the selected at least one minimum viable product; performing a usability test and a technicality test in conjunction with at least some of the tester terminals among the selected testers; and providing test result data according to the marketability test, usability test, and technicality test to a customer terminal.

column12: Bluetooth sound equipment circuit with engine sound wave simulation function
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of electronic product sound design, in particular to design of a Bluetooth sound equipment circuit with an engine sound wave simulation function. The circuit comprises a Bluetooth sound box and an engine simulation sound box. The Bluetooth sound box is composed of a Bluetooth sound box body and a Bluetooth sound box control circuit. An audio signal amplifying and processing module is arranged on the Bluetooth sound box control circuit, a loudspeaker module is arranged on right of the signal amplifying and processing module, an engine sound wave simulation circuit module is arranged in the upper side of the loudspeaker module, and a Bluetooth communication and audio playing circuit module is arranged in the upper side of the engine sound wave simulation circuit module. According to the invention, the sound box product can realize the function of engine sound wave simulation on the basis of playing common music.
column14: TIANJIN YIDE SOUND TECH CO LTD

column12: METHOD FOR CONTROLLING AN ADAPTIVE LIGHT FUNCTION AND MOTOR VEHICLE HEADLIGHT
Test system and test method for testing a broadband cellular network
column13: A test system (1) serves to test a broadband cellular network. The test system (1) includes at least one user interface (2, 3) and at least one central test module (7) capable to run a predetermined or user-defined test method. A smartphone test probe interface module (13) of the test system (1) is connected to the central test module (7). Such smartphone test probe interface module (13) is capable to establish a data/signal connection between at least one smartphone test probe (14) and a network component of the broadband cellular network. The test system (1) further includes a radio test probe interface module (15) and a core network test probe interface module (17) capable to establish in a similar manner a data/signal connection between at least one radio/core test probe (16, 18) and a respective network component of the broadband cellular network. During a test method using such test system, a group of test probes is assigned to network components of the network to be tested via the respective interface modules (13, 15, 17). After that, at least one test sequence within the network is performed and data and results from the test probes (14, 16, 18) and the test sequences are aggregated to monitor the performance of the network. A test system results having enhanced capabilities to enable the testing of the broadband cellular network.

column12: System and method for unmoderated remote user testing and card sorting
column13: A system for performing remote usability testing of a website includes a module for generating particular tasks, a module for moderating a session with a number of participants, and a module for receiving usability data. The system further includes a analytics module for analyzing the received usability data. The module for generating the particular tasks includes a research server configured to interface with user experience researchers and storing multiple testing modules for selecting qualified participants from the number of participants and for generating the particular tasks having research metrics associated with a target web site. In an embodiment, the research server randomly assigns one or more of the multiple testing modules to one of the participants. The multiple testing modules may include card sorting studies for optimizing a web site's architecture or layout.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR MEASURING THE RELATIVE AND ABSOLUTE EFFECTS OF ADVERTISING ON BEHAVIOR BASED EVENTS OVER TIME
column13: The systems and techniques described herein measure advertisement effectiveness of behavior-based outcomes (e.g., site visit, number of pages consumed, searches, online and offline transactions). The system implemented an automated model to measure the impact of exposures and impressions on outcomes using uses panel data, cookie-based data, and combinations thereof. The techniques use test and control approach to calculate effectiveness, where the test group are those exposed to a campaign and a control group who is not exposed. For those exposed, a running analysis of impressions (and other variables) in a pre period is used to determine behavior based outcomes over a set time period after that exposure. As a result, the automated model is able to generate metrics that show absolute and relative impacts on future behavior.
column15: HAARSTICK CHRISTOPHER S;;TALKINGTON TODD;;SHIELDS DEVIN;;KEMP PATRICK;;MILLMAN STEVEN

column12: Transform-combined lightweight Chinese speech recognition method
column13: The invention provides a lightweight Chinese speech recognition method in combination with Transform, and belongs to the field of speech recognition. Firstly, audio feature information is obtained by using depth separable convolution; secondly, constructing a double-half-step residual weight feedforward neural network layer: a Macarron-Net structure, and introducing low-rank matrix decomposition to realize model compression; in order to verify the model, on the premise that no language model is used, testing is carried out on an Aishell-1 data set and an aidatatang200zh data set. Experimental results show that compared with the Open-Transformer, the character error rate of the model disclosed by the invention is relatively reduced by 19.8%, and the real-time rate of the model disclosed by the invention is relatively reduced by 32.1%.
column14: YUNSHANG INTELLIGENT TECH WUXI CO LTD

column12: Two-ounce PCB color-difference-free printing process
column13: The invention discloses a two-ounce PCB color-difference-free printing process. The process comprises the following steps: S1, performing engineering data design; S2, manufacturing a screen printing plate: drying a screen in a screen room according to engineering data obtained in the step S1; S3, primary solder mask printing: filling printing ink in the middle and at the edge of a circuit; S4, performing primary solder mask printing and UV curing; S5, performing solder mask pretreatment; S6, performing secondary solder mask printing: printing solder mask insulation ink on a base material and a copper foil surface; and S7, performing secondary solder mask printing and UV curing. According to the two-ounce PCB color-difference-free printing process provided by the invention, through improvement on the solder mask data, ink is removed from an ink feeding position on the base material in primary solder mask printing, and ink is fed during secondary solder mask printing, so that the use amount of additional printing ink is saved, and the color difference problem is solved.
column14: KUNSHAN WANYUANTONG ELECTRONIC TECH CO LTD

column12: Error-proofing automatic test method and error-proofing automatic test system
column13: The invention relates to an error-proofing automatic test method and system. The method comprises the steps of generating a product plan data table, a test tool data table and a product test program and tool data table; obtaining a test tool model of a test tool, scanning a bar code of a test product and generating a first error-proofing request instruction, judging whether a test program and a version number are correct or not, whether a test tool corresponding to a test tool model meets requirements or not and whether a test product to be tested is correct or not based on the product plan data table, the tool data table, the test tool data table and the first error-proofing request instruction; and when the judgment result is correct, the test circuit is electrified and the test product is tested. According to the invention, product bar codes are effectively prevented from being wrong, and an incorrect test tool is used; an incorrect test program is used; test tools, such as test probes and electrical connectors, are not timely replaced. Defective products and rework of a production line can be reduced, cost is reduced, and production efficiency and product quality are improved.

column12: SOH estimation method for lithium ion battery system
column13: The invention provides a lithium ion battery system SOH estimation method. The method comprises the following steps: establishing a battery database model; establishing a vehicle operation condition model by collecting and analyzing driving data; calculating the SOH estimated value of a single string of batteries; the charging data are compared and analyzed, SOC-OCV data in a battery database model are combined, and SOH of a single string of batteries is corrected; and differentiating the SOH estimated values of the single-string batteries to finally obtain the SOH estimated value of the system. According to the scheme, the SOH capacity of each string of batteries can be independently estimated by establishing parameters in a battery database model and combining a plurality of parameter variables including SOC-OCV data, attenuation data models under different temperatures, different multiplying powers and different cycle intervals and charging end data comparison, and SOH estimation of the battery system is realized through difference calculation; sOH estimation can be quickly completed without dismounting the battery system; the SOH estimation can be completed through the normal charging and discharging of the whole vehicle level without using test equipment.

column12: Tea variety classification method based on SE-ResNet model
column13: The invention discloses a tea variety classification method based on an SE-ResNet model, and the method comprises the steps: collecting an original image of tea, zooming the image data according to the design requirements of the SE-ResNet model in an equal proportion, and expanding the generalization of the image data through employing the modes of overturn transformation, rotation transformation, noise disturbance and contrast transformation in sequence; after the number of network layers is determined, a hyper-parameter, an activation function and a loss function are selected to construct an SE-ResNet model for tea variety classification, training set and verification set data are adopted to train the SE-ResNet model, corresponding training weights are saved, and the model is optimized according to training precision and a loss function graph; and reloading the training weight into the optimized model, and finally verifying the tea variety classification performance of the model by using test set data. According to the invention, different tea varieties can be quickly identified, the tea variety classification efficiency is improved, and the time and labor costs are reduced.
column15: YUAN HONGCHUN;;JIA YUHAN;;ZANG TIANQI;;WU RUOYOU;;ZHOU HUI;;WU SHUNLONG

column12: Method and device for acquiring minimum boosting temperature of CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor
column13: The invention provides a method and a device for acquiring the minimum boosting temperature of a CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor, and the method comprises the following steps: acquiring material test data of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor, and generating a first boosting temperature threshold value of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor under the influence of tempering embrittlement according to the material test data; design parameters of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor are obtained, and the wall hydrogen concentration of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor under the steady-state working condition is generated according to the design parameters; acquiring material parameters of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor, and generating a second boosting temperature threshold value of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor under the influence of hydrogen-induced embrittlement according to the wall hydrogen concentration and the material parameters; and generating the lowest pressure rising temperature of the CrMo steel hydrogenation reactor according to the first pressure rising temperature threshold value and the second pressure rising temperature threshold value.

column12: BM AUTOMATIC CALCULATION METHOD FOR PLANT STATIONARY EQUIPMENT
column13: The present disclosure relates to a bill of material (BM) automatic calculation method for plant stationary equipment, and more particularly, to a BM automatic calculation method for plant stationary equipment capable of automatically calculating BM data for purchasing a plate required quantity required for manufacturing stationary equipment through cutting plan and optimization deployment in order to manufacture stationary equipment using data extracted from a strength calculation program of the plant stationary equipment prepared in a plant engineering step. The present disclosure has an advantage of greatly reducing the labor force by automatically calculating the cutting plan drawing, the nesting plan drawing, and required BM of the plate of the stationary machine which has been manually performed in the related art.
