column12: Music creation system based on intelligent mobile terminal
column13: The invention relates to a music creation system based on an intelligent mobile terminal. The system comprises a nested kit module which is used for supporting the intelligent mobile terminal, a sensor module used for receiving a gesture control signal, an interface parameter control module which responds to a touch trigger signal and generates a first audio parameter control instruction, a sensorsignal analysis module used for analyzing the gesture control signal and generating a second audio parameter control instruction according to a preset sound design mapping relationship, an audio digital signal processing module which performs corresponding effect processing on an audio material to be processed according to the first audio parameter control instruction and the second audio parameter control instruction, and a sound mixing processing module used for carrying out sound mixing processing on the audio signal which has been subjected to effect processing and then outputting a processed audio signal. Compared with the prior art, the system has the advantages of being convenient and flexible, improving user experience and the like.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PERFORMING A BEAMFORMED TEST SIGNALING
column13: A method is disclosed for a wireless communication node operating in a wireless communication system and controlling an antenna system. The method comprises obtaining information indicating a direction from the antenna system towards a location of interference sensitivity, and performing beamformed test signaling (e.g., over-the-air transmission of the test signal), wherein a beam direction of the beamformed test signaling and the indicated direction are different. For example, performing the beamformed test signaling may comprise orienting an emission pattern of the beamformed test signaling such that the emission pattern has an emission strength in the indicated direction which is lower than an emission strength threshold. The location of interference sensitivity may comprise a vehicular route, a location of a vehicular control station, or an area of operation of another wireless communication node. In some embodiments, the method is for antenna calibration of the antenna system, and the beamformed test signaling comprises beamformed antenna calibration signaling. Corresponding computer program product, apparatus, and wireless communication node are also disclosed.
column14: ERICSSON TELEFON AB L M;;ZHANG HAO

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR USING TEST DEPOSITS TO DETECT UNLISTED ACCOUNTS ASSOCIATED WITH USERS OF A DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
column13: Test deposit mechanisms used by financial institutions to link accounts are used to identify undisclosed accounts associated with users of a data management system. The potential existence of undisclosed accounts is determined based on the assumption that the presence of test deposit transactions in user account data is a strong indication that an undisclosed user account exists. Using this assumption, transaction data from user accounts disclosed to a user data management system is scanned to identify test deposit transactions listed in the transaction data. If test deposit transactions are identified, the user of the data management system is queried regarding the existence of the undisclosed user account. If the user confirms the existence of the undisclosed account, the formally undisclosed account is added to a set of disclosed user accounts with the data management system.

column12: TTA METHOD FOR DETECTING OUT-OF-DISTRIBUTION DATA USING TEST-TIME AUGMENTATION AND APPARATUS PERFORMING THE SAME
column13: Provided are a method for detecting out-of-distribution (ODD) data and an operating method thereof, comprising the steps of: generating at least one new data from input data using a data conversion method; obtaining a first output value of an artificial neural network model for each of the at least one new data; calculating a second output value using the obtained first output values; and determining whether or not the input data are external domain data by comparing the second output value with a predetermined specific value. At least one new data is generated from input data using a data conversion method, and external domain data are detected based on the output value of an artificial neural network model for each of new data to have a high detecting performance of external domain data while using a small amount of memory.

column12: Adhesive Selection Method, Adhesion Complex, and Production Method for Adhesion Complex
column13: In an adhesive selection method, test data is acquired by subjecting an adhesion complex, obtained by integrally bonding one material and an other material that are heterogeneous using an adhesive, to a shear test, in which a tensile shear load is applied to the adhesion complex in a direction that causes shear deformation in the adhesive, until adhesive failure takes place. Based on the test data, a plurality of two- or three-dimensional FEM analysis models of the adhesion complex with varied adhesives are constructed. On each of the analysis models, a simulation is performed in which a tensile shear load is applied. Based on the stresses and locations of the stresses generated in each of the analysis models in the course of the, the adhesive for binding one member made of the one material and the other member made of the other material is selected from among the adhesives.

column12: Techniques for building medical provider databases
column13: Information about a medical provider's locations, brands, and gateways can be received (e.g., via an online portal). This information can be used to generate a data object that represents relationships between the locations, the brands, and the gateways. This data object can be maintained in a database base that is searchable by a user device. For example, a user of the user device may search the database to identify a medical provider where the user obtains care. Once identified, other systems can be used to connect the user device to a gateway associated with the medical provider in order to download electronic health record data associated with the user.

column12: Test case generation method and device based on dominance relationship
column13: The invention discloses a test case generation method and device based on a dominance relationship, which are used for generating a test case meeting an all-uses data flow test criterion. The method comprise the steps of analyzing a data flow of a program based on a constructed control flow graph CFG model of a program to be tested, and calculating a definition-use pair in the program; defining afitness function based on a dominance relationship, and generating a test case set meeting the all-uses criterion by utilizing a multi-objective-oriented genetic algorithm. The test case generation method has the beneficial effects that an effective test case generation method is provided for the all-uses data flow test criterion. A fitness function based on a dominance relationship is defined, the existence possibility of killing definitions is considered in analyzing the coverage degree of a test case on the definition-use pair, and the sequence of definition nodes and use nodes in an execution path is considered; the genetic algorithm can be more effectively guided to search out the test cases covering all definition-use pairs in an input domain, so that the all-uses test criterion is met.

column12: Power distribution network situation awareness method based on cubature Kalman filter optimization neural network
column13: The invention discloses a power distribution network situation awareness method based on a cubature Kalman filter optimized neural network, and belongs to the technical field of power distribution network situation awareness, and the method comprises the steps: collecting the historical data and information of a power distribution network, and screening out high influence factors affecting the situation awareness of the power distribution network through employing an analytic hierarchy process; taking a training set in a high influence factor set of power distribution network situation awareness as input of a neural network, and constructing a wavelet neural network model; constructing an improved wavelet neural network model based on volume Kalman filtering, taking a node connection weight of the wavelet neural network model as a state parameter of a volume Kalman filter, and updating the weight in the wavelet neural network by using a volume Kalman filtering algorithm; and verifying the accuracy and reliability of the wavelet neural network model improved based on the volume Kalman filter by using test set data in the historical data set. According to the invention, rapidity and accuracy of situation awareness of the power distribution network can be improved.

column12: Method for improving elastic stability of pneumatic servo
column13: The invention discloses a design method for improving the elastic stability of an aerodynamic servo. The method comprises the steps: correcting a body elastic model and a transfer function through employing a whole-plane ground resonance test or whole-plane ground structure modal coupling test data design optimization technology, and then improving the elastic stability of the aerodynamic servo through employing a flight control law dynamic parameter adjustment technology; the aerodynamic force, the structural elasticity and the coupling relation between control systems can be well considered,so that the flight quality requirement, the stability margin requirement of the control systems and the pneumatic servo elastic stability requirement are met within the full envelope range, and the method is already applied and verified in the multi-control-surface unmanned aerial vehicle. The problem that the pneumatic servo elastic stability of a multi-control-surface unmanned aerial vehicle isdifficult to control is solved.

column12: Visual detection device and method for depth of depth control hole
column13: The invention relates to a depth control hole depth visual detection device, which comprises a detection module arranged on a PCB production process edge, the detection module is a visual hole module, and the production of the visual hole module comprises the following steps: S1, data design, including visual hole design, and designing at least one visual hole at the position of the production process edge; the depth control holes are designed, specifically, a plurality of depth control holes corresponding to the cutter diameters of the in-process plate are designed according to the in-process plate, and the depth control holes are distributed on the edge of the visible hole with the circle center of the visible hole as the center; and S2, copper surface reservation design: reserving a copper layer on each layer of board at the position of a production process edge. The visual detection device for the depth of the depth control hole has the advantages of being ingenious in conception, saving working procedures, improving efficiency and quality and the like.

column12: Pressure test ball, method for accurately testing bottom hole pressure in light casing fracturing and application of pressure test ball and method for accurately testing bottom hole pressure in light casing fracturing
column13: The invention provides a pressure testing ball, a method for accurately testing bottom hole pressure in light casing fracturing and application, the pressure testing ball comprises an inner core and an outer side wrapping the inner core, the inner core is in a hollow sphere shape, and a pressure meter is arranged in the inner core. The testing method comprises the following steps: 1, marking pressure testing balls of all sections according to the number of fractured partial pressure sections of the horizontal well; 2, putting a first-stage pressure test ball from a wellhead, and recording bottom hole pressure data in the fracturing process; 3, fracturing of the remaining sections and measurement of bottom hole pressure data are completed in sequence; 4, collecting the pressure test balls entering the well on the ground in sequence; 5, reading pressure meter data in each section of pressure test ball; and 6, analyzing and evaluating the fracturing effect by using test data, and further optimizing fracturing parameters. According to the method, the pressure gauge is arranged in the fracturing ball, accurate testing of key parameters such as underground pressure and temperature in the horizontal well volume fracturing construction process is achieved, and a new way is provided for unconventional oil and gas reservoir volume fracturing testing.

column12: HARDWARE RELIABILITY DIAGNOSTICS AND FAILURE DETECTION VIA PARALLEL SOFTWARE COMPUTATION AND COMPARE
column13: Methods, apparatus, and software for hardware reliability diagnostics and failure detection via parallel software computation and compare. Parallel testing is performed on hardware resources such as processor cores, accelerators, and Other Processing Units (XPUs) using test algorithms such as encryption/decryption. The results of the testing (the algorithm outputs) are compared to detect errant hardware. Comparison may be across cores (via execution of software-based algorithms), across accelerators/XPUs (via algorithms implement in hardware) or between cores and accelerators/XPUs. Techniques are disclosed to enable all cores to be tested while a platform is performing a workload, such as in a data center environment, wherein unused cores are used for testing, with workloads being migrated between cores between tests.

column12: SYSTEMS, METHODS AND DEVICES FOR ASSESSING HEARING
column13: Described embodiments generally relate to a method of assessing the hearing of a subject. The method comprises presenting a first aural stimulus to the subject; presenting a second aural stimulus to the subject, the second aural stimulus being different to the first aural stimulus; receiving at least one physiological response signal relating to the second aural stimulus received by the subject; comparing at least one parameter related to the at least one physiological response signal with a control parameter; and determining an auditory discrimination response of the subject based on the outcome of the comparison.

column12: Modeling and analyzing method for primary frequency modulation of pressurized water reactor nuclear power unit
column13: The invention relates to a modeling and analyzing method for primary frequency modulation of a pressurized water reactor nuclear power unit, which comprises the following steps of: analyzing mutual influence factors among parameters in a primary frequency modulation action process according to a primary frequency modulation action principle of the nuclear power unit, and giving a model structure among the parameters in combination with an operation mechanism, and meanwhile, according to a primary frequency modulation application range, selecting a typical working point, performing a characteristic test, using test data to carry out parameter identification on the model, building a primary frequency modulation dynamic model near the typical working point, performing simulation analysis through the established primary frequency modulation dynamic model, and evaluating the primary frequency modulation performance and the influence on the safety performance of the unit. Compared with the prior art, the modeling method provided by the invention has the advantages of being simple and convenient in modeling, capable of more accurately reproducing actual operation characteristics and the like.

column12: New energy BMS hardware-in-loop test case library establishing method
column13: The invention discloses a new energy BMS hardware-in-loop test case library establishment method. The method comprises the following steps: step 1, establishing a hardware-in-loop test project in hardware-in-loop simulation test software, step 2, performing block management on the project by adopting different storage spaces respectively to prevent data overlapping; step 3, establishing a BMS hardware-in-loop test case library by using test case execution software; step 4, according to the BMS hardware-in-loop test requirements, forming a BMS hardware-in-loop test sequence by each test case ofthe BMS hardware-in-loop test case management file in the step 3, and defining a testing sequence as well as the cycle index of each test case. According to the invention, the test software, the testhardware, the model and the test case are defined respectively to prevent any one of the items going wrong and thus the test is protected from being affected; and the error correction is also facilitated.

column12: Test scene generation method and device, electronic equipment and computer storage medium
column13: The invention provides a test scene generation method and device, electronic equipment and a computer storage medium, and the method comprises the steps: firstly, for each user using tested software, obtaining user operation information of the user; then, correlation analysis is conducted on every two functions in the tested software according to the user operation information of the user, and an analysis result is obtained; carrying out statistics on the typical user operation and the atypical user operation to obtain a use scene of the tested software, and a use frequency of the typical user operation and a use frequency of the atypical user operation in the use scene of the tested software; and finally, generating a test scene of the tested software according to the use scene of the tested software, and the use frequency of the typical user operation and the use frequency of the atypical user operation in the use scene of the tested software. The generated test scene can be more targeted, and noise data generated by misoperation of a user under a large data volume can be effectively eliminated.
column14: CHINESE AGRICULTURAL BANK STOCK LTD COMPANY

column12: ERROR IDENTIFICATION AND MODEL UPDATE METHOD THROUGH INFORMATION MATRIX-BASED TRIAL DESIGN
column13: Provided is a method for identifying an error and updating a model, capable of minimizing an unknown parameter estimation error through a test design based on an information matrix. In accordance with one embodiment of the present invention, the method for identifying an error and updating a model includes: a step in which an unknown parameter determination part included in an error identification and model update system checks whether an unknown parameter exists in an analysis model; a step in which when the unknown parameter exists, an information matrix-based test design part included in the error identification and model update system performs a test design based on an information matrix with respect to a test model; a step in which a model correction part included in the error identification and model update system estimates a value of the unknown parameter by using test data acquired through the test design based on the information matrix; and a step in which a model verification part included in the error identification and model update system verifies the analysis model by using the test data.

column12: Visual PICC simulation teaching model
column13: The utility model relates to a visual PICC simulation teaching model, which comprises a human body upper half body simulation model, a right upper limb model connected with the human body upper half body simulation model and a silica gel heart model arranged at the left side heart front area of the human body upper half body simulation model, and is characterized in that the visual PICC simulationteaching model is also provided with a silica gel vein network; the silica gel vein network comprises an upper right vena cava, a precious vein, a head vein and an elbow median vein, the precious vein, the head vein and the elbow median vein are arranged on the surface of the upper right limb and communicated with the upper right vena cava, a PICC catheter is implanted in the precious vein, and the human body upper half body simulation model is in a half-section state. Wherein the silica gel heart model is exposed out of the front area of the left side heart, the right upper vena cava is communicated with the silica gel heart model, and the back face is a plane. The visual PICC teaching aid is of a visual design, is clear in structure, facilitates PICC teaching practice, and helps medicalstaff to improve professional skills of PICC maintenance.

column12: MODEL COMPARISON WITH UNKNOWN METRIC IMPORTANCE
column13: A method includes generating first metric data by executing a test suite on a first version of a software model; generating second metric data by executing the test suite on a second version of the software model; generating first and second version principal components that represent the first and second metric data by executing a dimension reduction technique on the first and second metric data; determining at least one control limit based on at least one of the first version principal components; determining a mean value of one of the second version principal components; determining whether the second version of the software model performs within at least one control limit by comparing the mean value to the at least one control limit; and notifying a user of the results of the determining whether the second version of the software model performs within the at least one control limit.

column12: All-weather inspection robot based on voiceprint detection technology
column13: The invention provides an all-weather inspection robot based on a voiceprint detection technology, and the robot comprises a detection module which carries out the grid unit differentiation of a pipe network road environment and a non-junction R-structure environment, achieves the posture control through the calculation and analysis of a digital diagram through a cooperation terminal behavior planner, generates an environment in real time, and carries out the rear-end optimization; the obstacle avoidance module is used for constraining and calculating an optimal convex polygon of the robot in a convex polygon area by training a double-layer calculation structure and combining with a relaxation neural network model, and ensuring the safety of a machine or an inspection unit; the deformable differential base is used for carrying out real-time attitude equal-proportion state calculation through an R-chieve algorithm so as to realize three-dimensional space sensing and positioning of indoor and outdoor switching conditions of a slope; and the terminal interconnection system is used for carrying out visual design on a machine real-time terminal and a control network, and designing and adjusting a double-cross-shaft Ackerman chassis and a self-adaptive suspension. According to the invention, scene construction can be carried out in real time for full-dimensional dynamic and static obstacle avoidance, and the inspection safety is greatly improved.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR HOUSING ANTENNAS
column13: A multiple radio and/or multi antenna chassis is described in some embodiments, along with methods of operation, and non-transitory computer readable media storing machine interpretable instructions to be executed on a processor to perform the methods of operation. Variants are described having regard to the use of one or more of the antennas for establishing bonded connections whereby one or more subsets of the antennas are coordinated to operate in concert to operate one or more connections for data packet transmission while reducing energy loss issues as between operating antennas. The approaches described herein can operate, for example, with a plurality of wideband antennas to provide a multi modem communications device that can be coupled to a master / primary data communications device.

column12: Method and device for acquiring optimized parameters of static closing force of sliding door
column13: The invention relates to a sliding door static closing force optimization parameter obtaining method and device, and relates to the technical field of vehicle design, and the method comprises the following steps: building a sliding door three-dimensional model based on sliding door design data information, and obtaining a closing instant motion instantaneous center; segmenting a sealing strip of the three-dimensional model of the sliding door according to a force arm change condition on the three-dimensional model of the sliding door to obtain a plurality of sealing strip sub-segments; obtaining each stress point and stress direction of the three-dimensional model of the sliding door based on the instantaneous center of the closing instantaneous motion and the plurality of sealing strip sub-sections, and constructing a moment balance model; based on a moment balance model, contributions of the static closing force and a plurality of counterforces to the static closing force are obtained. The static closing force of the sliding door is calculated, evaluated and optimized in the data design stage, the problem that in the prior art, the static closing force of the sliding door needs to be evaluated and adjusted in the real vehicle stage is solved, part molds such as sliding door sealing strips are prevented from being modified, and the project development cost and period are saved.
column15: LIU HAILU;;ZUO JUNFENG;;DAI LEHONG;;ZHANG ZHE;;LI WEIPING

column12: Reliability evaluation method, device and equipment for success and failure products in case of failure and medium
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of reliability evaluation, and provides a method, a device, equipment and a medium for evaluating the reliability of a success-failure product in case of failure aiming at the reliability evaluation problem of the success-failure product under multiple stresses, so that the reliability of the success-failure product can be evaluated under the condition of failure in the test or use process of the success-failure product. The reliability of the success and failure product is further evaluated by constructing a multi-stress nonlinear model of the success and failure product and determining the model and estimating model parameters by using test data of the success and failure product. The calculation steps are clear, and the problem that an existing success and failure type reliability evaluation method does not consider multiple stresses is solved.
column14: CHINESE PEOPLE LIBERATION ARMY AND NATIONAL DEFENSE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY UNIV

column12: Safety technology protection engineering design system and method
column13: The invention discloses a security technology protection engineering design system and method, and relates to the technical field of security technology protection engineering. The operation content of a user in a temporary simulation interval and the temporary simulation interval are encrypted through an encryption module. Firstly, the temporary simulation interval is marked, and a first encryption key is generated, so that the temporary simulation interval is encrypted; then operation content of the user in the temporary simulation interval is marked, and a second encryption key is generated, so that the operation content of the user in the temporary simulation interval is encrypted. The temporary simulation interval used by the user can be directly protected by setting a first encryption key, and therefore external opening is prevented; meanwhile, the operation content in the temporary simulation interval is protected through the second encryption key, so that the operation content in the temporary simulation interval is prevented from being leaked, and the confidentiality of the content designed by the user can be effectively improved by arranging the encryption module.

column12: Method, device and system for generating training course content, configuration and simulation
column13: The embodiment of the invention provides a training course content, configuration and simulation generation method, device and system, and the training course content design method comprises the steps: aiming at a specific node of training course content, employing a plurality of candidate teaching theory models corresponding to the specific node, generating a child node set of the specific node according to the training demand information corresponding to the specific node; for each tail end branch node of the training course content, determining a target training template corresponding to the tail end branch node according to a plurality of preset training link templates corresponding to the tail end branch node and training demand information corresponding to the tail end branch node, and generating at least one leaf node of the tail end branch node according to the target training link template, and binding the target training link template to the tail end branch node.

column12: Lightweight optimization method for sound insulation pad
column13: The invention discloses a lightweight optimization method for a sound insulation pad. The method comprises the following steps: 1, performing thickness quantitative analysis on a sound insulation pad, dividing the sound insulation pad into a plurality of sound insulation areas with different thicknesses, and representing corresponding thickness intervals by taking a quantitative thickness value as a central value; 2, establishing an optimization equation set by adopting a Lagrange multiplier method; 3, setting a performance equivalent thickness value according to sound insulation performance requirements, and setting an area proportion constraint condition according to the arrangement space; and 4, solving according to the area proportion constraint condition and the optimization equation set in the step 2 to obtain the optimal solution of the area proportion pi of the ith sound insulation area. According to the method, the optimal sound insulation pad thickness distribution can be quickly obtained in the design stage according to the performance target and the constraint condition, and a product engineer is guided to carry out data design.
column15: LIU CONGGUANG;;YANG LIANG;;WAN YUPING;;ZHANG SIWEN;;WANG SEN

column12: Rigidity evaluation method for rear bumper of passenger car
column13: The invention discloses a passenger car rear bumper rigidity evaluation method, and belongs to the technical field of rear bumper rigidity evaluation, and the method comprises the steps: confirming the flanging length L2 of a rear bumper; according to the size of L2, the diameter S of the force application pressing column is selected; confirming the position of the stress point of the rear bumper in the left-right direction of the vehicle; confirming the position of the stress point of the rear bumper in the front-back direction of the vehicle; according to the size of the flanging length L2 of the rear bumper, corresponding application gravity, application speed and holding time are selected, and the deformation of the flanging of the rear bumper in the vertical direction is recorded and evaluated; according to the method, the local rigidity of the rear bumper is evaluated in a data design stage or a real object stage, so that the bearable gravity of the rear bumper is evaluated, and the problems of local deformation of the rear bumper, even falling of a fixing structure of the rear bumper and a vehicle body and the like in actual use of a vehicle delivery user are avoided.

column12: SYSTEM FOR REVERSELY EXTRAPOLATING OPTIMAL SINGLE MANEUVERING HYDRODYNAMIC DERIVATIVES BY USING THE SEA TRIAL TEST INFORMATION ACCORDING TO PLURAL MANEUVERING MODE
column13: According to the present invention, a reverse estimation system for an optimal single control fluid power derivative using test run results in a plurality of control modes comprises: a control simulation module (110) using an estimation control fluid power derivative calculated based on an empirical formula in accordance with basic data of a ship model for MIB control performance evaluation as an input value to derive first control performance information in a plurality of control modes through a control equation of motion; and an optimization module (120) linked to the control simulation module (110) to acquire an estimation control fluid power derivative set for each control mode satisfying a specific error range by a script defining a relative error between the first control performance information and second control performance information by test run results in the plurality of control modes, and reversely estimating an optimal single control fluid power derivative following all the test run results in the plurality of control modes. The optimal single control fluid power derivative corresponding to a single ship model can be acquired.

column12: Anti-pattern detection in extraction and deployment of a microservice
column13: Disclosed are various embodiments for anti-pattern detection in extraction and deployment of a microservice. A software modernization service is executed to analyze a computing application to identify various applications. When one or more of the application components are specified to be extracted as an independently deployable subunit, anti-patterns associated with deployment of the independently deployable subunit are determined prior to extraction. Anti-patterns may include increases in execution time, bandwidth, network latency, central processing unit (CPU) usage, and memory usage among other anti-patterns. The independently deployable subunit is selectively deployed separate from the computing application based on the identified anti-patterns.

column12: Water vapor correction precision analysis method under different sea conditions based on microwave radiation
column13: The invention discloses a water vapor correction precision analysis method under different sea conditions based on microwave radiation. Firstly, factors influencing determination of water vapor correction precision are deduced by a water vapor correction model, wherein the factors comprise sea conditions, brightness temperature measurement values of the frequency, brightness temperature values of other frequencies and brightness temperature measurement precision. Numerical simulation is carried out on brightness temperature measurement values through a brightness temperature determination theoretical model, and an error propagation coefficient is calculated by traversing a brightness temperature measurement value range; and finally calculating the water vapor correction precision under different sea conditions. Compared with a water vapor correction precision analysis method obtained by using test data in the prior art, the method considers more comprehensive and finer problems, the water vapor correction precision under different sea conditions is obtained, and a solution is provided for realizing fine determination of satellite altimetry precision under different sea conditions.

column12: Method and system for tuning a musculoskeletal model
column13: A computer-implemented method and system for modifying a musculoskeletal model is provided. Test data for a set of ergonomic tests performed by a number of test subjects fitting a profile is obtained. A number of muscle parameters for a number of muscles in the musculoskeletal model are adjusted using the test data to modify the musculoskeletal model to adapt to the profile.

column12: Motion sensing nuisance fauna deterrent
column13: A motion sensing nuisance fauna deterrent is provided for abating animal nuisances from disturbing a target flora. A sensing platform having a fixed base portion provides a stationary support platform. A rotating base platform has proximity detection sensors positioned about a periphery for proving non-contact proximity sensing capable of detecting a nuisance animal. A speaker provides an audible output in response to an actuation initiated the proximity sensors. A decoy secured to the platform is in the form of a canine. By placing at a detection perimeter and directed outward, an approach of a nuisance animal initiates an audible alarm to deter the approach of the nuisance animal with a non-lethal effect. The instant abstract is neither intended to define the invention disclosed in this specification nor intended to limit the scope of the invention in any way.

column12: Depression detection method based on natural language processing and time sequence convolutional network
column13: The invention provides a depression detection method based on natural language processing and a time sequence convolutional network. The method specifically comprises the steps: constructing a training sample set and a depression word library, the training sample set being text information correspondingly converted from the voice of interviews, and the depression word library being artificially made; converting text information in the training sample set and the depression word library into text embedding vectors; inputting the text embedding vector into a time sequence convolutional network TCN for training to obtain a depression prediction model; based on the obtained depression prediction model, performing prediction by using test data to obtain a prediction result; and classifying the interviews according to a prediction result, and determining whether the interviews belong to depression users or not. According to the method, a natural language processing technology is used, and speech information associated with a topic scene is added; and the sequential convolutional network TCN is used for processing the sequential data in a convolution mode, high precision is achieved, and the text-based depression detection method is achieved.
column14: HANGZHOU YIDIAN INTELLIGENT TECH CO LTD

column12: Main cylinder hydraulic pressure estimation method based on EHB self characteristics
column13: The invention relates to a main cylinder hydraulic pressure estimation method based on EHB self characteristics, which comprises the following steps: 1) establishing a kinetic equation of an EHB system, testing sliding friction force of the EHB under a pressurization working condition and a decompression working condition, and obtaining test data; (2) according to the transmission principle of a transmission mechanism in the EHB, obtaining a theoretical model of sliding friction force; 3) fitting parameters of the sliding friction force theoretical model by using test data to obtain a sliding friction force model of the EHB; 4) performing derivation on the kinetic equation of the EHB, making the rack speed to be zero, and obtaining a static friction force model of the EHB; 5) combining the static friction force of the EHB with the sliding friction force model of the EHB, and establishing a coulomb friction model adaptive to the torque of the motor; and 6) estimating the hydraulic pressure of the main cylinder by utilizing the established model and combining a kinetic equation of the EHB. Compared with the prior art, the method has the advantages of good robustness and the like.

column12: Electronic component test structure and equipment
column13: The invention discloses an electronic component test structure and equipment, and the structure comprises a housing, the top of the housing is provided with a test groove, the side surface of the housing is movably provided with a test rod which can be inserted into the test groove, and the side, located at the test groove, of the top of the housing is provided with a test piece. A controller is installed at the top of the shell and located on one side of the test piece, the test rod and the test piece are both electrically connected with the controller, and a remote transmitter is installed in the shell; the beneficial effects of the invention are that the data tested by the test piece can be transmitted to the terminal through the remote transmitter, thereby further improving the convenience of use; test data can be stored and backed up by inserting a USB flash disk into a transmission port; through the alarm lamp and the horn mouth of the buzzer, the alarm performance when a fault occurs is improved; the electric push rod works, so that the test element is ejected out, and the efficiency of taking out the test element is improved; and the protection cover covering the shell is used for increasing the protection on the test piece and the test groove.
column14: NANJING YONGLAI HOLDING GROUP CO LTD

column12: Test management method, platform, medium and equipment
column13: The invention discloses a test management method, a platform, a medium and equipment. The method comprises the following steps: performing test preparation of demand analysis, a performance target, application software, a deployment platform, a load model and a project plan on a bank system; after the test preparation is completed, establishing a test environment of the bank system; compiling a performance test script and importing the performance test script into the test management platform; and selecting a performance test script matched with the target bank system from the test management platform, and performing performance test on the target bank system by using test data generated by the performance test tool. According to the invention, an integrated pluggable platform system for performance testing can be incubated, the working efficiency of people is improved, the cost is saved for enterprises, and more values are created for the enterprises.

column12: Low-conductivity working solution for optimizing neural network based on genetic algorithm and design method
column13: The invention relates to a low-conductivity working solution for optimizing a neural network based on a genetic algorithm and a design method, and solves the problems of long design and development period, high cost and poor processing effect in the prior art. The formula of the working solution can be scientifically and effectively optimized, so that the processing efficiency and the processing quality are improved, and the production cost is reduced. Comprising the following steps: collecting data, and obtaining an optimal weight and threshold parameter of a multi-layer perceptron neural network through a genetic algorithm; constructing a multi-layer perceptron neural network, and training a multi-layer perceptron neural network model; and verifying the neural network model obtained by training by using test set data to obtain a final accurate model, and searching a low-conductivity and high-oxidation-resistance working solution formula by using the final accurate model. The method has good prediction accuracy, the machining efficiency of electrolytic electric spark combined machining and the surface quality of the machined workpiece are improved on the premise that the development period is shortened, and the production cost is reduced.
column14: UNIV XIAN TECHNOLOGICAL;;HUNAN HANGTIAN CHENGYUAN PREC MACHINERY CO LTD

column12: Undercarriage aerodynamic characteristic identification method based on test flight
column13: The invention discloses an undercarriage aerodynamic characteristic identification method based on test flight, and the method comprises the steps: firstly collecting test flight state points and test flight data through test flight; then, the aerodynamic coefficient of the aircraft is calculated through a rigid body kinematics equation; identifying the pneumatic data of the aircraft landing gear by using a least square method; and finally, establishing a nonlinear model of the aerodynamic characteristics of the undercarriage, and checking a result. According to the method, the problem that variable control among the position, the angle of attack and the Mach number of the undercarriage cannot be implemented in the process of modeling the aerodynamic characteristics of the undercarriage by using test flight is solved, and compared with a traditional linear model, the result accuracy is obviously improved; besides, the invention provides a simple and reliable undercarriage model accuracy checking method, and the accuracy of the model obtained by the method can be simply and quickly verified, so that a result reliability judgment standard is provided; the method is high in universality, suitable for various aircraft models with retractable undercarriage devices, simple in algorithm and easy to program and implement.
column15: CAI XIANGQUN;;LI WEIQI;;DAI SHULING;;ZHAO YONGJIA;;LEI XIAOYONG

column12: Method and device for detecting abnormal core in graphics processor and electronic equipment
column13: The embodiment of the invention discloses a method and a device for detecting abnormal hardware in a graphics processing unit and electronic equipment, which can effectively avoid blockage caused by abnormity of a hardware processing unit when the graphics processing unit runs, and can recover the working state of the hardware processing unit when the hardware processing unit returns to normal. And the task processing efficiency of the graphics processor is improved. The detection method comprises the following steps: when the graphics processor is powered on, initializing the graphics processor; if initialization is normal, the main control core is controlled to use test case data, whether a hardware processing unit in the graphics processor runs abnormally or not is periodically detected, and the test case data is used for detecting the running state of the hardware processing unit; if the hardware processing unit runs abnormally, controlling the main control core to suspend task distribution to the hardware processing unit; and when detecting that the hardware processing unit returns to normal in any subsequent period, controlling the main control core to recover to perform task distribution to the hardware processing unit.
column14: SHENLIUWEI INTELLIGENT TECH SHENZHEN CO LTD

column12: High-precision self-correcting IRIG-B (AC) code modulation device and method
column13: The invention relates to a high-precision self-correcting IRIG-B (AC) code modulation device and method, which are used for synchronous satellite navigation signals and outputting B (AC) codes with phase deviation superior to 100ns. The device comprises a satellite navigation information processing unit, a clock unit, a coding unit, a decoding unit, a modulation unit, a zero-cross detection unit, a signal processing unit, a signal conversion unit, a data acquisition unit and a self-correcting unit. In a long-distance B code time service application environment, after a time service cable or an interface is replaced, link delay is corrected through the self-correcting interface, the usability, testability and maintainability of time service equipment are improved, and the method has a higher practical application value.
column14: CHINA SHIPBUILDING IND CORP NO 707 RES INST

column12: Construction method using foam lightweight concrete as foundation pit backfill material
column13: The invention discloses a construction method using foam lightweight concrete as a foundation pit backfill material, which comprises the following steps of: carrying out field investigation and slope surface treatment, carrying out foam lightweight concrete backfill material proportioning test in combination with geological exploration data, design requirements and economical efficiency, determining the foam lightweight concrete mix proportion, and carrying out foundation pit backfill material proportioning test. The method comprises the following steps: determining the length of a construction section and the thickness of a pouring layer according to the scale of a construction working face and the allocation condition of constructors, and according to design data, if an overlying structure and the thickness of a structure layer subtracted from the elevation of the top surface of the structure are the backfill elevation and are larger than or equal to the sum of the tunnel structure elevation and 0.5 m, if no overlying structure exists, reducing 0.7 m according to the ground elevation and the backfill elevation is not larger than 0.5 m. And the height is greater than or equal to the sum of the tunnel structure elevation and 0.5 m. The load-reducing layer is formed by the foam lightweight concrete, has the characteristics of flexible construction, good fluidity, low density and good load-reducing effect, and can effectively reduce the influence of load on the underground structure and prolong the service life of the underground structure.

column12: Processing method for improving alignment precision of cover film
column13: The invention discloses a processing method for improving the alignment precision of a cover film. The method is suitable for a flexible circuit board and comprises the following steps: preprocessingproduction materials to obtain a semi-finished FPC, including material design, cutting and drilling operation; wherein the data design is to perform field-shaped jointed board small unit design on theproduction data, and the size of each small unit is less than or equal to 120mm * 150mm; performing black shadow operation and dry film pasting operation on the semi-finished FPC, and then performingexposure and development to obtain an FPC to be selectively plated; carrying out selective plating operation and film stripping operation on the FPC to be subjected to selective plating to obtain theFPC subjected to selective copper plating; manufacturing a circuit on the surface of the FPC subjected to copper selective plating, conducting punching operation, specifically, conducting punching through reflected light, and obtaining the punched FPC; attaching a plurality of surface films to the surface of the jig in sequence, each surface film sequentially comprising green silica gel, a bottom-layer covering film, a punched FPC and a top-layer covering film, conducting pressing through a cover plate with the temperature, and obtaining the special jig; and the special jig being subjected tohot-pressing pressing and plate baking after being subjected to cold pressing.
column14: ZHUHAI KINWONG FLEXIBLE CIRCUIT CO LTD

column12: Customized fast moving consumer goods production system
column13: A manufacturing method for customized fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) comprising the production of the customized goods in a main production process stream or a side stream. The method further comprises temporarily storing the customized goods in a side stream process and subsequently re-inserting said goods into the main production process stream. The customized goods may be finally packaged in a dedicated pack or in a pack that also contains non-customized goods. The method is suitable for, but not limited to, articles such as diapers, absorbent products, tissues and other hygienic products.

column12: Optoelectronic solar cell test system for an in-line solar cell production plant, and method for optimising the in-line production of solar cells using an optoelectronic solar cell test system of this type
column13: The invention relates to an optoelectronic solar cell test system for an in-line solar cell production plant, the solar cell test system having: an exposure- and measuring device (10) for in-line measurement of solar cells and a control- and evaluation unit (20) coupled to the exposure- and measuring device (10), the exposure- and measuring device (10) being designed and configured to carry out one or more test measurements (TM) for generating test measurement data, on a solar cell (SC). According to the invention, the control- and evaluation unit (20) is configured and designed to carry out statistical analyses (200), using test measurement data from identical test measurements (TM) undertaken by the exposure- and measuring device (10) on a plurality of solar cells (SC) produced in-line, and to correlate statistical analyses (200) of test measurement data from different test measurements (TM) with one another, and/or to correlate statistical analyses of test measurement data (TMstat) with statistical analyses of production measurement data (PMstat), and/or to correlate statistical analyses of test measurement data (TMstat) and/or statistical analyses of production measurement data (PMstat) with production input data (PED), in order to generate correlation results (201), and to derive, from the correlation results (201), on the basis of derivation rules (202), at least one action recommendation (203) and/or at least one action instruction (204) which are assigned to at least one personnel group (PG1, PG2, PGn) responsible for the in-line production of the solar cells, wherein the control- and evaluation unit (20) has a communication device (21) which transmits the at least one action recommendation (203) and/or the at least one action instruction (204) to the at least one assigned personnel group (PG1, PG2, PGn). The invention also relates to a method for optimising the production of solar cells by means of an in-line solar cell production plant, using a solar cell test system of this type.

column12: Asphalt concrete performance tester
column13: The utility model particularly relates to an asphalt concrete performance tester. The asphalt concrete performance tester comprises a machine body assembly, a test assembly and a simulation assembly, the machine body assembly comprises a box body, a feeding and discharging opening formed in the lower portion of the box body, a first hinge base installed in the box body, a lifting machine hinged to the first hinge base, a rotating machine arranged at the driving end of the lifting machine, an installation frame connected to the driving end of the rotating machine and a hydraulic rod installed at the bottom of the installation frame. Through the test assembly and the simulation assembly, the servo motor can be utilized to drive the mounting disc to rotate to quickly replace the used test head, shutdown replacement is not needed, meanwhile, the simulation assembly can spray a material influencing friction force onto concrete through a spray head, clear water cleaning is performed after one-time test is completed, and the test efficiency is improved. And then different materials are replaced for continuous testing, so that abundant test data can be obtained in a short time, and the research and development efficiency of the asphalt concrete is effectively improved.
column14: WUHAN KUNDA ENG COST CONSULTATION CO LTD

column12: Auxiliary test assembly for testing performance of finish rolling deformed steel bar connector
column13: The utility model discloses an auxiliary test assembly for detecting the performance of a finish rolling deformed steel bar connector, which comprises a finish rolling deformed steel bar connector performance detection device (1) and an auxiliary test assembly connected with the finish rolling deformed steel bar connector performance detection device (1) to complete work. The auxiliary test assembly comprises a first test auxiliary component (2), a jack (3) and a second test auxiliary component (4), and the first test auxiliary component (2), the jack (3) and the second test auxiliary component (4) are sequentially arranged and installed in a split mode from front to back. The test device can be processed on site, is simple to manufacture, verifies whether the quality of the finish rolling thread thick steel bar connector meets the design requirement by using test data, and achieves the purposes of simple field test operation, accurate test data, visual test result, lower cost, reusability, economy, environmental protection, high efficiency and the like of the test device. And the construction safety and the construction quality in the construction process are ensured.
column14: YUNNAN CONSTRUCTION & INVEST HOLDING GROUP CO LTD

column12: Power configuration picture control method and system based on eye movement interaction, electronic equipment and storage medium
column13: The invention provides a power configuration picture control method and system based on eye movement interaction, electronic equipment and a storage medium. The power configuration picture control method comprises the following steps: S1, setting an eye movement tracking system; s2, designing a user interface; s3, collecting eye movement data; s4, preprocessing the eye movement data; s5, eye movement feature extraction; s6, establishing eye movement control mapping; s7, controlling mapping integration; and S8, improving the usability test and control method. According to the method, the eye movement tracking system is arranged, eye movement characteristics are mapped to specific actions or instructions for controlling power configuration pictures, integration of the eye movement tracking system and the power system is achieved, the purpose of controlling the power configuration pictures through eye movement interaction is achieved, a more intuitive and efficient control mode for a complex operation interface of the power system is provided, and the control efficiency is improved. The monitoring and control process is simplified, the operation efficiency of a user on an electric power configuration picture is improved, and the dependence on other input devices is greatly reduced.
column15: SHEN CHAO;;DAI JINXIA;;ZHOU WEI;;MAO MENGGE;;TANG XU;;ZHAO KUN;;HUANG KUN;;LI LEI

column12: Implementation method for automatically matching optimal noise reduction through different wearing states
column13: The invention discloses an implementation method for automatically matching optimal noise reduction through different wearing states, and the method comprises the steps: 1, carrying out the data collection of a detected leakage value through the classification of different genders, head shapes and wearing angles; 2, calculating the leakage amount; thirdly, the ANC under the leakage value is adjusted and optimized, and a leakage compensation model is obtained; 4, writing the established leakage compensation model into the earphone; 5, carrying out the use test of the earphone, and obtaining the compensation parameters of the earphone; and 6, calling the leakage compensation model. Different head forms and wearing postures are used as cardinal number groups, an ANC algorithm is adjusted and optimized through wearing leakage values of each group, ANC compensation is carried out on leakage data, and therefore grouped leakage compensation values are obtained; during production burning, the grouped leakage supplementary values are written into earphone ANC parameters; when a user wears the earphone, leakage compensation detection is started, and therefore the best noise reduction effect can be achieved under different head types and wearing postures.
column15: YANG XINGWANG;;WU MENG;;GAO JUNTAO;;LI BAIJUN;;ZHOU XUEFU

column12: Technological parameter energy-saving optimization method for aluminum die-casting smelting furnace
column13: The invention discloses a technological parameter energy-saving optimization method for an aluminum die-casting smelting furnace. The technological parameter energy-saving optimization method comprises the steps that (1) heat preservation power, melting power, oxidation burning loss, standby and state switching data are obtained through a field test; (2) fitting expressions of heat preservation power, melting power and oxidation burning loss by using test data according to a given form; (3) establishing a model taking minimum heat preservation energy consumption, melting energy consumption andoxidation burning loss cost as optimization objectives, wherein the model comprises heat preservation energy consumption, melting energy consumption and oxidation burning loss calculation; and (4) searching for an optimal parameter combination by using a genetic algorithm, and for a given production plan, inputting plan parameters into the model, so that the parameter combination with the optimalcost can be quickly given. According to the method, the smelting furnace operation parameter combination with the lowest cost can be selected for a given die-casting production plan, and the manufacturing cost can be effectively reduced.
column32: YANFENG ZHANG 等: "Based on energy-saving and emission-reducing control system design of industrial wastes furnace", 《2010 THIRD INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON KNOWLEDGE ACQUISITION AND MODELING》;;黄向阳: "高效节能天然气蓄热式熔炼炉的建设或改造方案", 《有色冶金节能》;;荣辉: "铸造生产中感应熔炼技术的发展与优势", 《现代铸铁》

column12: METHOD FOR DIAGNOSING EXTERNAL SHORT CIRCUIT FAULT OF LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACK ON BASIS OF TWO-STAGE MODEL PREDICTION
column13: Provided by the present invention is a method for diagnosing the external short circuit fault of a lithium-ion battery pack on the basis of two-stage model prediction, which relates to the technical field of lithium-ion power battery safety, comprising: first, carrying out an external short circuit experiment on a lithium-ion battery pack, constructing a two-stage equivalent circuit model for the external short circuit of the battery pack, and using tested experiment data to perform offline optimal identification for battery model parameters; next, determining the battery state in the battery pack when operating according to battery measurement data; marking adjacent battery units which experience abnormality as a whole when discovered that the voltage of part of the batteries experiences a voltage abnormality, denoting same as an abnormal battery pack, starting a first stage battery model, triggering a second stage battery model if the error of the first stage battery model is less than a critical threshold value, and calculating model errors; and finally, conducting fault diagnosis for the abnormal batteries by means of the fitting degree between measured data and the two-stage models. The present method has simple steps, is easy to achieve online, is highly reliable, and is suitable for online fault diagnosis and safe management of an electric vehicle power battery.
column15: CHEN ZEYU;;CAI XUE;;YANG YING;;ZHANG HAO;;ZHANG QING

column12: PREDETERMINING SEPARATE THERMAL CONTROL POINTS FOR CHIPS OF A MULTI-CHIP MODULE
column13: Thermal control of a multi-chip module in an operating environment is facilitated by predetermining separate thermal control points for multiple chips of the multi-chip module, with a first chip and a second chip having different predetermined thermal control points, and saving the predetermined thermal control points for reference by a thermal control of the multi-chip module in an operating environment. The thermal control monitors an operating temperature of the first chip, and compares the operating temperature of the first chip to the predetermined thermal control point of that chip. The thermal control further initiates a control action to control temperature of the first chip based on comparing the operating temperature of the first chip to the predetermined thermal control point of the first chip.
column15: MARZ ERIC;;PETERSON KIRK D;;ABRAMI GREG;;MAHANEY JR HOWARD V;;ANDERL WILLIAM JAMES;;FLUHR ERIC JASON;;ROSEDAHL TODD JON

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR A NEURAL NETWORK
column13: In accordance with an embodiment, a method includes reducing a size of at least one initial parameter of each layer of an initial multilayer neural network to obtain for each layer a set of new parameters defining a new neural network, wherein each new parameter of the set of new parameters has its data represented in two portions comprising an integer portion and a fractional portion; implementing the new neural network using a test input data set applied only once to each layer; determining a distribution function or a density function resulting from the set of new parameters for each layer; and based on the determined distribution function or density function, adjusting a size of a memory area allocated to the fractional portion and a size of the memory area allocated to the integer portion of each new parameter associated with each layer.

column12: Cleaning liquid constant-temperature circulating water bath tank
column13: The utility model discloses a cleaning fluid constant-temperature circulating water bath box which comprises a box body, and the box body is divided into an observation tank and a circulating tank; the observation groove is communicated with the circulating groove through a drain hole, and the drain hole is tightly attached to the bottoms of the observation groove and the circulating groove; a heating pipe is arranged in the observation groove, is U-shaped and is fixed on the side wall of the observation groove; the limiting blocks are symmetrically arranged at the middle section of the side wall of the observation groove; a partition plate is further included, through holes are distributed in the partition plate, and the partition plate is placed on the limiting blocks; the test box is simple and convenient to use, test variables are adjusted by changing different structures of the box body, and accurate production data is provided for production links of final products.
column14: CHANGZHOU HAINER ENVIRONMENTAL TECH CO LTD

column12: SELF-CONTAINED MINIMAL ACTION INVASIVE BLOOD CONSTITUENT SYSTEM
column13: A minimal action, invasive blood constituent device can streamline the process for the self-monitoring of blood-related tests by holding and facilitating the use of some or all of the tools for obtaining and testing a blood sample. The device can include a slider, that when pumped, causes the device to spring-load a lancet and eject a testing strip. The device can include a trigger that, when pressed, activates the lancet by unloading the spring. A strip-lancet apparatus can combine the roles of two disposable products—a testing strip and a lancing needle—into an apparatus that can be configured for piercing the testing site as well as receiving the blood sample. A testing strip apparatus can facilitate the use and/or disposal of testing strips. A lancet apparatus can facilitate the use and/or disposal of lancets.
column15: OLSEN GREGORY A;;LEE SAI KONG FRANK;;VO HUNG THE;;PAULEY KEVIN HUGHES

column12: System and method for determining a change of a customary vehicle driver
column13: A system and method for determining a change of a customary vehicle driver that include receiving and storing vehicle sensor data from a vehicle for at least one predetermined period of time. The system and method also include determining a vehicle driving pattern for the at least one predetermined period of time based on the vehicle sensor data and determining if there is a change in the customary vehicle driver based on a comparison of a real-time vehicle sensor data with the vehicle driving pattern. The system and method further include controlling at least one vehicle system by executing vehicle settings associated with at least one of: the customary vehicle driver and a newly designated customary vehicle driver based on if the change is determined in the customary vehicle driver.

column12: METHOD AND PROCESS FOR PREDICTING AND ANALYZING PATIENT COHORT RESPONSE, PROGRESSION, AND SURVIVAL
column13: A system and method for analyzing a data store of de-identified patient data to generate one or more dynamic user interfaces usable to predict an expected response of a particular patient population or cohort when provided with a certain treatment. The automated analysis of patterns occurring in patient clinical, molecular, phenotypic, and response data, as facilitated by the various user interfaces, provides an efficient, intuitive way for clinicians to evaluate large data sets to aid in the potential discovery of insights of therapeutic significance.
column32: Kopcke et al., Evaluation of data completeness in the electronic health record for the purpose of patient recruitment into clinical trials: a retrospective analysis of element presence, 2013, BMC Medical Informatics and Decision Making 13:37 (Year: 2013);;Nasir et al., A New Paradigm to Analyze Data Completeness of Patient Data, 2016, Applied Clinical Informatics (Year: 2016);;Weber et al., Biases introduced by filtering electronic health records for patients with 'complete data', August 2017, Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association, 24(6) (Year: 2017)

column12: BATTERY MODULE TESTING
column13: Testing of a battery module can be conducted using monitoring electronics attached to the battery module. Stimulus can be applied to the battery module and removed. After removal of the stimulus, the monitoring electronics can collect signals from the monitoring electronics reflecting parameters of the battery module as it relaxes back to a non-stimulated state. The stimulus can be provided by test equipment or by components of a system in which the battery module, having attached monitoring electronics, is implemented. The monitoring electronics attached to the battery module can provide autonomous recording of signals associated with the battery module that can provide data regarding the status of the battery module or one or more batteries contained in the battery module.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR RECOMMENDING SECURE TRANSFER MEASURES FOR PERSONAL IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION IN INTEGRATION PROCESS DATA TRANSFERS
column13: An information handling system operating a personal identifiable information (PII) recommendation system may comprise a GUI modelling with visual integration elements, an integration process flow for migrating field values comprising PII data, wherein the integration process applies a security measure to migration of PII data, a processor executing code instructions to generate a migrating field value term frequency vector describing a weighted frequency with which a metadata term for the migrating field value appears within a metadata for a migrating dataset comprising the migrating field value, input the term frequency vector into a trained neural network to determine the migrating field value includes PII data, label the migrating field value as PII data, such that the modeled integration process applies the security measure to the migrating field value, and a network interface device transmitting a set of connector code instructions for performing the modeled integration process for remote execution.
column32: Goel et al (“Integration of data analytics with cloud services for safer process systems, application examples and implementation challenges” Oct 2020) (Year: 2020)

column12: Computerized voting system
column13: Officials, Agents and Devices researching, creating lists of Registered Voters, Proxy Voters whom are sent machine readable encoded Documents (Registration, Language choice, Voting Ballots), optional return Containers. Each Document correlated to Receipt(s) via shared unique Random Symbolic Identifier(s), other Security Elements. For voting privacy, Voters exchange Ballots within their Voting Region. Voters complete Document(s), add Personal Security Identifier(s), keep Document Receipt, send Documents to Officials In-Person or by Postal Mail, Delivery Service, Telephone, Fax or Facsimile, Internet, EMail, Interactive Television. Officials receiving Documents provide delivery confirmation. Imaging machines record Documents duplicate images, correlates RSID, stores data. Timely, valid, authentic Documents are machine read via computer software extracting Voter information, selections, Write-In choices, Personal Security Items correlated to Document RSID. Read data stored, published to Voter privately accessible data vault. Completed ballots and Documents tallied for certifying. Official computers running artificial intelligence programs manage data (security, processing, integrity), communications, devices: availability, workload allocation.

column12: Deep convolutional neural network-based power distribution network small current grounding fault cause intelligent identification method and system
column13: The invention discloses a deep convolutional neural network-based power distribution network small current grounding fault cause intelligent identification method and system, and the method comprises the following steps: firstly obtaining a fault waveform through an on-site actual grounding fault and a manual grounding test, and constructing a typical fault scene database training set and a test set; secondly, constructing a deep convolutional neural network; and finally, training optimization is carried out on the constructed neural network by using training set data in the typical fault scene database, the optimized neural network is tested by using test set data, and after the accuracy of a test result meets an application requirement, an input and output mapping vector is packaged to obtain a small-current grounding fault cause identification neural network model. And intelligent identification of the small current grounding fault cause of the power distribution network can be realized. According to the method, the optimized deep convolutional neural network model is utilized to intelligently identify the cause of the small current grounding fault, so that the pertinence of fault line patrol is improved, and the method is of great significance in improving the fault repair efficiency and the power supply reliability.

column12: Method for establishing high-density polyethylene pipeline safety threshold prediction model under action of strong earthquake
column13: The invention provides a method for establishing a high-density polyethylene pipeline safety threshold prediction model under the action of a strong earthquake, and the method comprises the following steps: S1, carrying out the field test of a socket and spigot type high-density polyethylene corrugated pipeline under the action of the strong earthquake, and obtaining the field test data; s2, fitting by using test data to obtain a mathematical prediction model of the interface corner; s3, calculating a vibration speed safety threshold value of the buried high-density polyethylene pipeline under the action of the strong shock load according to an existing polyethylene pipeline construction specification; and S4, establishing a finite element model to verify the mathematical prediction model of the interface corner obtained in the step S2. The method has the beneficial effects that the problem that in the prior art, the damage of the urban buried socket-and-spigot type high-density polyethylene drainage pipeline under the strong shock load effect is difficult to effectively evaluate can be solved; and a scientific and reasonable judgment basis is provided for design and construction of blasting engineering, earthquake structure protection engineering and buried socket type high-density polyethylene drainage pipeline installation engineering.
column15: ZHANG YUQI;;JIANG NAN;;JIA JIANHONG;;ZHOU CHUANBO;;YAO YINGKANG;;MENG XIANZHONG

column12: Intelligent wire harness detection system
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of wire harness monitoring, and particularly discloses and provides a wire harness intelligent detection system which comprises a wire harness information extraction and division module, a wire harness temperature and humidity adaptation detection module, a wire harness vibration adaptation detection module, a database, a wire harness environment adaptation evaluation module and a wire harness evaluation feedback terminal. According to the invention, the to-be-detected wire harness batch is subjected to detection category classification, temperature, humidity and vibration experiment setting is carried out in combination with the automobile model to which the to-be-detected wire harness belongs, and then temperature, humidity and vibration adaptability detection is carried out, so that the environment adaptation index corresponding to the current to-be-detected wire harness batch is evaluated, and the actual use scene of the wire harness is fitted; therefore, the defects existing in current wire harness environmental adaptability detection are effectively overcome, the boundary performance and reliability of experimental data design are further improved, meanwhile, the coverage of wire harness environmental adaptability detection is expanded, and the accuracy and rationality of wire harness environmental adaptability detection are ensured.
column14: CHANGCHUN E PLUS TECH CO LTD

column12: Fuzzy reasoning method for determining design parameters of integrated circuit
column13: The invention discloses a fuzzy reasoning method for determining design parameters of an integrated circuit. The fuzzy reasoning method comprises the following steps: establishing an integrated circuit design database; setting a target performance index of the design parameters of the integrated circuit, and subtracting each performance index in the database from the target performance index to obtain a plurality of performance index error vectors corresponding to each design parameter; calculating the membership degree of the performance index error vector by using a fuzzy reasoning method; and multiplying the membership degree of the performance index error vector by a corresponding design parameter in a database, and summing to obtain an integrated circuit design parameter reaching a target performance index. In order to solve the problem that size parameters of an integrated circuit device are difficult to quickly determine in the research and development process of an integrated circuit chip, a database is established according to integrated circuit design data, design parameters reaching target performance indexes are quickly estimated by utilizing a fuzzy reasoning method, and the method can be applied to integrated circuit design and has high practicability. A new method is provided for shortening the design period of an integrated circuit.

column12: METHODS FOR PREDICTION AND EARLY DETECTION OF DIABETES
column13: The present disclosure is related to the field of diabetes diagnostics. It introduces novel biomarkers that can be used to predict diabetes and detect presence of the disease. In addition, novel fatty acid biomarkers are presented.

column12: Deep network lung texture recogniton method combined with multi-scale attention
column13: The invention discloses a deep network lung texture recognition method combined with multi-scale attention, which belongs to the field of image processing and computer vision. In order to accurately recognize the typical texture of diffuse lung disease in computed tomography (CT) images of the lung, a unique attention mechanism module and multi-scale feature fusion module were designed to construct a deep convolutional neural network combing multi-scale and attention, which achieves high-precision automatic recognition of typical textures of diffuse lung diseases. In addition, the proposed network structure is clear, easy to construct, and easy to implement.
