column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR AUTOMATICALLY DETECTING A CLINICALLY RELEVANT LEAK
column13: This invention concerns a method for automatically detecting a clinically relevant leak and/or inadequate closure following a medical procedure, in a hollow organ (2) residing in the interior volume (4') of a body cavity (4).Wherein said test method comprises the steps of:injecting, via adapted injection means (3) a specific test gas or a gas mixture containing at least one test gas, into said organ(s) (2),analyzing the gas mixture and measuring the concentration of test gas in the interior volume (4') of the body cavity (4) via adapted detection means (5) and at least during a measurement window,evaluating the likelihood of the presence of a leak and its degree of severity, by comparing stored data and realtime data with each other,said test method being characterized in that the pressure difference between the interior of the hollow organ(s) (2) and the interior volume (4') of the body cavity (4) is controlled or mastered at least at a given moment during at least one measurement window, and preferably maintained constant during said window.
column14: INSTITUT HOSPITALO UNIV DE CHIRURGIE MINI INVASIVE GUIDEE PAR LIMAGE

column12: Cross-domain small sample learning method based on layered variational condition transfer neurons
column13: The invention discloses a cross-domain small sample learning method based on hierarchical variation condition transfer neurons. The method comprises the following steps: 1) constructing an initial memory unit set M; 2) randomly initializing a parameter theta of a keyword generation network f, a parameter phi 1 of a query set reasoning network g and a parameter phi 2 of a support set reasoning network g; (3) optimizing the generation process of the memory unit set M and the parameters theta, phi1 and phi2 by using a variational reasoning ELBO lower limit; and 4) after training convergence of the parameters theta, phi1 and phi2, testing by using test data. According to the cross-domain small sample learning method based on the hierarchical variation condition transfer neurons, the cross-domain offset problem can be solved under small samples, the memory unit is constructed on the distribution level, and the generalization performance of the model is enhanced.

column12: Steam-cured concrete strength prediction method and steam-curing parameter optimization method
column13: The invention relates to a steam-cured concrete strength prediction method and a steam-cured parameter optimization method, a model is established by using test data obtained in a laboratory curing environment, and optimization of curing parameters is completed based on response surface method analysis. According to the method, each level of an experiment can be continuously analyzed instead of analyzing independent experiment points one by one, and the influence of each process parameter on the strength and the mutual influence among the process parameters in actual production are fully considered, so that optimization is carried out aiming at the specific process parameters, and the optimization efficiency is greatly improved. And feasible guidance is provided for a concrete curing scheme in actual production. In the whole concrete curing period, through reasonable arrangement of curing parameters, the concrete strength meets the engineering requirements, the strength loss caused by curing is reduced, the energy consumption is minimum, the use is convenient, the effect is good, and good social and economic benefits are achieved.
column14: ROAD & BRIDGE SOUTH CHINA ENGINEERING CO LTD

column12: Well group system comprehensive electricity-to-water coefficient and graded water lifting energy consumption calculation method and device
column13: The invention discloses a comprehensive electricity-to-water conversion coefficient calculation method for a well group system, which comprises the following steps: carrying out water pumping test on N first-stage water lifting pumps and one second-stage water lifting pump, and calculating by using test data to obtain # imgabs0 #, # imgabs1 #, # imgabs2 # and # imgabs3 #, the operation time # imgabs4 # of the first-stage water lifting pump and the operation time # imgabs5 # of the second-stage water lifting pump in the irrigation period are recorded, and the comprehensive electricity-to-water conversion coefficients # imgabs8 # and # imgabs9 # of the well group system are calculated in combination with # imgabs6 # and # imgabs7 #. The invention further provides a comprehensive electricity-to-water conversion coefficient calculation method of the well group system and a related device. According to the method, the underground water mining amount and the graded water lifting energy consumption can be calculated by utilizing the unique electric meter of the well group system.

column12: Limit test method and system for insulation resistance performance of slip ring
column13: The invention provides a limit test method and system for the insulation resistance performance of a slip ring, and the method comprises the steps: loading different environment conditions to a slip ring product, carrying out the performance test of the insulation resistance, and recording the insulation resistance values under different environment conditions, the insulation resistance values measured under different environment conditions are drawn into a curve graph of the relation between the environment conditions and the insulation resistance, and the limit value of the insulation resistance under the corresponding environment conditions is obtained. The performance of the insulation resistor of the slip ring can be systematically studied through test acquisition and comparison and drawing of a related chart, accurate data support is provided for product design, and an important judgment basis is provided for later product use, test, fault judgment and the like. According to the invention, high-reliability and large-batch product design and rapid product delivery are realized, and the reliability of product application performance is improved.
column14: SHANGHAI ELECTRONIC CONTROL RES INSTITUTE OF CHINESE WEAPON EQUIPMENT GROUP

column12: Unmanned ship navigation control parameter intelligent matching method based on deep reinforcement learning
column13: The invention discloses an unmanned ship navigation control parameter intelligent matching method based on deep reinforcement learning, relates to the technical field of unmanned ships, and aims at solving the problem that unmanned ship navigation control parameters are difficult to adjust through designing a reinforcement learning network model based on a near-end strategy optimization method. A control strategy model is automatically learned by using test data, so that a corresponding control strategy can be obtained based on state variable intelligent matching, then navigation control parameters are obtained, self-adaptive matching of the navigation control parameters of different ship types and different environments can be realized, parameter adjustment experience is directly copied to other ship types or environments, and the navigation control parameters can be automatically adjusted. Therefore, the generalization ability of the navigation controller is effectively improved, and the navigation efficiency of the unmanned ship in a complex environment is effectively improved.

column12: Screen-free glucometer adopting SIM (Subscriber Identity Module) card as communication medium
column13: The utility model relates to a glucometer, in particular to a glucometer without a screen and adopting an SIM (Subscriber Identity Module) card as a communication medium. The blood glucose meter comprises a blood glucose meter body, a test paper collecting box is arranged at the top of the blood glucose meter body, a smashing device is arranged in the test paper collecting box and comprises a plurality of rotating rods, a plurality of blades are arranged on the outer walls of the rotating rods and rotate in the blood glucose meter body in a staggered mode, and connecting cylinders are arranged at the ends of the rotating rods. And the connecting cylinder rotates on the inner wall of the test paper collecting box. Used test paper sheets can be conveniently stored and smashed, cross infection caused by discarding and inconvenience in cleaning due to attachment to a plane are avoided, and an SIM (subscriber identity module) card can be used as a communication medium to transmit and store data.

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR IMPROVEMENTS TO USER EXPERIENCE TESTING
column13: Systems and methods for transcription analysis of a recording are provided. The recording includes an audio and screenshot/video portion. The audio portion is transcribed using a machine learned model. Models may be selected by the recording quality and potentially accents or other speech patterns that are present. The transcription is then linked to the video/screen capture chronology, so that automatic scrolling is enabled, clip selection from the transcription, and searching to a video time is possible. There is improvements to user experience question generation, review of study results, and in managing the study participants.

column12: Doe-based two-stroke spark ignition type aviation kerosene engine knock suppression method
column13: The invention discloses a Doe-based two-stroke spark-ignition type aviation kerosene engine knock suppression method, which comprises the following steps of: obtaining a structure size required in one-dimensional simulation according to a three-dimensional model of an engine, building a GT-Power one-dimensional model through engine construction, and checking the GT-Power one-dimensional model; acquiring the knock intensity under the conditions of no knock, slight knock and heavy knock by using test data to obtain a threshold value when the test engine is slightly knocked, and enabling the checked knock index of the one-dimensional model to correspond to the knock intensity obtained by the test; according to the method, engine knock prediction is carried out under all working conditions by utilizing a one-dimensional model, control parameters are optimized through a DoE method, optimal oil injection-ignition control parameters are obtained by modifying the working conditions and the optimization range of the control parameters for multiple times, engine power is optimized through the DoE method, and the engine knock prediction efficiency is improved. The method reduces the time loss caused by the repeated searching of the optimal working condition point of the engine through a test method, and improves the calibration efficiency of the engine pedestal.
column32: 刘畅一: "《二冲程煤油发动机爆震识别与抑制策略的研究》", 《中国优秀硕士学位论文全文数据库 工程科技II辑》;;胡晓生 等: "《关键参数对二冲程煤油发动机爆震的影响》", 《航空动力学报》

column12: Rigidity evaluation method and device for front bumper mask of passenger car
column13: The invention relates to a passenger car front bumper mask rigidity evaluation method and device. Comprising the steps that firstly, the position of a tangent point P1 is determined according to the longitudinal axis L1 of a vehicle, the outer contour line L2 of the vertical projection of a front bumper mask and a straight line L3; 2, determining a straight line L4 which passes through the point P1 and is parallel to the longitudinal axis L1 of the vehicle according to the position of the P1; 3, according to the L4, determining a plane S1 which passes through the straight line L4 and is parallel to the longitudinal plane of the vehicle; 4, determining an intersection line C1 of the plane S1 and the front bumper mask according to the S1 and the front bumper mask; 5, determining a rigidity evaluation area of the front bumper mask according to the intersecting lines C1 and C2; and 6, applying pressure to the rigidity evaluation area of the front bumper mask, and evaluating the rigidity deformation of the front bumper mask. According to the method, the rigidity of the front bumper mask is evaluated in the data design stage, so that the bearable rigidity deformation of the real front bumper mask is pre-judged and evaluated, and the obvious or unacceptable soft phenomenon is avoided.

column12: EUV In-Situ Linearity Calibration for TDI Image Sensors Using Test Photomasks
column13: To calibrate a TDI photomask inspection tool, a photomask with a plurality of distinctly patterned regions is loaded into the tool. The plurality of distinctly patterned regions is successively illuminated with an EUV beam of light. While illuminating respective distinctly patterned regions, respective instances of imaging of the respective distinctly patterned regions are performed using a TDI sensor in the inspection tool. While performing the respective instances of imaging, a reference intensity detector is used to measure reference intensities of EUV light collected from the photomask. Based on the results of the respective instances of imaging and the measured reference intensities of EUV light, linearity of the TDI sensor is determined.
column32: Nakajima, Y. et al., "Effective-exposure-dose monitoring technique in EUV lithography," Proc. column12: The mechanical sealing element simulates real working condition to use testing device
column13: The utility model discloses a testing device for simulating a real working condition to use a mechanical sealing element. Workbench, the left side of the top of the workbench is fixedly connected witha fixing frame. A top plate is fixedly connected to the top of the fixing frame, an air cylinder is arranged at the top of the top plate, clamping plates are arranged on the front side and the rear side of the top of the workbench, driving mechanisms are arranged on the front side and the rear side of an inner cavity of the workbench, each driving mechanism comprises a motor, and the right side of each motor is fixedly connected with the right side of the inner cavity of the workbench. The workbench, the fixing frame, the top plate, the air cylinder, the clamping plate, the driving mechanism,the stamping plate, the moving rod, the sliding sleeve and the sliding column are arranged and matched with one another; the mechanical sealing element testing device is simple in structure and convenient to use, mechanical sealing elements of different sizes can be fixed, meanwhile, displacement of the mechanical sealing elements is avoided, the pressure resistance of the mechanical sealing elements can be tested, and test data of the mechanical sealing elements are not affected.
column14: JIANGSU FEIJIA FLUID TECH CO LTD

column12: Plant feature detection using captured images
column13: Described are methods for identifying the in-field positions of plant features on a plant by plant basis. These positions are determined based on images captured as a vehicle (e.g., tractor, sprayer, etc.) including one or more cameras travels through the field along a row of crops. The in-field positions of the plant features are useful for a variety of purposes including, for example, generating three-dimensional data models of plants growing in the field, assessing plant growth and phenotypic features, determining what kinds of treatments to apply including both where to apply the treatments and how much, determining whether to remove weeds or other undesirable plants, and so on.
column32: United States Office Action, U.S. Appl. No. 15/407,644, dated Oct. 18, 2018, 44 pages.

column12: DYNAMIC RANDOM ACCESS MEMORY BUILT-IN SELF-TEST POWER FAIL MITIGATION
column13: Self-test and repair of memory cells is performed in a memory integrated circuit by two separate processes initiated by a memory controller communicatively coupled to the memory integrated circuit. To ensure that the repair process is completed in the event of an unexpected power failure, a first process is initiated by the memory controller to perform a memory Built-in Self Test (mBIST) in the memory integrated circuit and a second process is initiated by the memory controller after the mBIST has completed to perform repair of faulty memory cells detected during the MBIST process. The memory controller does not initiate the repair process if a power failure has been detected. In addition, a repair time associated with the repair process is selected such that the repair time is sufficient to complete the repair process while power is stable, if a power failure occurs after the repair process has been started.

column12: System and method for automatically testing static work of chip
column13: The invention relates to a chip static work automatic test system and method. The test system comprises a control processor, a power supply feedback control system and a software defined clock system. The power supply feedback control system comprises a power supply circuit used for outputting voltage and current to a tested chip, and a monitoring function circuit used for monitoring impedance, voltage and current of the tested chip and feeding back the impedance, voltage and current to the control processor. The software-defined clock system is used for outputting a clock signal to the tested chip; and the control processor is used for configuring the power supply circuit, the monitoring function circuit and the software defined clock system and receiving data fed back by the monitoring function circuit. The test system can replace a traditional exchange chip test platform, does not need to use test instruments such as a signal generator, a direct-current power supply analyzer and a universal meter, and has the advantages of being easy to configure, simple to operate, low in cost and the like.
column14: WELL CORE MICROELECTRONIC TECH TIANJIN LIMITED COMPANY
column15: ZHU KE;;WANG YONGSHENG;;WANG PAN;;LIU CHANGJIANG;;MAO YINGJIE

column12: Infrared and visible light image fusion method based on visual enhancement
column13: The invention discloses an infrared and visible light image fusion method based on visual enhancement, and relates to the technical field of image classification. The method comprises the following steps: step 1, constructing an auto-encoder, and training the auto-encoder; step 2, obtaining a training set of an enhanced network; 3, constructing an enhancement network, and training the enhancement network to obtain a trained enhancement network model; 4, obtaining a training set and a test set of the fusion network; 5, constructing a fusion network, and training the fusion network to obtain a trained fusion network model; and step 6, testing the trained fusion network model obtained in the step 5 by using test data in the test set of the fusion network to obtain a fusion image. The fusion image of the infrared image and the visible light image under the low-light background obtained by the image fusion method can obtain more texture details, richer edge information and better overall brightness.

column12: Self adapting iterative read calibration to retrieve data from memory cells
column13: A memory sub-system configured to iterative calibrate read voltages, where higher read voltages are calibrated based on the calibration results of lower read voltages. For example, a memory device initially determines first read voltages of a group of memory cells. The memory device calculates a second read voltage optimized to read the group of memory cells according to first signal and noise characteristics measured based on at least one of the first read voltages. A third read voltage is estimated based on an offset of the second read voltage from a corresponding voltage among the first read voltages. Second signal and noise characteristics of the group of memory cells are measured based on the third read voltage. The memory device then calculates a fourth read voltage optimized to read the group of memory cells according to the second signal and noise characteristics.
column15: ALHUSSIEN ABDELHAKIM S;;PARTHASARATHY SIVAGNANAM;;FITZPATRICK JAMES;;KHAYAT PATRICK ROBERT

column12: QR METHOD FOR ENHANCING SECURITY OF QR CODE USING PROOF-OF-WORK USER TERMINAL AND AFFILIATE TERMINAL USING THE SAME
column13: The present invention relates to a method for enhancing the security of a QR code using a proof-of-work technology, and a user terminal and a member store terminal using the same. According to the present invention, the method for enhancing the security of the QR code using the proof-of-work technology comprises: (a) a step in which, when QR code information is acquired, the user terminal acquires member store information for an issuing member store who has issued the QR code from the QR code information; (b) a step in which the user terminal transmits a proof-of-work request including a specific random number generated by using a certain algorithm, a difficulty condition for the proof-of-work set in the user terminal, and information on a specific hash algorithm for the proof-of-work to a member store terminal of the issuing member store by referring to the member store information, the member store terminal performs the proof-of-work using the specific hash algorithm by using test data combining the specific random number and a random nonce value, and when the proof-of-work is completed, the member store terminal is supported to transmit the specific nonce value used for the completed proof-of-work to the user terminal; and (c) a step in which the user terminal generates data for verification by using the specific random number generated by using the specific nonce value transmitted from the member store terminal and the certain algorithm, and verifies if the results of hashing the data for verification by the specific hash algorithm meet the difficulty condition for the proof-of-work, so that if the results meet the difficulty condition for the proof-of-work, the user terminal confirms the QR code as the authentic one, and if the results do not meet the difficulty condition for the proof-of-work, confirms the QR code as not the authentic one.
column15: YANG HEE SUN;;OH JUN TAEK;;ROH KWANG SEOK;;JIN MIN SIK;;JUNG DAE KYU

column12: Target deformation acquisition method for vehicle door metal plate pre-bending
column13: The invention discloses a vehicle door metal plate pre-bending target deformation acquisition method. The method comprises the following steps: establishing a three-dimensional original model of a vehicle door; obtaining the sealing deformation of each point on the metal plate structure in the Y direction of the vehicle due to the counter-acting force of the sealing rubber strip; the pressure difference deformation of each point on the metal plate structure in the Y direction of the automobile due to the internal and external pressure difference of the automobile is obtained; and the maximum value in the sealing deformation is the maximum sealing deformation, the maximum value in the pressure difference deformation is the maximum pressure difference deformation, and the deformation of each point on the metal plate structure corresponding to the larger one of the sealing deformation and the pressure difference deformation serves as the pre-bending target deformation. During the pre-bending design, the counter-acting force of the sealing strip and the deformation condition of the metal plate structure of the vehicle door under the high-speed wind load condition of the vehicle are comprehensively considered, and the metal plate structure with large deformation is taken as the pre-bending design input, so that the pre-bending data design of the metal plate structure is more reasonable, and the sealing performance of the vehicle door is improved.
column15: CHEN QUANXIN;;WANG RUOMAN;;QIN YUJUN;;LI YANLONG;;HU YANGJUN

column12: Method for manufacturing circuit board with air guide plate special for hole plugging printing instead of white paper for hole plugging
column13: The invention discloses a method for manufacturing a circuit board with an air guide plate special for hole plugging printing instead of white paper for hole plugging. The method sequentially comprises the following procedures of engineering data design, cutting, board drying, inner layer circuit processing, press fit, one-time drilling, chemical copper deposition, whole board electroplating, outer layer circuit processing, pattern electroplating, alkaline etching, AOI inspection, solder mask processing, character processing, forming, electrical testing and finished product inspection. The anti-welding procedure sequentially comprises the following procedures of pretreatment, oil opening, hole plugging, printing, pre-baking, exposure, developing and post-curing; and before the hole plugging procedure, a hole plugging aluminum sheet and a special air guide plate are manufactured firstly, the hole plugging aluminum sheet is redesigned, the special air guide plate is adopted in a matched mode, and white paper does not need to be adopted, so the hole plugging speed is effectively increased, the time for replacing the white paper is saved by using the special air guide plate, the production efficiency is improved, and compared with an existing traditional technological process, the method has the advantage that the quality of the finished product is better guaranteed.

column12: Operation method of labeling pillow bag tracing system for formula granules
column13: The invention discloses an operation method of a labeling pillow bag tracing system for formula granules. According to the invention, qualified small bags are manually stacked and put into grids of a feeding belt of a pillow packaging machine, and a small package bar code rechecking scanner scans the last two-dimensional code or any small package two-dimensional code of the small package through a packaging film for rechecking before a three-level code pre-printing labeling machine is pasted; when the scanner does not scan the two-dimensional code or the scanned two-dimensional code is not the two-dimensional code in the five small parcels, the system can automatically identify the two-dimensional code, and the removing system can automatically remove the two-dimensional code; the anti-counterfeiting and anti-fleeing functions that market inspectors can scan any small bag, small parcel, medium parcel and large box to find out the authenticity of the product, the place to which the product is sent, the time to produce the product, which team personnel produce the product and the like can be realized; and consumers can browse corresponding market promotion data designed by our market personnel by scanning the two-dimensional codes on the products with any packaging specifications.

column12: POINT-OF-CARE BLOOD ANALYSIS SYSTEM
column13: The present disclosure relates to a point-of-care blood analysis system, specifically to the disposable, single-use test cartridges used in such a system. The test cartridge is inexpensive and simple to use because it contains neither a calibration fluid pack nor a separate sensor substrate. The test cartridge accepts a whole blood sample and then separates plasma from a portion of that whole blood sample. The test cartridge has broad application because it allows analytes in both the whole blood and the separated plasma to be measured using both fluorescent sensors and cuvettes.

column12: Video weak supervision anomaly detection system and method based on confrontation and attention combined mechanism
column13: The invention discloses a video weak supervision anomaly detection system and method based on a confrontation and attention combined mechanism. The method comprises the following steps: carrying out the preprocessing of a training video, and obtaining video features including normal video features and abnormal video features; the abnormal video features are confronted through an FGSM algorithm, confrontation samples are obtained, for each abnormal video feature, when the confrontation samples are misclassified by the classification network, the confrontation samples are stopped, otherwise, the confrontation samples are iterated to a set value, then the confrontation samples and video features including the abnormal video features and normal video features are sent to an abnormal scoring module for training, and a trained model is obtained; adopting a loss function for constraint in the training process; and performing performance evaluation on the trained model by using test data to complete video weak supervision anomaly detection. In the invention, a plurality of instances are selected in combination with an attention mechanism, the attention on abnormal fragments is increased, and an adversarial sample is added in the invention, so that the network is more robust.

column12: Rotating hub test system
column13: The invention provides a rotating hub test system, and the system is characterized in that a rotating hub test vehicle transmits a pedal signal of a former rotating hub test based on an OBD interface,and only receives an accelerator pedal position signal from a CAN receiving and transmitting processor; a CAN transceiver processor receives a pedal signal of a previous hub test, constructs and stores a one-dimensional change array related to accelerator pedal parameters based on the pedal signal, and sends elements in the one-dimensional change array in sequence according to a predetermined period; each element of the one-dimensional change array is an ASCII code of an accelerator pedal parameter obtained by sampling a pedal signal of a previous hub test in a predetermined period; manual operation is digitized, previous driving operation is fitted in the whole process, interference, introduced by human factors, on test result analysis is reduced to the maximum extent, and data comparability is improved; meanwhile, software is convenient to use, test results are compared and analyzed in a instrumentalized mode, and the vehicle calibration parameter optimization efficiency is improved.

column12: Intelligent thrust prediction and real-time early warning method for aero-engine
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of aero-engine thrust prediction, and particularly relates to an intelligent thrust prediction and real-time early warning method for an aero-engine. According to the specific technical scheme, the method comprises the following steps: clustering test parameter characteristics of the aero-engine according to measurement parts and systems; performing feature selection on the clustering parameters; establishing a component and system sub-network; connecting the component and the system sub-network according to the actual working matching relation of the aero-engine; adding a feature mapping network at the final output end of the aero-engine digital engineering model; and training the network model by using test data generated in the test process of the aero-engine to obtain a real-time thrust prediction model and a reference thrust prediction model. A physical architecture of the aero-engine is fused into intelligent network design, efficient fusion of multiple systems in a digital space can be achieved, the performance of the aero-engine is tightly tracked by a digital model, individualized differences are reflected, and therefore the thrust performance of the engine is accurately tracked.
column15: YU AIYANG;;XIAO HONG;;TANG KE;;XIAO DASHENG;;WANG DONGHUAN

column12: Interventional instrument in-vitro simulation training system
column13: The utility model relates to an interventional instrument in-vitro simulation training system, and the system comprises a blood vessel simulation device which comprises a blood vessel model and a supply module for providing blood for the blood vessel model; the approach guiding device is used for guiding an interventional instrument to a target position of the blood vessel model; the sensor is arranged on the inner wall of the blood vessel model to monitor and output monitoring information; the in-vivo environment simulation device is used for controlling the blood vessel simulation device to accord with preset state information; and the control device is electrically connected with the blood vessel simulation device, the approach guiding device, the sensor and the in-vivo environment simulation device and is used for performing operation control. By building a human body complex blood vessel model, the simulation use test of various interventional instruments can be realized, and the real use condition of the instruments can be evaluated.

column12: METHOD FOR DETECTING CAN BUS INTRUSION OF VEHICLE-MOUNTED NETWORK BASED ON GMM-HMM AND SYSTEM
column13: The present disclosure provides a method for detecting controller area network (CAN) bus intrusion of a vehicle-mounted network based on a Gaussian mixture model-hidden Markov model (GMM-HMM), including the following steps: obtaining a normal packet of a CAN bus of a vehicle-mounted network, and counting cycles of all packets of each CAN ID based on a time sequence, that is, a time difference between two frames of packets of a same CAN ID, to form a cycle sequence as an input of an algorithm; dividing the cycle sequence of each CAN ID into a fixed length based on the algorithm, and then training a GMM-HMM for each CAN ID to obtain a likelihood probability of a normal cycle sequence; and further counting a cycle sequence of each CAN ID for a tested packet sequence, calculating, after the cycle sequence is input a model, a likelihood probability of generating the sequence, and determining whether the packet sequence is abnormal by comparing the likelihood probability with a threshold of the likelihood probability obtained in the previous step. In the present disclosure, anomaly detection of a packet cycle of a CAN bus is implemented, such that attack behaviors of inserting packets into the bus such as DoS, blur, and replay can be detected.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR NETWORK AND SERVICE CONTROLLED HYBRID ACCESS
Brand-new manufacturing method of backlight plate
column13: The invention relates to a brand-new manufacturing method of a backlight plate, which is a backlight plate manufacturing method for manufacturing PP holes after AOI and forming procedures, and comprises the following steps: cutting: selecting or preparing a thick double-sided copper-clad plate with the copper thickness of 3/HOZ, and cutting the copper-clad plate into a PNL plate with the required size according to the design size of a product; circuit pattern: carrying out film pasting on the upper surface and the lower surface of the thick double-sided copper-clad plate respectively, conducting exposure through data design and a film, and manufacturing a circuit pattern; etching treatment: synchronously etching the thick double-sided copper-clad plate subjected to circuit pattern manufacturing through developing and etching processes to manufacture an isolation groove, etching to form a cup opening window and a V-CUT line, carrying out AOI and forming procedures sequentially, and screening out unqualified products; PP hole manufacturing: conducting mounting hole manufacturing on the screened qualified products, and manufacturing PP holes in PP from top to bottom; and carrying out post-process treatment. The brand-new manufacturing method of the backlight plate has the advantages of low manufacturing difficulty, low cost, high production efficiency, high product quality and the like.

column12: ELEVATOR MONITORING DEVICE WITH VARYING WIRELESS TRANSMISSION POWER BASED ON ELEVATOR CAR POSITION
column13: An illustrative example embodiment of a device for communicating information regarding an elevator car that moves along a vertical path includes at least one sensing portion configured to be supported on the elevator car and to sense (54) at least one characteristic of the elevator car. A transmitter is configured to transmit a wirelessly communicated output indicating at least one condition based on the sensed characteristic. The transmitter is configured to use a first transmit power (60) when the device is at a first location along the vertical path (58) and to use a second, different transmit power (64) when the device is at a second, different location along the vertical path (62).

column12: Aviation multi-mode converged communication system test method
column13: The invention provides an aviation multi-mode converged communication system test method. Used test equipment comprises an aviation multimode communication terminal, aviation multimode communication terminal ground control equipment, a J30J-9TJL low-frequency power supply test cable, a J30J-37TJL low-frequency signal test cable, seven airborne antennas, three ground antennas, 17 radio frequency extension lines, a 28V stabilized voltage supply, an upper computer test notebook computer and ADS-B receiving equipment. The test comprises a power supply test, a flight control downlink information test and a flight control uplink information test; the invention provides an aviation multi-mode converged communication system test method, which is used for testing the interface adaptability, the data transmission communication function, the 5G public network communication function, the Beidou short message communication function, the differential RTK navigation communication function, the ADS-B aviation comprehensive monitoring function and other functions of an aviation multi-mode communication terminal, and has the advantages of convenience, high efficiency, low cost and the like.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR TESTING OF WORKFLOW APPLICATION BASED ON BUSINESS PROCESS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
column13: The present invention relates to an improved method and system for testing a workflow application which is developed based on a business process management system. The method comprises retrieving a user specification input and a plurality of palettes and associated properties (100); generating an orthogonal array template (101); generating a workflow model (102); establishing a first optimization module and a second optimization module (103); generating a set of workflows and associated deployable files (104); generating a set of test scenarios and associated test steps (105); providing rules pertaining to prioritization and probable outcomes (106); performing an execution of the set of test scenarios using test data and the rules on a system under test (107); and collecting test metrics and test execution results of the execution (108). The system comprises a decision support unit (200), a palette specification database (201), a test optimization agent (202), a test engine (203) comprising a test workflow generator (203a), a test scenario generator (203b) and a test execution engine (203c), a configuration controller (204), a report analyzer (205) and a dashboard application (206). column12: Test strip for rapidly detecting toxoplasma gondii IgG in human blood
column13: The utility model discloses a test strip for rapidly detecting toxoplasma gondii IgG (immunoglobulin G) in human blood, relates to detection equipment, and solves the problem that the test result is influenced due to irregular diffusion caused by the fact that samples cannot be concentrated by the currently used test strip, and the key points of the technical scheme are as follows: the test strip comprises a main body substrate, the main body substrate is divided into a non-adsorptive part and an adsorbable part, the adsorbable part on the main body substrate is provided with a drip area, a wetting area and a main runner, the drip area is located at one end of the main body substrate, the wetting area is located in the other end of the main body substrate, and a gap is reserved between the wetting area and the other end of the main body substrate; the infusion area and the wetting area are communicated through the main runner, the end, close to the infusion area, of the main body substrate is connected with the connecting membrane, the tail end of the connecting membrane extends to one side of the wetting area, the accuracy of detection data can be improved, and the use process is simple and direct.

column12: LASER SCANNING MICROSCOPE AND METHOD FOR ADJUSTING A LASER SCANNING MICROSCOPE
column13: A laser scanning microscope and method for adjusting a laser scanning microscope. The microscope has an optical system which has a light guiding fiber between the first light source and the third beam deflection unit and has no light guiding fibers between the second light source and the third beam deflection unit. In this way, the second light source can be used as an adjustment reference for the first and second beam deflection units. The adjustment can be implemented using test images recorded by means of the third and fourth beam deflection units; additional sensors or internal calibration samples are not required.

column12: Automated extraction of isolated nodes during source code refactoring
column13: Disclosed are various embodiments for the extraction of isolated nodes during source code refactoring. A graph model representative of a computing application is generated having nodes and bridges that connect some nodes to other nodes. An application component corresponding to a selected one of the nodes may be extracted from the computing application. An independently deployable component of the computing application may be generated and deployed on a network service such that the independently deployable component is accessible through a network-based call.

column12: Test bundling and batching optimizations
column13: Test bundling and batching by a test execution framework may be customized in accordance with test suite requirements for testing platform implementations on network-connected, resource-limited devices. Tests, test data and test results may be communicated in bundles or batches. Multiple tests may be bundled into a test application bundle and communicated over a single data connection. Test data for the tests in a bundle may be packaged into a single batch and transferred using a single data connection. Similarly, results from executing the tests in a test application bundle may be batched and transferred together over a single connection. Additionally, a custom user interface may be utilized to allow for customizing the test bundling policy for individual test suites. Providing the ability for a user to customize the test bundling policy may significantly reduce the number of data connections required during test suite execution.

column12: Channel estimation in communications
column13: A method is provided for channel estimation of an antenna array comprising multiple antenna elements. The method comprises obtaining channel state information for antenna elements with a high-end radio frequency chain, wherein the antenna elements with the high-end radio frequency chain are placed in the antenna array intermittently with antenna elements with a low-cost radio frequency chain. Channel state information is estimated for the antenna elements with the low-cost radio frequency chain, by interpolating the channel state information obtained for the antenna elements with the high-end radio frequency chain.

column12: MEMORY SYSTEM TESTER USING TEST PAD REAL TIME MONITORING
column13: A variety of applications can include systems and methods that include a memory system tester having an analyzer coupled to a test flow controller. The test flow controller can be arranged to generate test signals to a memory system with the analyzer arranged to couple to test pads of a package platform for the memory system. The analyzer can provide data to the test flow controller to conduct testing and/or debugging of the memory system, with the data based on real time monitoring of the test pads of the package platform. In various embodiments, the analyzer can provide data feedback to the test flow controller in real time such that the test flow controller can control the flow of test signals to the memory system in real time. Additional apparatus, systems, and methods are disclosed.

column12: System for full-automatic online detection of blue absorption amount of molding sand
column13: The invention provides a system for full-automatic online detection of the blue absorption amount of molding sand, and relates to the technical field of foundry molding sand treatment. The system comprises a material conveying and feeding module, a material weighing and taking module, a detection liquid processing module, a heating processing module, a dropwise adding and dyeing module, a determination output module and a PLC data processing module, and the material conveying and feeding module, the material weighing and taking module, the detection liquid processing module and the heating processing module are sequentially connected. The device is used for carrying out standard sampling and electronic weighing on the placed molding sand, then carrying out detection liquid detection and heating treatment on the weighed molding sand, and providing basic conditions for subsequent dropwise adding and dyeing. Through the dropwise adding dyeing module and the measuring output module, the accuracy of the testing result of the blue absorption amount of the molding sand is higher, the detection process is more time-saving and labor-saving, meanwhile, the used testing device is convenient to operate and low in price, resources are effectively saved through the recycling processing module, and the molding sand resource utilization rate is increased.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR DETECTING TARGET COMPONENTS BY UTILIZING MOBILE TERMINAL
column13: A method and system for detecting a target component by using a mobile terminal, and a detection method for simultaneously screening multiple target objects. The method for detecting a target component by using a mobile terminal comprises: detecting a target component by using test strips (100) to obtain chromogenic test strips (100); arranging the test strips (100) around a same circle center at equal angles to obtain an arrangement ring of test strips (100), positioning identifiers being provided on an area outside the test strips (100) on the arrangement ring of the test strips (100); performing image acquisition on the arrangement ring of the test strips (100) by using a mobile terminal, and uploading an acquired image to a data processing center, correcting the acquired image according to the positioning identifiers; determining the positions of a personalized mark area and a result display area of each test strip (100) in the image; performing segmentation to obtain images of the personalized mark area and the result display area of each test strip (100); calculating a chromogenic result of the result display area, and obtaining a test result of the target component; and outputting the test result of the target component and displaying the test result on the mobile terminal.

column12: Unified characterization method for subgrade soil multi-type shear curves under complex conditions
column13: The invention discloses a uniform characterization method for subgrade soil multi-type shear curves under complex conditions, which comprises the following steps: designing a subgrade soil monotonic loading test scheme which can fully cover subgrade soil and possibly considers moisture content, compactness, confining pressure and shear rate, and obtaining the shear curves of the subgrade soil under different working conditions through tests; determining the influence characteristics of each factor on the roadbed soil shear curve; based on the shear curves under different working conditions, a mathematical model capable of uniformly describing three types of shear curves of strain hardening, strain stability and strain softening of roadbed soil under complex conditions is provided; fitting the established mathematical model by using test data under different working conditions to obtain model parameters under different working conditions, and establishing a multivariate and multiform function relationship between the model parameters and the water content, the compaction degree, the confining pressure and the shearing rate; through the established mathematical model and multivariate function relationship, different types of shear curves of roadbed soil under complex conditions are represented, and the calculation efficiency and convergence are improved.

column12: Infrared and visible light image fusion method based on low-light illumination and adaptive constraint
column13: The invention provides an infrared and visible light image fusion method based on low-light illumination and adaptive constraint, and relates to the technical field of image enhancement and image fusion, and the method comprises the following steps: 1, obtaining a training set of an illumination scene discrimination network; 2, constructing an illumination scene discrimination network, and training the illumination scene discrimination network to obtain a trained illumination scene discrimination network model; step 3, obtaining a training set of the enhanced network; 4, constructing an enhancement network, and training the enhancement network to obtain a trained enhancement network model; step 5, obtaining a training set and a test set of the fusion network; step 6, constructing a fusion network, and training the fusion network to obtain a trained fusion network model; and 7, testing the trained fusion network model obtained in the step 6 by using test data in the training set of the fusion network to obtain a fusion image. The fusion image of the infrared image and the visible light image under the low light background obtained by the image fusion method can obtain more prominent target information, richer texture details and better visual perception.

column12: Research method for searching optimal milling parameter based on multi-feature fusion model
column13: The invention relates to a research method for searching an optimal milling parameter based on a multi-feature fusion model. The method comprises the steps: formulating milling tests of different milling parameters, and building a milling temperature and milling force synchronous test system; measuring time domain signals of the milling temperature and the three-way milling force near the tip of the milling cutter, and extracting a milling temperature mean value and a milling force root-mean-square value from the time domain signals of the milling temperature and the three-way milling force by the milling temperature and milling force synchronous test system; solving and optimizing the multi-feature fusion model through a particle swarm optimization algorithm to obtain an optimal milling parameter, namely establishing a multi-feature fusion model which takes a milling temperature mean value, a milling force root mean square and a metal removal rate as target feature variables and takes the milling parameter as an optimized parameter based on test data; and then solving specific milling parameters in the multi-feature fusion model based on a particle swarm optimization algorithm, so that an optimal milling parameter solution in a used test parameter range is obtained.

column12: Test paper storage equipment for microbiological detection
column13: The utility model relates to the technical field of microbiological detection, in particular to microbiological detection test paper storage equipment which comprises a storage box main body, a placing plate is fixedly connected to the inner side wall of the storage box main body, a second sliding groove is formed in the top of the placing plate, and a second sliding block is movably connected to the inner wall of the second sliding groove. A placing frame is fixedly connected to the top of the second sliding block, a transverse plate is fixedly connected to the inner side wall of the placing frame, and an ultraviolet lamp is fixedly connected to the inner top wall of the storage box body. According to the test paper storage equipment for microbiological detection, through the storage box body, the movable cover, the storage vessel, the first sliding groove, the first sliding block, a movable plate, a partition plate, a first box door, a first magnet and a second magnet, unused test paper and used test paper can be stored in a classified mode in the test paper storage process; the phenomenon of pollution caused by random placement of the test paper after microorganism detection is avoided, so that the accuracy of microorganism detection data is guaranteed.

column12: Outer covering part product A face virtual coloring forming design and drawing die debugging method
column13: The invention discloses an outer covering part product A face virtual coloring forming design and drawing die debugging method, the position of a reserved balance table of a process supplementary molded surface and the flatness of the molded surface are considered in the stamping process design stage, and in the machining data design stage, a grinding and repairing balance table is arranged on the product process supplementary molded surface according to the balance, and the grinding and repairing balance table is arranged on the product process supplementary molded surface. In the drawing die debugging stage, a debugging bench worker makes a balance table according to a coloring diagram, and it is guaranteed that the die assembly gap of the drawing die is uniform; after grinding and repairing, the profile of the balancing platform is re-colored, the precision of the profile is less than or equal to 0.02 mm, and the height difference Tmax-Tmin of the die assembly gap of the surface A of the drawing punch-die product of the outer covering part is less than or equal to 0.03 mm; finally, the die assembly gap of the molded surfaces of the A-face areas of the drawing male die and the drawing female die gradually tends to be one time of the material thickness, and it is regarded that the virtual coloring forming drawing die is adjusted to be qualified; according to the method, after an early-stage product A surface virtual coloring forming design, a given debugging and repairing area is clearly defined, a later-stage mold production debugging thought is single, and a debugging stage result is obvious and direct; and the debugging period of the drawing die is shortened.

column12: Test system for cathode circuit of fuel cell
column13: A test system for a fuel cell cathode circuit comprises: a cathode chamber assembly comprising a cathode simulation chamber and a first electric control valve; the input end of the second electric control valve is used for being connected with the humidity outlet end of the humidifier; the input end of the first valve is used for being connected with the dry inlet end of the humidifier; the first cooling device is used for cooling the air compressor; the second cooling device is used for cooling the intercooler; the sensor assembly is used for detecting pressure, temperature and flow in the test system; and the controller is used for controlling the test system to work. According to the fuel cell cathode circuit testing system, testing can be carried out without connecting the cathode circuit with a fuel cell system, the portability and safety of testing are greatly improved, meanwhile, testing of various fuel cell cathode circuits can be achieved through one set of testing system, and in addition, the fuel cell cathode circuit testing system is an integral testing system and is convenient to use. Testing of equipment in the whole fuel cell cathode circuit can be completed at a time, and the testing efficiency is further improved.

column12: Method for checking safety of electric vehicle with quickly-replaceable power battery
column13: The invention relates to a method for checking the safety of an electric vehicle with a quickly-replaceable power battery. The method comprises two aspects: 1, checking a whole vehicle, namely, quickly replacing a power battery, driving the vehicle and performing water prevention on the vehicle, so as to check the basic conformity of the electric vehicle with the quickly-replaceable power batteryin the aspect of safety; and 2, checking components, namely, simulating the real installation environment of components such as a battery replacement interface and a battery replacement mechanism on the electric vehicle, simulating load influence of vehicle driving on the components by using test equipment in a test room, so as to directly check the safety of the battery replacement interface andthe battery replacement mechanism.

column12: Immunochromatography detection device capable of being used repeatedly
column13: The utility model discloses an immunochromatography detection device capable of being used for multiple times. The immunochromatography detection device comprises a shell and a sample adding port, the releasing column is rotatable and is used for fixing the test strip; the furling column can rotate and is used for replacing and storing the test strip; the auxiliary wheel is arranged between the unwinding column and the winding column and is in contact with the lower surface of the test strip; and the roller cantilever mechanism is movably connected to the shell and elastically presses and holds the test strip towards the direction of the auxiliary wheel. A vertical reel type test paper roll structure is adopted, the size is small, a large amount of test paper is stored, and the detection efficiency is improved; the used test strip is convenient to process; consumables of the sample adding port sleeve can be replaced, so that the detection accuracy is improved; a detection result is automatically shot through the micro camera, the shooting result is transmitted to the cloud, data stored in the cloud are compared, the result is stored and output, the detection efficiency is improved, and the user experience feeling is optimized; a cutting knife is designed on the shell and can cut off and open a water absorption layer between the test paper, so that the pollution problem caused by reverse flow of the reagent is prevented.

column12: Field test device for vertical permeation of vadose zone
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of underground water environmental influence evaluation and hydrogeology field test, in particular to an aeration zone vertical penetration field test device which comprises a support device, a volumetric flask, an inner ring water inlet pipe, an outer ring water inlet pipe and a liquid level control device. The bracket device is arranged on the ground; the volumetric flask is movably arranged on the bracket device; the upper end of the inner ring water inlet pipe is arranged in the volumetric flask, and the lower end extends into the bracket device; one end of the outer ring water inlet pipe is connected with the water storage container, and the other end extends into the bracket device; and the liquid level control devices are respectively arranged in the inner ring water inlet pipe and the outer ring water inlet pipe. The device is simple in structure and convenient to assemble and use, test operation can be carried out by a single person, the test process is smooth, and the working efficiency is greatly improved; unmanned interference can be realized, the liquid level can be automatically adjusted, the water level control in the test process is more accurate, and the test result is more reliable; test data is high in accuracy, and the support device is arranged, so that the structure is more stable.

column12: Road surface profiler, road surface profiler performance measuring instrument, and method for assessing performance of same road surface profiler by using same measuring instrument
column13: Provided according to the present invention is a road surface profiler performance measuring instrument, which implements a virtual road surface state in order to assess the performance of a road surface profiler (A) including a distance measurement unit (10) and a flatness measurement unit (20), the measuring instrument comprising: a travel operation unit (100) for augmenting movement distance information (a) generated by the distance measurement unit (10); and a height adjustment unit (200) for changing height information (b) generated by the flatness measurement unit (20).

column12: RF signal system outputs calibration
column13: A method of calibrating a test platform with a plurality of system outputs to align radio frequency signals generated by the system outputs, comprising detecting power of a combined signal from a reference signal and a test signal 410 each generated by respective system outputs. The phase of the test signal is shifted iteratively relative to the reference signal until the detected power reaches a minimum 420 and the test signal is inverted to be in phase with the reference signal 430 when the combined power reaches the minimum. The test platform may be a Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) simulator. The method may be rerun using test signals generated by other test system outputs in the plurality of system outputs. The invention allows for multiple clock signals and resultant test signals to be correctly synchronized with respect to one another.

column12: Touch sensitive system and method for cognitive and behavioral testing and evaluation
column13: Portable operatively simple touch screen apparatus uses testing methods and systems that are free of age and language constraints include special signal processing techniques that provide a temporal resolution highly sensitive for probing cognitive function. The embodiments include or make use of one or more modules implemented at least partially in a set of instructions in software and configured to measure user reaction times to visual stimulus on a touch screen device having a capacitive sensor touch-sensitive surface and a detector of audio waves resulting from touch on the touch-sensitive surface. The modules employ recordation of acoustic vibrations resulting from a user's touching a target location on the touch screen surface spaced from a touched starting location on that surface, in one embodiment, to measure temporal response to a visual stimulus placed at the target location.

column12: Device for gearbox piston movement resistance test
column13: The utility model discloses a device for a gearbox piston moving resistance test, and relates to a test device. A hollow cavity is formed in the mounting disc, an oil inlet communicated with the hollow cavity is formed in the outer side wall, placing grooves are formed in the two end surfaces, and oil outlets communicated with the hollow cavity are formed in the bottom surfaces of the placing grooves; the placing groove is in interference clamping connection with the piston; the mounting disc ring sleeves the outer side of the supporting column, the two ends of the supporting column are connected with the pressure discs, and the opposite surfaces of the two pressure discs are pressed and attached to the piston; the supporting mechanism is connected with the displacement mechanism, the displacement mechanism is connected with the pressure disc, and a pressure sensor is arranged between the displacement mechanism and the pressure disc; the installation disc is placed on the supporting mechanism, and the end face, away from the pressure sensor, of the installation disc abuts against the supporting mechanism. According to the utility model, a real vehicle use environment and real vehicle use pressure are simulated, test values are read in real time, the whole structure is simple, the pre-use test of the piston is realized, the piston put into use is ensured to meet the use requirements, the whole vehicle performance is improved, and the customer experience feeling is improved.

column12: COMPUTER-IMPLEMENTED TEST ENVIRONMENT, AND METHOD FOR TESTING SOFTWARE COMPONENTS
column13: The invention relates to a computer-implemented test environment (100) and to a method for testing software components which are designed to be ran on a specified target system. Each software component comprises a sequence of multiple program steps which can be chronologically planned, and the duration from when a program step is triggered until the program step has been completely carried out is defined as the response time of the system running the program step, i.e. the target system or test system (10). The test is carried out using a test system (10), on which the software component to be tested is ran using test input data, and using a time model (21) which describes a system state-based relationship between the time behavior of software components when being ran on the target system and the time behavior of said software components when being ran on the test system (10). According to the invention, when a software component to be tested is being ran on the test system (10), at least one test system characteristic is detected which describes the current state of the test system (10). The response time of the target system for the current program step is then estimated while taking into consideration the current state of the test system (10) using the time model, and a corresponding response time is specified for the test system (10).

column12: Near field wireless communication device testing using dual-polarity transducer
column13: Methods and apparatus are disclosed for near field radio-frequency (RF) testing of devices, particularly user equipment (UEs) capable of millimeter-wave (mmWave) transmissions. An exemplary test apparatus is described that uses a transducer to facilitate near field over-the-air testing of UEs in the mmWave transmission band. The transducer may be an orthomode transducer and may include a dual-polarity port positioned in the reactive near field of an antenna of a device under test (DUT). For UE signal transmission tests, the orthomode transducer splits test signals received from the antenna of the DUT via the dual-polarity port into a pair of single-polarity RF signals. The single-polarity RF signals are separately fed through a pair of waveguide-to-coaxial adaptors into separate coaxial cables, which feed coaxial transmission versions of the single-polarity RF signals to test equipment for analysis. UE signal reception tests are also described that utilize the same or different orthomode transducer.

column12: Method of estimating a line width of a nanoparticle line formed using a capillary tube, and related methods
column13: A method of obtaining a numerical model is disclosed. The numerical model correlates estimated line width values to minimum pressure for gas bubble generation (MPGBG) values. An MPGBG value of each capillary tube in the reference group is measured for a liquid. A nanoparticle composition is deposited, under standard conditions, on substrate(s) from each respective reference capillary tube, to form nanoparticle lines. A line width of each of the nanoparticle lines deposited using each respective reference capillary tube is measured by a microscope apparatus. A numerical model that correlates estimated line width values to MPGBG values for the liquid is calculated.

column12: FULLY-AUTOMATIC THROMBOELASTOGRAPHY TESTING DEVICE AND TESTING METHOD
column13: The invention discloses a full-automatic thrombo elastometer device and a test method. Said device comprises a control device, a testing cup-loading device connected to said control device, a test-driving device, a plurality of test passages, a reagent-storing device, a blood sample-loading device and a liquid-adding device, wherein the test-driving device includes a cup-clamping mechanism and a test-driving mechanism connected to the cup-clamping mechanism, the test-driving mechanism drives the cup-clamping mechanism to move to the testing cup-loading device, each test passage, and the liquid-adding device, respectively, so as to complete at least automatically taking a testing cup, and cooperatively carry out removing a cup lid, adding a reagent and a blood sample, and testing blood. Each device being integrated into one housing and two mechanical hands matching with each other in the invention achieves fully automatically detecting the blood coagulation data, and improves test efficiency and test accuracy.

column12: GAS LEAKAGE METER
column13: A gas leakage meter (100) for use onsite in a process plant comprises a housing (110) with an inlet (101), an outlet (102) and an inlet nozzle (111) fluidly connected to a unit to be tested (3) through a downstream connector (1040) and to the inlet (101), the housing (110) being filled with a liquid to a level (10). An inclined pipe (120) is arranged such that, in use, test gas released from the inlet nozzle (111) raises through a liquid and the inclined pipe (120) to a gas-collecting chamber (122) at an upper end of the inclined pipe. (120). The gas-collecting chamber (122) has a gas release valve (150; 170) for releasing test gas before a test period. Embodiments where the inclined pipe (120) is mounted on a pivot and alternative gas release valves (150, 170) are also disclosed.
